loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael G., aged 44 years, is married to Esther and they have two school-aged children. They live in Dandora but the business is located right at the town center. He sells spare parts. He was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing client.

Michael has been in this business for 11 years and earns a profit of KES.50,000. This is his third loan from KADET LTD. He paid his previous loans well and in good time. He intends to add more stock of spare parts such as diffs, axles and shafts.

If the loan boosts his business, he plans to open another spare parts store. Michael is hardworking.

loans.use: To buy more stock of spare parts for sale

loans.name: Dora Maria

texts.es: Dora María Z. L., de treinta y nueve años de edad, reside en municipio de La Libertad departamento de La Libertad, vive en compañía de compañero de vida y tres hijos menores de edad que estudian. Ella vende desde hace mas de 10 años ropa y perfumes por catalogo, además de fantasía fina y ropa casual para hombres y mujeres, todo en su misma casa de habitación, la que cuenta con una ubicación envidiable para ejercer el comercio, además sale a distribuir sus productos a lugares vecinos, siempre a través de la modalidad de agencias de distribución y no casa por casa. Dora solicita crédito para aumentar su inventario de  perfumes, shampos, gel para el cabello y productos de limpieza facial. Dora María es muy conocida en su lugar por persona responsable y trabajadora y desea hacer crecer mas este año su negocio
texts.en:
Dora María Z. L. is 39 years old and lives in the town of La Libertad in the department of La Libertad.  She lives with her common-law husband and three school-aged minor children.  For ten years she has been selling clothing and perfumes by catalogue as well as costume jewelry and casualwear for men and women.  She does this out of her home since she the ideal place there for her business.  She also sells her products in neighboring towns through distribution agencies, not door-to-door.  

Dora is requesting a loan to buy perfume, shampoo, hair gel and facial cleansing products to increase her inventory.  Dora María is well-known in her area because she is very responsible and hard-working.  Her goal for this year is to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy perfume, shampoo, hair gel and facial cleansing products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a wider variety of sweets and beverages as well as ingredients to make "pupusas"

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is married and a mother of two. She operates a restaurant business to earn a living. She has been running her business for 5 years. She dreams of expanding her restaurant into hotel in the future.

Yehu Microfinance has been a blessing to her family. This is because she has been able to educate her children with her previous loans from Yehu Microfinance. She has requested 40,000 KES to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sweets and basic grains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase meat, cold cuts, drinks, and household cleaning products.

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi is a single woman with five school-aged children. She has been running a food-selling stall for the past two years. Previously she sold ground nuts which contributed to her source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit.

She is requesting 25,000Kes to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a restaurant in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Prosperidad Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra en su décimo-quinto ciclo, se llama Prosperidad.
La Sra. Lizza P. tiene 2 hijos y se dedica a vender ropa que trae D. Clorinda, hace bordado D. zapatilla y luego lo venD. en su casa. Vive en Puerto Botánico, ciudad D. Asunción, ella es una mujer muy sacrificada y necesita del crédito para poder realizar mayores compras para su posterior venta, pues al comprar en mayores cantidades consigue precios más reducidos y así aumentar su margen D. ganancias.
texts.en:
This existing committee named “Prosperidad” (Prosperity) is in its fifteenth loan cycle.

Sra. Lizza P. has two children and sells clothing that is brought in from Clorinda. She also decorates shoes and sells them from her home. Lizza lives in Puerto Botánico in the city of Asunción. She is a woman who has maD. many sacrifices and needs this loan so that she can make larger purchases of clothing for later resale. By purchasing in bulk quantities, she is able to continue acquiring merchandise at reduced prices so that she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To purchase shorts, T-shirts, shirts, skirts, sweaters, and other garments in large quantities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy lotion, creams, hair gel and dyes

loans.name: Olpha Kwamboka

texts.en:
Olpha Kwamboka, aged 28, is married to Philip and they have two children. They live in Noonkopir. Olpha runs a retail shop located in Kitengela market, which is a busy market. Most of her customers are females. She earns a monthly profit of KES 5,000. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. She has never borrowed from any other MFI. She has applied for her third loan from KADET LTD and she intends to buy more stock of sugar, maize meal and sweets.

If the loan boosts her business, she plans to start a wholesale shop. Olpha is a hardworking lady.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, floor and sweets for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase corn, lime, and propane gas to make tortillas.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married woman with eight children, three of whom attend school while five are adults. She has been running a clothing store selling Lesos (Kenyan women's attire) for the last 15 years. She always presents new collections to attract more customers to her shop. She cooperates with her husband who helps in selling clothes to meet the family needs. Mbeyu faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bales of new clothing to help diversify her merchandise selection. In the future, she is hoping to sell shoes, as well as clothes, from her store.

loans.use: To purchase bales of new clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric and thread to make clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy textiles and raw materials for making beads

loans.name: Anara

texts.en:
Anara M. is 46, widowed and has three children. She was born in a large family of farmers and from childhood helped her parents in household tasks. After graduating from Medical College, she worked as a nurse at the local hospital. Unfortunately, wages of medical personnel are too low to cover all household expenses so, in order to find an additional means of subsistence, Anara decided to begin cattle breeding and land cultivating. She started these activities with an initial capital of 5,000 KGS and managed to earn about 8,000 KGS in a month. Today Anara’s farm consists of two milk cows, three bull calves and ten sheep. With the revenues, she managed to give a good education to her children. Now Anara wants a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase more milk cows and sheep which will allow her to increase her sales of milk and meat products. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Shirley Fazileth

texts.es: Shirley Fazileth R. D. C.,  D. Veintiún años D. edad, resiD. en la ciudad y municipio D. Soyapango, departamento D. San Salvador, en casa D. sus padres, Shirley es madre soltera, tiene bajo su custodia la responsabilidad D. su hija, y si bien el padre D. su hija mensualmente aporta una cantidad D. dinero, resulta muy poco para las necesidades diarias tanto D. su hija como ella. Razón por la cual Shirley encontró en la venta D. cosméticos por catalogo una excelente opción D. cuidar D. su hija y hacerse D. dinero para costear necesidades básicas D. sus vidas. Este es uno D. los mejores momentos comerciales por los que esta pasando Shirley , por lo que espera con este crédito, invertir mas en su negocio a fin D. incrementar su inventario y contar con nuevos productos que le piden sus clientes y vecinos a fin D. mejorar cada día la calidad D. vida tanto para ellas como para sus padres que tanto le están apoyando.-
texts.en:
Shirley Fazileth R. D. C. is 21 years old and lives in the city of Soyapango in the department of San Salvador in her parent's house.  Shirley is a single mother who has the primary responsibility for her daughter.  Her daughter's father contributes a sum of money every month, but there is little left for the daily necessities for her and her daughter.  For this reason, Shirley found that selling cosmetics by catalog was an excellent option to care for her daughter and earn money for basic necessities.  

This is a good time for business for Shirley, so she is hoping she can use this loan to invest more in her business.  She would like to increase her inventory and have new products to offer to her customers and neighbors so that she can improve her life and her daughter's life, and also help her parents because they have given her so much support.

loans.use: to purchase lotions, hand and body creams, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 43-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives on his own. He has been working as a farmer for 15 years. In 2000, he bought his own land and started cultivating all types of vegetables and fruits, according to the season. He sells his products to people from his town and neighboring villages. He works hard to be able to satisfy his own needs. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase needed supplies for his agricultural work. In the future, he plans to further expand his business and cultivate exotic fruits.

loans.use: to purchase needed supplies for his farm

loans.name: Elva Alicia

texts.es: Elva Alicia M. D. A., cuenta con sesenta y seis años D. edad, tuvo 6 hijos que a la fecha todos son mayores D. edad y viven cada uno en sus propias casas, Elva vive sola con su esposo, Don Antonio. Tiene instalada una tienda en municipio y departamento D. San Salvador y cuenta ya con varios años D. experiencia y en este momento desea invertir mas en su negocio, queriendo incorporar mayor cantidad D. productos que demandan sus clientes en próxima vacación , que se aproxima D. verano, como bebidas, golosinas y productos enlatados. Elva cuenta con mucha experiencia D. créditos y sabe aprovecharlos, así como siempre ha sido muy visionaria, es por ello que espera contar con este nuevo crédito y aprovechar comprar productos que previo a la temporada D. verano se encuentran a menores precios y poder obtener así mejores ganancias.-
texts.en: Elva Alicia M. D. A. is 66 years old.  She has 6 grown children that all live in their own house.  Elva lives with her husband, Don Antonio.  She owns a store in the town and department of San Salvador and has several years of experience with this business.  Currently, she is interested in investing more in her business in order to offer more products that her clients are demanding as summer nears, such as beverages, sweets, and canned goods.  Elva has a great deal of experience with loans and knows how to take advantage of them, as she has always been very forward-thinking.  It is for this reason that she hopes to receive this new loan and use it to buy products before summer begins to take advantage of lower prices and thereby increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy beverages, sweets, and canned goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, beans, sugar, milk, and disposable products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To  purchase medication for her medical clinic.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase another quarry site or to extend her quarry plot

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase dried fish for the summer season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and juices for making smoothies and medicine for inclusion in her inventory.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She has been operating a cafe for the past three years, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business.

With the 40,000Kes she is requesting, she wants to purchase a potato-chip cutter and increase her food inventory. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a potato-chip cutter and increase food inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of dry goods and propane gas.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the rental bill.  She has operated a tailoring business for the past five years, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby.  Previously she sewed school uniforms for her source of income. 

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase a sewing machine and thread. She dreams of establishing a tailoring training school in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a zigzag machine and sewing thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase powdered milk, cold cuts, canned goods, and basic grains.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is 39 years old and is married, with two children who are 1 and 3 years old. She also takes care of two relatives. Selina is a self-employed businesswoman selling a variety of goods, as her photo indicates. Among those goods are cosmetic products like body lotion and Colgate (toothpaste), and foods like rice and sugar.

Selina has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing a large quantity of sugar and rice, as they are highly in demand. With this large quantity she will also start wholesaling. In doing so, Selina hopes to earn more profits.  That will allow her to renovate her house and continue to pay school fees for her two relatives as well as to build a secure future for her two children.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of sugar and rice.

loans.name: Melquiadeza

texts.es:
Melquiadeza es socia del Banco Comunal Cielo, tiene 46 años, es casada, 2 hijos de 16 y 11 años. Melquiadeza tiene un  Salón de belleza, hace trabajos de cortes de cabello para damas caballeros y niños, maquillajes para todo tipo de compromisos, tintes, venta de accesorios para belleza, joyas, entre otros.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para su establecimiento, está en Finca Perú, hace muchos años, le gusta por el acceso a los créditos, por la facilidad en los pagos de sus créditos y sobre todo puede ahorrar, con sus ahorros pudo implementar su casa, educar a sus hijos. Su sueño es que su negocio siga prosperando y que sus hijos terminen de estudiar.
texts.en:
Melquiadeza is a member of the Communal Bank “Cielo” (Heaven). She is 46 years old, married, and has two children (ages 16 and 11). Melquiadeza has a beauty salon where she provides haircuts for women, men, and children. In addition, she performs makeovers for all types of events, hair coloring, and sells beauty accessories, jewelry, and other products.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of supplies for her establishment. Melquiadeza has been with FINCA Peru for several years. She enjoys having access to loans, the convenience of her loan payments, and being able to save. With her savings she has been able to maintain her home and provide her children with an education. Her dreams include continuing to prosper in her business and seeing her children finish their studies.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her salon.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Sr. Francisco tiene 41 años, es soltero pero tiene novia, quien no participa del crédito porque no viven juntos, ella vive con su madre.
Su actividad la está realizando desde el año 2003 y desde el año 2005 empezó a trabajar con Fundación Paraguaya, cuando ya tuvo un puesto fijo en la Ciudad de San Lorenzo. Empezó vendiendo y recorriendo las calles, pero viendo que ya tenía formada cierta cantidad de clientes consiguió un local de buena ubicación para tener mayor cantidad y variedad de mercaderías.
Con este crédito piensa comprar un televisor más grande y un amplificador de sonido, y por lo que sobre del préstamo invertirlo para actualizar el stock de productos.
texts.en:
Sr. Francisco is 41 years old. He is single and has a girlfriend, but she is not participating in this loan because they do not live together. His girlfriend lives with her mother.

Francisco has been in business since 2003 and started working with Fundación Paraguaya in 2005 when he had an established location in the city of San Lorenzo. He started traveling and selling in the streets, but once he acquired a set number of customers he secured a shop in a good location so that he could have a large inventory and wide variety of merchandise.

With this loan, Francisco plans to buy a larger television and a sound amplifier. Any subsequent loan will be used to upgrade his inventory of products.

loans.use: To purchase a television and an amplifier.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.es: Marlon, de 27 años, es un joven ambicioso; pues quiere salir adelante por su esposa Victoria y su hija Mariela de 3 años de edad; con las que vive en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Sangani (selva central peruana). Como Técnico de enfermería Marlon, desde hace 7 años trabaja en el puesto de salud de la comunidad de La Palmas, ubicada en las afueras de la ciudad de Pichanaki. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder atender a las personas de bajos recursos, y que son ellos los que constantemente sufren de infecciones producidas por insectos propios de la selva. Pero su principal molestia son los bajos recursos en que él atraviesa y no le alcanza lo suficiente para mejorar su calidad de vida. “Gracias al poyo de mi esposa, que trabaja como secretaria para el gobierno local del estado, tenemos un nivel de vida digna”, menciona. Los planes de Marlon, son poder estudiar y así obtener un mayor ingreso. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Gedeón de los olivos”, y este es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde se siente desarrollado y con motivación para salir adelante. La hija de Marlon comenzará a estudiar, por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar los materiales para las clases de su pequeña hija, asimismo invertirá en el arreglo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marlon, age 27, is an ambitious young man who wants to succeed on behalf of his wife Victoria and their three year old daughter Mariela. They live in their own home in the town of Sangani in the central Peruvian jungle. As a nurse technician, Marlon has worked seven years at a community health clinic in Las Palmas, which is outside of the city of Pichanaki. What he enjoys most about his work is helping people who have limited resources. These individuals are the ones most likely to suffer to from infections caused by jungle insects. However, his main complaint is his own situation since he lacks sufficient funds to improve his quality of life. “Thanks to the help of my wife, who works as a secretary at the state government office, we are able to have a decent standard of living,” says Marlon. His plans include pursuing his studies so that he can obtain a better income.

Marlon is a member of the Communal Bank “Gedeón de los Olivos” (Gideon of the Olive Trees). This is his third loan with MFP. Being part of the organization, he feels he has developed and gained the motivation to move forward. Marlon’s daughter will be starting school, so he plans to use this loan to buy materials for her classes. In addition, he will invest in repairs to his home.

loans.use: To purchase educational materials for his daughter and pay for home repairs.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal Cielo, tiene 40 años, es casada y tres hijos de 21, 19 y 17 años.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de alimentos. Sonia y su esposo tienen un restaurante en la Urb. María Parado de Bellido, está en Finca Perú hace varios años, le gusta por los créditos que le otorgan y puede ahorrar, estando en Finca Perú ahorro y pudo comprarse un terreno, implementar su restaurante, también porque pasa momentos gratos con las compañeras de su banco. Su sueño es poder ahorrar para abrir una pollería y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the Communal Bank “Cielo” (Heaven). She is 40 years old, married, and has three children (ages 21, 19, and 17). Sonia is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of supplies for preparing food. She and her husband have a restaurant in Urb. María Parado de Bellido.

Sonia has been with FINCA Peru for several years. She enjoys the loans that have been provided and being able to save. Using her savings with FINCA Peru, Sonia was able to buy a plot of land and maintain her restaurant. She also has a good time being with her fellow Communal Bank members. Her dreams include saving enough money to open a rotisserie chicken shop and seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for food preparation.

loans.name: Rosa Luz

texts.es: Rosa Luz M. D. C., D. cincuenta y seis años D. edad, resiD. y tiene instalada una tienda y venta D. jugos en su casa desD. hace años en Santa Tecla, departamento D. La Libertad. Rosa vive junto a su esposo Don Guillermo que aún trabaja como motorista del transporte público del sector y tres hijos que se encuentran trabajando y que ya colaboran con los gastos que genera este hogar.  Rosa es una mujer realizada y feliz ya que gracias a los ingresos que obtiene D. su negocio ha podido colaborarle a su esposo para que sus hijos ya ahora sean personas insertadas en la vida productiva D. este país. Pero Rosa Luz no conforme con esto se siente llena D. vida y desea seguir siendo útil y por ello desea reinvertirle a su negocio, a través del crédito solicitado, para que productos con los que no cuenta como maquillajes, lociones, medicinas ahora los tenga para sus clientes
texts.en:
Rosa Luz M. D. C., age 56, resides in Santa Tecla in the Department of La Libertad. She has a store and juice shop in her home that she started several years ago. Her husband, Don Guillermo, works as a motorcycle driver in the public transportation sector. They have three children who are working and contributing to the household expenses. Rosa is an accomplished woman and feels happy with the income her business generates. She and her husband have worked together to raise their children, who are now productive citizens of El Salvador.

Rosa does not feel that she has reached her potential in life, so she wants to continue being useful and reinvesting in her business. The loan she is requesting will be used to acquire products that she does not have in stock such as make-up, lotions, and medicines that her customers must have now.

loans.use: Purchase make-up, lotions, and medicines.

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with two school-aged children. She has operated a charcoal business for the past four years, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. Margaret joined Yehu Microfinance to access funds to boost her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Kakola Women's Group-Lugazi

texts.en: 42 year-old Constance N. is affiliated with Kakola Women's group-Lugazi. In the course of the last ten years, she has been in charge of a boutique business in Kakola-Lugazi. She has been selling ladies clothes primarily. She says she began this business with savings from her farming business. She still does farming, though it is now more of a second fiddle. Weekly, this business generates her 50,000 shillings as profit. She says she is requesting this loan to purchase more ladies' and children's clothes to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more ladies' and children's clothes.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia es socia del Banco Comunal Atinchik, es madre soltera, tiene 47 años y una hija de 17 años.
Virginia, tiene un puesto surtido de prendas de vestir para damas caballeros y niños, ropas interiores entre otros en el mercado de la Magdalena, aprendió de este negocio de su mamá pues ella también tiene un puesto. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la en la compra de mercaderías.
Ingreso a Finca Perú por la invitación de su cuñada, le gusta por la accesibilidad a los créditos y puede ahorrar, gracias a sus ahorros puedo surtir su mercadería y le va bien, le gusta compartir momentos gratos con sus con socias y también las capacitaciones que recibe que le ayudan en su vida diaria.
texts.en:
Virginia is a member of the Communal Bank “Atinchik”. She is 47 years old and a single mother of a 17 year old daughter. She has a clothing stand at the market in La Magdalena where she sells apparel for women, men, and children, as well as undergarments and other items. Virginia learned this business from her mother who also has a vending post. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of merchandise.

Virginia joined FINCA Peru after she was invited by her sister-in-law. She enjoys having access to loans and being able to save. Using her savings, she was able to acquire merchandise and has done very well. Virginia enjoys spending time with the other members and the training classes that have helped her in her daily life.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco, de 49 años; es un hombre honesto y trabajador. Vive junto a su esposa Marina, con quien tubo 5 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Sangani (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que se dedica desde hace 20 años, es la agricultura. Todas las mañanas se dirige a Vista alegre, donde tiene sus sembríos de café y plátano, los cuales cuida gracias a la ayuda del personal que contrata en cada campaña agrícola. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es trasladar café de la ciudad de Pichanaki a Pampa Camona, “ahora que comienza la campaña de café, todos los agricultores necesitan trasporte, en esta temporada es donde tengo mayores ganancias”, afirma. La principal dificultad de Francisco son los gastos de educación de sus hijos; por ello existen días donde le falta dinero para fertilizar y cuidar constantemente sus cultivos. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Gedeón de los olivos”, y este es el cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP, institución que le dio el apoyo para mejorar la calidad de sus plantaciones. Francisco, dentro de un mes cosechará los granos de café que cultivó, por ello con el crédito comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico, los cuales esparcirá entre sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Francisco, age 49, is an honest and hardworking gentleman. He lives with his wife Mariana. They have five children, but only two of them live in their home in the town of Sangani in the central Peruvian jungle. Franciso has been working for twenty years as a farmer. Every morning he heads out to Vista Alegre where he has his own coffee and banana crops. He is able to take care of crops with the help of workers he hires each season. What he enjoys most about his work is transporting his coffee to the city of Pichanaki in Pampa Camona. “Now that the coffee season has started, all farmers need to transport their crops so that they can have better earnings,” says Francisco. His main difficulty is paying for his children’s educational expenses. As a result, there are days when he lacks the money to acquire fertilizers so that he can provide constant care for his crops.

Francisco is a member of the Communal Bank “Gedeón de Los Olivos” (Gideon of the Olive Trees). This is his fourth loan with MFP, the institution that has given him support to improve the quality of his crops. Francisco will be harvesting coffee beans in a month. For this reason, he will use this loan to buy several sacks of organic fertilizers to apply on his crops.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Delia Constanza

texts.es:
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Atinchik, tiene 67 años, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos.
Delia es docente cesante, se dedica hacer trabajos en crochet, preparación bufetes, tortas y bocaditos para todo tipos de eventos como: matrimonios, bautizos, cumpleaños, entre otros. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de insumos. le gusta Finca porque sin darse cuenta ahorra, su sueño es que su negocio crezca
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the Atinchik Communal Bank, she is 67 years old, she is a single mother and has 2 children.
Delia is a retired teacher; she engages in making crochet crafts and in preparing buffet meals, cakes and sandwiches for every kind of events such as: weddings, christenings, birthdays and many others. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of ingredients. She likes Finca Peru because she can save effortlessly. She wishes for her activity to grow.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her activity.

loans.name: Bithia

texts.en:
Bithia is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She and her husband own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a fish selling business for the past three years, selling to her neighbors and passersby. With the Kshs 60,000, she wants to purchase fish and vegetables for sale. Bithia joined Yehu microfinance to access loans to boost her business. She dreams of adding to her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase fish and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro, de 40 años es un hombre evangélico. Él predica la palabra de Díos y a pesar de que no vive con su familia, se siente dichoso de habitar en la iglesia donde se reúnen con sus demás compañeros. Ubicada en la localidad de Sangani (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de medicinas naturales, para aquellas personas que sufren de alguna enfermedad, asimismo vende ollas quirúrgicas. Pero la verdadera actividad que le apasiona es la realización de injertos de plantas, los cuales realiza con el apoyo de un asistente. Los principales frutos que injerta son el cacao, cítricos y mango. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es ver crecer las semillas de los frutos. Según afirma son pocos los que se dedican a la elaboración de injertos; existe gran demanda porque la mayoría de los agricultores buscan injertos para sus plantaciones. Pero el principal inconveniente de Pedro, es el capital de trabajo, ya que para el proceso necesita un promedio de 10 mil soles. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Gedeon de los olivos”, y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde siente que puede encontrar el apoyo que tanto necesita para poder seguir con su actividad. Pedro, se está preparando para la campaña de siembra de cacao, por ello con el crédito que solicita, está pensando comprar semillas de cacao, que colocará en bolsas negras para la realización de los injertos.
texts.en: Pedro, 40 years old, is a protestant man. He preaches the word of God and although he does not live with his family, he feels fortunate to live at the church they attend along with their friends. The church is located in the town of Sangani, in the central Peruvian rainforest zone. Pedro earns a living selling natural medicines as well as stainless steel cookware. However, his third job, which he is most passionate about, is grafting plants. He does this with the help of an assistant. The main plants he grafts are cocoa beans, citrus fruits, and mangos. What he likes most about this job is seeing the seeds grow into trees. According to Pedro, there are very few people who work in grafting, yet there is a large demand since the majority of farmers seek out grafts for their farms. The main setback for Pedro is working capital since he needs an average of 10,000 soles for the process. He belongs to the "Gedeon de los Olivos" Communal Bank. This is his fourth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, through which he feels he can find the support he so badly needs to be able to continue his work. Pedro is preparing for the cocoa bean planting season, and for this reason he is planning to buy cocoa beans with the loan he is requesting, which he will place is large black bags for making the grafts.

loans.use: To buy cocoa beans

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El comité Primavera es de la zona de Pa'i Ñu de San Lorenzo. Varias señoras se dedican a la venta de comestibles, comidas rápidas y despensas. Son todas señoras con antigüedad en el negocio, que decidieron mantener el monto ya que no pagan bien su cuota por culpa de una integrante que no es responsable como las demás, pero esta vez tuvieron que excluirle por mal pago.
Dayana es hija de la tesorera, ella es la más joven y trabajadora, hace de todo, desde arreglar bicicletas, hasta cocinar, le encanta trabajar.
La sra. Lilian S. posee una despensa donde vende todo tipo de coemstibles y desea poder ampliar su variedad de productos con ayuda del crédito.
texts.en:
The Primavera group ("Spring") is from the Pa'i Ñu zone of San Lorenzo.  the group is made up of various women who sell food, fast food, and groceries. All the women are experienced businesswomen. They decided to pay their balance in full since they have not made payments well because of a member who is not as responsible as the other women.  For this line, they had to exclude the member because of bad credit.

Dayana is the daughter of the group's treasurer. She is the youngest member of the group. She is hard-working, doing everything from fixing bicycles to cooking. She loves to work.  Lilian S. has a pantry where she sells all type of food. She wants to increase the variety of products she sells with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to buy wheat, rice, pasta, sugar, maté, oil, salt, condiments, meat, tapioca, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: Madine

texts.en:
Madine is 34 years old and is married with five children between the ages of 14 and 17. She is commonly known for her business of selling vegetables.  This is her fifth successful year and she is very organized. She currently employs one person to help her and she operates her business from 6am to 6pm every day.

Madine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business.  She hopes to earn more profits which will allow her to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is married with two school-going children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees, medical bills and food for the family.

She has operated a vegetable stall business for the past year, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Catherine faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables and fruits to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Chixacol Group

texts.en:
Felipe S. Chún is single, 51 years old, and lives in the highland region of Totonicapan. He has five children, four of whom are currently in school. Don Felipe earns a living by selling daily consumer products. He has a store and has ten years of experience in the business. He started with a small shop and has developed his business into what it is today. 

Felipe is requesting a loan as a part of the ¨Chixacol¨ group to purchase more goods to sell in his store. He hopes to one day run a larger store and sell a wide variety of household goods to his customers. 

The ¨Chixacol¨ group consists of five members, two women and three men. The loan they are requesting will be used to expand their capital so that they can increase their sales volume. Group members are involved in the following businesses: plastics sales, clothing sales, and general goods sales.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in his store

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa, de 36 años, es una mujer admirable. Hace 4 años se separó de su esposo, con quien tuvo un hijo, Chen de 4 años de edad. En la actualidad ella y su hijo viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Sangani (selva central peruana). Hace 8 años que trabaja como profesora en un jardín, enseñando a niños menores de 5 años. Pero su verdadera pasión y pasatiempo es el bordado de faldas típicas en un taller que acondicionó en su casa, el cual realiza con la ayuda de 2 mujeres a las que contrata, de esa manera los clientes le llevan docenas de faldas para que le realice el bordado, cobrando 100 nuevos soles por cada falda. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la demanda que existe, “somos pocas las que se dedican a esto”, afirma. Sus principales inconvenientes son la falta de capital de trabajo, ya que los gastos íntegros para el bordado de las faldas, son cubiertos por Teresa, quien tiene que invertir grandes cantidades de dinero. En adelante ella está planeando comprar máquinas modernas para el desarrollo de su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Gedeón de los olivos”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde es una socia respetada por su capacidad de trabajo. Teresa, comprará con el crédito materiales para el bordado que realiza; como hilos de colores, algunos conos de hilos dorados y plateados, en donde invertirá un promedio de S/. 1500 nuevos soles y con el resto del dinero contratará personal para que le ayuden en este trabajo.
texts.en:
Teresa, 36 years old, is an admirable women.  It's been four years since she separated from her husband with whom she has a son, four year-old Chen.  Currently she and Chen live in their own home located in Sangani, a jungle in central Peru.  For eight years she has been a nursery/kindergarten teacher, teaching children under five years old.

Her real passion and hobby is embroidering traditional skirts in a workshop she set up in her house with the help of two women she hired.  Customers bring dozens of skirts to the workshop to be embroidered, and Teresa charges 100 nuevos soles per skirt. What she likes most about her work is the demand that exists. "There are only a few of us who do this," Teresa affirms.  Her main inconvenience is the lack of working capital, since the main costs for embroidering the skirts are covered by Teresa, who has to invest large quantities of money.  In the future, Teresa is planning to buy sewing machines to develop the business.

Teresa is a member of the community bank “Gedeón de los olivos.”  this is her third credit with MFP, where she is a respected for her capacity for work.  Teresa will use the loan to buy materials needed for her embroidery. She will use around 1500 nuevos soles to buy colored thread along with some silver and gold thread.  With the rest of the money, she will hire people who can help her with the embroidery.

loans.use: To buy colored, silver, and gold thread and contract two people to help her with embroidery.

loans.name: Duo Mujeres De Chuarrancho Group

texts.es:
Duo Mujeres de Chuarrancho: Este Grupo esta formado por. Olga A. de 33 años  soltera se dedica desde hace 15 años a la sostura de guipiles y cortes tipicos de la region, ella solicita el credito para la compra de materia prima para seguir confeccionendo tejidos,
Maria Elena A. de 40 años y se dedica a la confeccion de güipiles desde hace 15 años y nos cuenta que esta contenta de saber su oficio, ella vende su producto en el marcado de su localidad ella solicita este credito para la compra de materia prima para la comfeccion de tejidos.
texts.en:
Duo Mujeres de Chuarrancho ["Two Women of Chuarrancho"] Group is comprised of:

Olga A., 33, who is single and has been making blouses and skirts typical of their region for 15 years. She is requesting a loan to buy materials so she can continue making fabrics.

Maria Elena A., 40, has worked sewing blouses for 15 years and says that is happy with her trade. She sells her products in the local market. She is requesting a loan to buy materials for making fabric.

loans.use: to buy materials for making textiles

loans.name: Eutropia

texts.en:
Eutropia is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a poultry business for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Eutropia faces the major challenge of seasonality, and especially during outbreaks of poultry diseases. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the future.

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. Eutropia joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia, es una luchadora madre soltera que cuida de su hijo Aldair a quien quiere mucho. Juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Guacamayo (selva central peruana). Desde muy joven se dedicó a producir la tierra que le fue heredada, pues tenía que velar por su hijo. Fue entonces que comenzó a sembrar una variedad de frutas cítricas como: naranja, mandarina y tangelo, ya tiene 9 años de experiencia, en todo este tiempo su buena disposición en las ventas, le permitieron adquirir 5 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas. Recientemente incursionó en la siembra de plátanos con el que piensa generar ingresos casa 15 días, ya que su maduración es más rápida que otras variedades. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “nuevo amanecer de Guacamayo”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde espera lograr todos los objetivos de su banco comunal. Alicia, hace poco sembró tangelo (fruta cítrica), por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar varios sacos de abono orgánico, los cuales esparcirá entre sus sembríos para que sigan creciendo sin inconvenientes.
texts.en:
Alicia is a determined single mother who looks after her son Aldair, whom she loves very much. They live in her house, located in the community of Guacamayo (central Peruvian rainforest). From a young age she worked the land she inherited in order to support her child. That's when she began to sow a variety of citrus fruits such as oranges, tangerines and tangelos. She already has 9 years' experience and over time her sales ability has allowed her to purchase 5 hectares of agricultural land. She recently ventured into the cultivation of bananas, which she expects that will generate revenue every fortnight, as the ripening process is faster than with other varieties. 

She is a member of the "nuevo amanecer de Guacamayo" ("new dawn of Guacamayo") communal bank and this is her first loan with MFP. She is hoping to achieve all of her communal bank's objectives. Alicia recently planted tangelo (a citrus fruit) and she is planning on using the loan to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer, which she will spread amongst her crops so that they can continue to grow smoothly.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, provincia de Urubamba, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Clara; La socia tiene 38 años de edad, la socia  es conviviente; la socia tiene 5 hijos de (18,17,15,11,2) años de edad; la socia trabaja en artesanía, la socia realiza bellísimos trabajos en textil ería, también produce chompas de alpaca, la socia hace adornos y también surte su negocio con todo tipo de cerámica;  alternando a este trabajo la socia tien una parcela de terreno en la cual produce, maíz, papa, la socia desea el crédito está vez para poder invertir en la compra de materiales para los textiles, en lana de alpaca y en la compra de cerámica para surtir su negocio, ella vende todos los días en el mercado artesanal.
La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales.                                                                                                                                                          
La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Clara is a member of the "Nueva Victoria - Chinchero" ("New Victory - Chinchero") communal bank, located in the district of Chinchero, province of Urubamba, department of Cusco.

Clara is 38 years old and lives with her partner. She has 5 children aged 18, 17, 15, 11 and 2. She works in the crafts sector. She makes beautiful textile pieces as well as alpaca sweaters. She makes ornaments and also provides her business with all types of ceramic pieces. On top of this she owns a plot of land that produces corn and potatoes. 

She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of materials for her textile pieces, alpaca wool and ceramic pieces for her business. She sells her goods every day at the craft market. Clara is happy with the loan and is committed to repaying it in the agreed time.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of craft materials.

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es: María es integrante D. la Alcancía Comunal “DIOS ES AMOR”  es madre soltera y tiene 5 hijos, trabaja como vendedora ambulante D. frutas,  gaseosas y confitería en la zona D. corcona hace mas D. 20 años, ella se inicio junto a sus hermanas con el afán D. obtener ganancias ya que el transitan viajeros al centro del país.  María invertirá en la compra D. frutas D. estación como duraznos. tunas, uvas y manzanas para vender a buen precio. Ella desea mejorar su vivienda y que su hijo menor culmine sus estudios. Si tuviera más capital invertiría en apertura una bodega en su casa. La Alcancía  Comunal “Dios es Amor”    tiene 12 integrantes que se dedican al comercio informal y denominaron su asociación así por ser creyentes D. Dios. Están entusiastas D. participar por primera vez en el programa y agradecen la oportunidad brindada. En la fotografía apreciamos a tres niños sus padres tuvieron que traerlos porque no cuentan con el apoyo D. familiares a fin D. cuidarlos
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the "Dios es Amor" ("God is Love") communal bank. She is a single mother with 5 children and works as street vendor. She has been selling fruits, soft drinks and sweets in the Corcona area for over 20 years. She started with her sisters in order to make a profit, as the area is in the route that travellers take to get to the centre of the country. 

Maria will invest in the purchsae of seasonal fruit such as peaches, pears, grapes and apples, which she will sell at a good price. She wants to improve her home and for her youngest son to finish school. If she had more capital she would invest it in opening a store in her house.

The "Dios es Amor" communal bank has 12 members who work in informal traD. and gave this name to the association because they believe in God. The are keen to participate in the program for the first time and are grateful for this opportunity. In the picture you can see three children whose parents had to bring them along on the day as they cannot be looked after by family members.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as peaches, pears, grapes and apples.

loans.name: Lilian Antonieta

texts.es: LA señora Lilian Antonieta: tiene 34 años de edad se dedica a la confeccion de ropa variada, y de vestir desde hace 4 años ella esta contenta porque durante el tiempo que lleva a tenido muchos pedidos por mayor,ella solicita este credito para la compra de mas telas para la confeccion de playeras de diferentes tallas, ahora su gran sueño es seguir creciendo y contratar mas personas que le ayuden a confeccionar mas prendas y asi poder salir a vender a diferentes lugares.
texts.en: Ms. Lilian Antonieta is 34 years old, she has been engaging in creating various items of clothing for 4 years. She is happy because during the time she has been working she has received many wholesale requests. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more cloth to create T-shirts of different sizes. At the moment, her big wish is to keep on growing and to hire more people who can help her creating more clothes, and so be able to sell her products in different places.

loans.use: To buy cloth to create items of clothing.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, provincia de Urubamba, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Leonarda; La socia tiene 43 años de edad, la socia  es casada; la socia tiene 3 hijos de (18,15,13) años de edad; la socia se dedica la ganadería y a la agricultura, la socia tiene sus vacas, toros, ovejas, animales menores, la socia compra vacas, las cría y cuando alcanzan su madures las vende, ella tiene este negocio desde hace 20 años, ella también vende sus animales menores, la socia también eventualmente extrae leche de sus vacas adultas y elabora quesos, mantequillas caseras con el derivados de la leche y los vende a pedido, hace en pocas cantidades debido a que no llevan persevantes y debe venderlos de inmediato. La socia deseas invertiré el crédito en la compra de 2 vacas terneritas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de dos vacas terneras. 

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the community bank “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”; located in Chinchero District, Urubamba Province, Cusco.

Leonarda is 43, married and has 3 children (18,15,13 years old).  This borrower practices agriculture and raises cattle, bulls, sheep and other farm animals.  She buys the animals to grow and sells them when they mature; she has engaged in this business for the last twenty years. Leonarda also sells milk, butter and cheese produced from her cows, and does so in small quantities since they are perishable items.  Leonarda wishes to buy 2 small calves with the requested loan, and is committed to prompt repayment of the credit.

loans.use: To buy two calves

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa, de 40 años “es una mujer trabajadora”, que junto a su esposo Esequiel y sus 2 hijos, viven en armonía familiar en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Guacamayo (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que se dedica está laboriosa mujer es la agricultura, sus principales sembríos constan de cítricos como: naranja y tangelo. Ya tiene 5 años dedicándose a esta actividad y según afirma lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es “recalzar” (proceso de podar las plantas que no dieron frutos para poder realizar viveros). Además de cuidar sus cultivos, también trabaja en una hacienda donde le pagan cada fin de semana una suma considerable de dinero por podar, machetear y quitar la maleza de los cultivos de cítricos. Ahora ella está juntando dinero para poder comprar una moto taxi y así incursionar en el trasporte público. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “nuevo amanecer de guacamayo”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde espera obtener el apoyo necesario para poder hacer realidad sus objetivos. Luisa, constantemente realiza la limpieza de sus cultivos, por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar varios sacos de abono orgánico, como también podrá contratar personal para poder realizar la limpieza de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
40 year-old Luisa "is a hard-working woman" who, together with her husband Esequiel and their two children, lives in familial harmony in her own home which is located in Guacamayo community (in the central Peruvian jungle).  This hard-working woman is a farmer.  Her main crops are citrus fruits such as oranges and tangelos.  She has been in this business for 5 years and she tells us that what she likes most about her work is pruning the plants that haven't borne fruit so that she can make nurseries.  As well as looking after her own crops, Luisa also works on an estate where they pay her a considerable sum of money each weekend to prune, cut and weed their citrus fruit crops.

Right now, Luisa is putting together some money so that she can buy a 'mototaxi' (a motorbike with a cabin in back for transporting passengers and / or goods) so that she can start providing public transport services.  She belongs to the "Nuevo Amanecer de Guacamayo'" (New Dawn of Guacamayo) community bank and this is her first loan cycle with MFP.  She hopes to obtain the support she needs to reach her goals.

Luisa is constantly weeding her crops and, for this reason, she is planning to use her loan money to buy several sacks of organic manure and to hire workers to weed her crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and to hire workers to help her weed her fields

loans.name: Paraje Centro 2 Group

texts.en:
Rosario is 30 years old, single, and has no children. Although she never attended school, Rosario has developed a business of raising and selling chickens. She started this work when she was 20 years old and has been working in the business for the past ten years. She hopes to one day run a large farm with many different types of animals. 

Rosario is requesting a loan to purchase more animals to raise on her farm and sell in the market. She is part of a group of five women who are all requesting a loan under the group ¨Paraje Centro 2¨. Other members of this group are involved in the following activities: clothing sales, thermos sales, and animal raising and selling.

loans.use: purchase more chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: LA señora Josefina C.: es de 62 años de edad tiene 3 años de confeccionar ropa variada y nececita un refinanciamiento para comprar mas tela para la confeccion de pantalones ya que ella solo se dedica a la elavoracion y no cuenta con suficiente personal para que le elavoren mas prendas ahora  ella invertira en playeras por el tiempo de verano ya que a ella le ayuda porque todos los fines de semana sale a vender a diferente pueblos y unos de sus clientes  le hacen pedidos. el mayor deceo de ella es que su ultimo hijo estudie y le ayude al mismo tiempo para asi generar mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Josefina C. is 62 years old.  For three years she has been making clothes and she needs a loan to buy more fabric for making pants (trousers).  She makes her products alone and doesn't have the staff to make more clothes.

Josefina will invest in t-shirts for the summer season because every weekend she travels to different villages to sell her products and some of her customers make orders for them.  Josefina's biggest wish is for her youngest son to study and help her at the same time so that she can make more profits.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making pants and t-shirts

loans.name: Lester Antonio

texts.es:
Lester casado, su esposa ama de casa, sus hijos estudian, desde hace tiempo trabaja como chofer de ruta urbana, su proyecto mejorar la infraestructura de su casa, su meta que sus hijos se profesionalicen. 
Poco  a poco ha ido mejorando la vivienda con el ciclo anterior construyo una tapia en los costado del terreno. Con este préstamo comprara llama, perlines, cementos, piedrín, hierro, barias de soldar, alambre de marre, zinc, pernos punta de broca entre otros materiales para cambiar el techo. 
Agradece a la financiera por su apoyo a su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Lester is married and his wife is a housewife. Their children are in school. He has been public transport driver for a long time. His goal is to improve the infrastructure of his house and to see his kids grow up to have a career.

He has gradually been improving their house. With the past loan cycle he built a wall along the back end of their land. With this loan he will purchase beams, cement, gravel, iron, solder, wiring, zinc, drill bits and other materials that he needs to replace the roof. 

He is thankful to the financial organization for the support provided.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, provincia de Urubamba, Departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra: Raquel; La socia tiene 42 años de edad, la socia  es conviviente; la socia tiene 4 hijos de (24,22,18,5) años de edad; la socia se dedica la artesanía, la socia es artesana y desde su abuela, su madre y ella trabajan en la artesanía, al inicio ella empezó a tejer a mano las lanas formando figuras paisajísticas, la iconografía andina es muy sabia en esta zona como en todo el ande del Perú, la socia conocedora de estos paisajes plasma en ellos las vivencias de su comunidad, ella tejía pequeños brazaletes con lanas delgadas de oveja, esta lanas que eran extraídas de sus animales las hilaban en unos palos hechos por ellas para formar madejas y luego en trozos diferentes los teñían con óxidos naturales que se encuentra en la naturaleza con un proceso de ebullición, la socia empezó a realizar estos brazaletes en distintos colores con diferentes motivos y los llevaba a vender a los puntos turísticos, desde muy niña, entonces es así que poco a poco su pueblo fue cobrando vida y fue reconocido como uno de los poblados artesanales, entonces ella se agrupo y formo junto a otras tejedoras, artesanas, pintores, y artistas el mercado artesanal dominical, años atrás se visitaba estas ferias solo los días martes, jueves y domingos, hoy en día por la afluencia del turismo abren la feria todos los días y aqui se las encuentra con sus trajes típicos, y sus mil trencitas característicos de esta zona a los artesanos en sus stand ofreciendo sus trabajo a precios muy cómodos. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de tejidos.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Raquel is a member of the "Nueva Victoria - Chincero" community bank which is located in Chincero district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Raquel is 42 years old, lives with her partner, and has 4 children aged 24, 22, 18 and 5.  Her business is handicrafts.  Raquel is a craftswoman and her grandmother and her mother also work in this field.

Raquel started out weaving by hand, making representations of landscapes.  Andean iconography is very well known in this area, as it is throughout the Peruvian Andes.  Raquel is familiar with these landscapes and she captures the experiences of her community within them.

Raquel used to weave small bracelets with thin strands of sheep's wool.  She would take this wool from her animals and spin it on specially made sticks, to form skeins, then dye different sections with natural oxides, using a boiling process.  She started making these bracelets in different colors, with different motifs, and would take them to sell in tourist areas.  She has been doing this since she was a very young girl.

Gradually, Raquel's village was brought to life and became known as one of the craft villages.  Raquel got together with other weavers, craftswomen, painters and artists at the Sunday craft fair.  Years ago, she would visit these fairs only on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Sundays.  Now, owing to the influx of tourists, they open the fair every day of the week and the craftspeopple can be found there with their traditional outfits and braids which are characteristic of the area.  They can be found on their stalls, offering their work at very reasonable prices.

Raquel is requesting this loan to invest in buying materials for making her woven products.  She is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy materials for making her woven products

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Inés, es una mujer seria y trabajadora de 23 años. Que vive junto a su esposo Oscar y sus 2 hijos, en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Guacamayo (selva central peruana). El trabajo conjunto que realiza a lado de su esposo, le valió para poder sembrar café en su media hectárea de terreno agrícola, esperando pacientemente los 3 años de maduración que restan para que pueda dar sus primeros granos. De igual manera tiene una tienda de comestibles, donde vende productos de primera necesidad a los habitantes de su localidad. Ahora desea comprar más terrenos y así poder sembrar los diferentes frutos que crecen en está parte del país. Con el trabajo de su esposo, quien tiene experiencia en la siembra de cítricos; espera obtener los objetivos que se planteó. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “nuevo amanecer de Guacamayo”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde agradece la buena disposición de los integrantes, con el desarrollo de los objetivos. Inés, observó que su tienda de comestible carece de algunos productos de primera necesidad. Por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar hortalizas, arroz, azúcar, y bebidas para la temporada de verano.
texts.en: Inés is a serious and hardworking 23 year old woman. She lives with her husband Oscar and their 2 children in their own home, located in the community of Guacamayo (central Peruvian jungle). The work she has done at her husband's side has served for her to be able to plant coffee on their half-hectare plot of cropland. They are patiently awaiting the 3 years left in the maturation process to be able to have their first beans. In addition, she also has a grocery store wher she sells basic neccesity products to the residents in the area. Right now, she wants to buy more land and thus be able to plant different crops that grow in this part of the country. With the work of her husband, who has experience planting citrus, she hopes to attain the goals she has set. She belongs to the “Nuevo Amanecer de Guacamayo” [New Dawn of Guacamayo] group, and this is the first loan that she has had with MFP. She is grateful for the members good disposition, and with the development of their objectives. Inés observed that her store lacks some basic neccesity products. Because of this, with the loan she is planning on buying fresh produce, rice, sugar and beverages for the summer season.

loans.use: To buy fresh porduce, rice, sugar and soft drinks to supply her store.

loans.name: Heberardo

texts.es:
Heberardo, de 43 años de edad, es originario de la comunidad el Regadío, localizada en el departamento de Estelí, es casado, tiene 4 hijos a su cargo, de oficio agricultor, también comerciantes. Lleva 2 años en el negocio de destace de res.
Inicio en la agricultura en la comunidad el Regadío, ayudándole a su papa en el cultivo, arriar ganado a los 6 años de edad. Estudio la primaria en su comunidad de origen donde asistían todos los día caminando ida y vuelta, ya que la escuela queda algo lejos de du casa así mismo con la secundaria hasta lograr culminar su secundaria.  Después de eso tuvo que  trabajar para poder sobrevivir y se dedico al destace de cerdo y luego el  ganado. Con la primera vaca que compro y vendió le quedo una ganancia de C$4000 córdobas. Así logro trasladarse con su negocio hasta el centro de la comunidad el Regadío, municipio de Estelí, para vender carne a los mercados locales de Estelí, sin dejar atrás  la agricultura que es la actividad que aprendió desde niño.  
Solicita el crédito para comprar ganado, ya que con esto espera aumentar sus ventas al igual que su número de clientela.
Dentro de sus planes esta volverse proveedor exclusivo de carnes para los supermercados. Su meta próxima es poder etiquetar su producto con el nombre de su carnicería  darle una mejor presentación a su producto para atraer mas clientes fuera de Estelí y poder ofrecerle un mejor futuro para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Heberardo is 43 years old. He is from the community of El Regadío, located in the departament of Estelí. He is married and has 4 children. He is a farmer by profession, as well as a merchant. He has been in the cattle butchering business for 2 years.   

He started in agriculture in the community of El Regadío, helping his father with the crops, driving cattle at 6 years old. He went to primary school in his home community, walking there and back every day, since the school was a little far from his house. He did the same in secondary school, until he finished secondary school. Afterwards, he had to work to be able to survive and he began to work in butchering pigs and later cattle. With the first cow he bought and sold he made C$4,000 cordobas. He also was able to transfer his business to the downtown of the El Regadio community, town of Estelí, to sell meat in the local markets of Estelí. He dis this without leaving farming behind, the activity he learned as a child.  
 
He is asking for the loan to buy cattle, since in this way he hopes to increase his sales as well as his customers. 

Among his plans is becoming the exclusive provider of meat to the supermarkets. His next goal is to be able to label his product with his butcher shop's  name, giving his product a better appearance to attract more customers outside of Estelí and be able to offer a better future to his children.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials needed for home improvements.

loans.name: Cruz Absalon

texts.es:
Cruz, de 30 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos, originario de la Concordia, municipio de Jinotega, de oficio agricultor.
Don Cruz dice que gracias a su primer préstamo pudo lograr sacar adelante su cultivo de cebolla , ya que pudo comprar semillas de cebolla , pagar mano de obra , combustible e insumos(abono), pues el esperaba sacar una manzana de siembra de cebolla y logro sacar 2 manzanas superando sus expectativas de siembra , sintiéndose agradecido y satisfecho con el apoyo recibido del crédito.
Solicita un segundo préstamo, para sembrar tomate y repollo. Quiere sembrar una manzana de  tomate que posee una semilla llamada chanti la cual es resistente al invierno, comprar insumos para el tomate como fertilizante, plaguicida para el repollo  y no se eche a perder el cultivo, pagar mano de obra y combustible que es usado para el motor de riego. En esta inversión cuenta con  el apoyo de un amigo cercano quien le ayudara  a vender la producción obtenida.
Este segundo préstamo le facilitara la condiciones de pago de su crédito, sacara mas producción con mayor calidad, espera lograr uno de su sueños que es comprar una camioneta para transportar su producto el mismo fuera de Estelí llevarlo hasta Managua  y ahorrare costos de transporte, mejorara la infraestructura de su casa, el pozo de riego y sobre todo tener ahorros para pagarle a buena educación  a sus hijos. 
Una vez cancelado su segundo préstamo desea continuar  sembrando sus cultivos, incorporarse a sembrar también una manzana de chiltoma , 3 manzanas de frijoles y una manzana de maíz. Dedicarse también a venta y compra de ganado cuando este baja la venta de hortalizas.
texts.en:
Cruz is 30 years old, married, and he has 3 children. He is originally from the municipality of Jinotega in Concordia. He is an agriculturist.

Cruz said that thanks to his first loan he was able to have a good onion harvest. He was able to buy the onion seeds, to hire help, and to pay for fuel and materials (fertilizer). He set out to have one onion plantation but he managed to have 2 plantations, exceeding his expectations. He is thankful and satisfied with the support he received in the form of a loan. 

He requests a second loan to plant tomatoes and cabbages. He wants to plant a plot of tomatoes using a seed called "Chanti" that is resistant to the winter. He will purchase materials for the tomato harvest, such as fertilizers, and pesticides for the cabbage harvest to keep it from going to waste. He will hire help and he will pay for the fuel that is used by the irrigation system. He has the support of a close friend and he will help him sell the products he obtains.

This second loan will help him meet the payment terms of his loan, he will have a greater yield  and of higher quality, and he hopes to reach his dream of purchasing a pick-up truck to  transport his products outside of Esteli and all the way to Managua in order to save  transportation costs. He will improve the infrastructure of his house and his irrigation tank, but above all, he wants to have savings in order to provide his children with a good education. 

Once his loan has been repaid, he wants to keep growing the same products and add to his harvest a plot of chilies, 3 plots of beans, and one plot of corn. He will buy and sell livestock when the sale of produce declines.

loans.use: to grow tomatoes and cabbages

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Él siempre alegre Mario, de 39 años. Vive junto a su esposa Raquel y sus 2 hijos, en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Guacamayo (selva central peruana). Una vez al año cosecha  “achiote”, producto que siembra desde hace 20 años. En todo este tiempo de arduo trabajo y empeño logró adquirir con la ganancia de sus cosechas; 3 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas propios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder negociar sus productos en el mercado de compradores de la ciudad de Pichanaki, pues siente la motivación en cada venta que realiza. Ahora él se está preparando para la cosecha del mes de noviembre, ya que el precio del producto está subiendo en el mercado. Él pertenece al banco comunal “nuevo amanecer de Guacamayo”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde tiene muchas expectativas de poder mejorar sus cultivos con el apoyo de su asociación. Mario, tiene que cuidar de sus cultivos para que puedan crecer y dar buenos frutos. Por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar herramientas para podar sus plantaciones y sacar la maleza que entorpece su crecimiento.
texts.en:
The always-happy Mario is 39 years old and he lives with his wife Raquel and their 2 children.  They live in their own house located in the community of Guacamayo (central Peruvian jungle).  Once a year he harvests achiote. It is a product he has been growing for 20 years. During this time of long and arduous work he managed to acquire with the earnings from his harvests: 3 hectares of farm land. What he most enjoys about his work is to be able to sell his products at the buyers market in the city of Pichanaki. He is motivated by each sale that he completes.

Currently he is getting ready for the harvest in the month of November. The price of the product is rising in the market. He is a member of the communal bank "Nuevo Amanecer de Guacamayo", meaning "A New Dawn in Guacamayo". It is the first loan he has with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he has great expectations to improve his plantations and have good harvests. With his loan he thinks to purchase tools to use in his plantations in order to remove the brush that impedes growth.

loans.use: to purchase tools to remove field brush

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, provincia de Urubamba, Departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra: Tomasa; La socia tiene 64 años de edad, la socia  es casada; la socia tiene 5 hijos de (todos ellos independientes); la socia se dedica a trabajar en agricultura y artesanía, la socia es principalmente artesana y ella dedica la gran parte del tiempo a la artesanía, ella realiza bellos y finos trabajos y hace textiles, para lo cual ella desea comprar materiales, y que le proporcionen los óxidos naturales, que son traídos de las alturas, ella realiza los textiles a mano con una tradicional y ancestral técnica, ella toma varias lanas de oveja de un extremo ayudada por un clavo y las estira todas va tejiendo con sus manos poco a a poco y formando figuras y para ajustar la lana y no quede suelta se ayuda de un pedazo de madera larga, de este modo ella trabaja, la socia pertenece al mercado artesanal en su pueblo y hay la pueden ver trabajando sus textiles y exponiendo los otros que hizo días atrás, la socia requiere el préstamo para la compra de materiales. La socia solicita el préstamo para poder incrementar su capital y comprar materiales.
La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Nueva Victoria - Chinchero", meaning "New Victory - Chinchero". It is located in the district of Chinchero, in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco. 

Her name is Tomasa. She is 64 years old and she is married. She has 5 children (all are independent). Her occupation is agriculture and crafts, although she is primarily and artisan.  She dedicates a great portion of her time to making crafts. She makes beautiful and refined works and she creates textiles, for which she wants to purchase materials and to acquire the natural pigments that are brought from the mountains. She makes her textiles by hand, using a traditional and ancestral technique. She places sheep’s wool in one extreme, held by a nail, and she stretches them and weaving them with her hands to form figures. In order to tighten the wool, to prevent it from being loose, she uses a large piece of wood. This is how she works. She is a member of a crafts market in her village and there she can be observed as she works her textiles and she displays works that were completed in the days past. She requires this loan to purchase materials. She requests a loan in order to increase her working capital and to purchase materials. 

She is happy with the loan she has been granted and she is committed to the established payment terms.

loans.use: to purchase wool and pigments to create textiles

loans.name: Jeanette De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Jeanette madre soltera, tiene dos hijos ya mayores le ayudan con los gasto de la casa, como madre desea lo mejor para sus hijos y que se preparen son unos de sus deseo. Ella trabaja como cocinera desde hace un tiempo.
A corto plazo mejorar la infraestructura son planes para realizar, por medio del financiamiento comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, bloques, piedra cantera, hierro, piedrines, arena, estribus, etc. para levantar las columnas del porche y cambiar el techo. Obteniendo comodidad, seguridad y protección.
texts.en:
Jeanette is a single mother of two grown children who help her with living expenses.  As a mother she wants the best for her children and wants them to prepare themselves.  For some time she has worked as a cook. 

In the short term, she has plans to improve the infrastructure of her home.  With this loan she will buy construction materials like cement, cinder-block, granite, iron, stones, sand, stirrups, etc. to put up columns on the porch and change the roof.  This will give her comfort, security and protection.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to make infrastructure improvements

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 36 years old and has five children between the ages of 3 and 18. All of the children except the youngest are currently enrolled in school.  She rents a portion of lakeside property from the government, which she in turn rents out to fishermen who want to fish within that area.  Angelique’s husband is a fisherman who sells the fish he catches. Angelique and her husband have had this business for four years, which has allowed them to pay for their children’s school fees. With the profits, Angelique intends to build a house on a piece of land which she already owns.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Janviere

texts.en: Janviere is 31 years old and has three children between the ages of 1 and 10, two of whom are in school. Janviere’s husband runs a bar and Janviere owns a general store in which she sells Vaseline, sugar, and a variety of foodstuffs. She has had this business for three years. She is requesting a loan to buy additional inventory of the items she sells in her shop. With the profits, she hopes to buy some fabrics for her home, and to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for her shop.

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.es:
Aurelio A. B., tiene la edad de 74 años, está casado y vive con su señora esposa. El quiere comprar almacigo para la resiembra de su propiedad. El cuenta con la experiencia y el terreno, pero el café ya está en unas condiciones regulares por lo cual él quiere es resembrar las partes más dañadas y seguir con el proyecto apara adelante. El pretende con esto generar ganancias para el bienestar de su familia y también mejorar sus cosechas este próximo año.
Es el segundo  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Aurelio A. B. is 74 years old. He is married and he lives with his wife. He wants to purchase seedlings to replant his land. He has the experience and the land that he needs but his coffee is in a poor state so he wants to replant the most dominated sections and keep on with his plantation. With this he plans on generating an income for the wellbeing of his family and also to improve the harvest for the following year. 

This is the second loan he receives through Fudecosur (Kiva Field Partner). He had not hand previous loans from state banks, but Fudecosur provided him with a loan and with greater benefits, and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: to replant coffee

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en: Consolee is 67 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of 18 and 24. Two of her children are in school, and the other two have already completed secondary school. Consolee’s husband is a farmer and she herself sells sorghum. She has run this business for eleven years, and with this loan she wants to buy more sorghum to sell.  With the profits, Consolee plans to save some, feed her family, and stock a few sacks of sorghum as well.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en: Ernest is 46 years old and has four children between 8 and 21 years old. Ernest‘s wife sells foodstuffs. Ernest mills maize (corn), using a machine which grinds and sifts the corn into flour. Ernest has run this business for eleven years, and the business has enabled him to feed his family and to pay school fees for his children.
