They are:  Mrs. Lorenza E. C. who will use the loan to buy rice by the kilogram, eggs, pork, sausages, vegetables, cream, cheese and corn to prepare her meals; Mrs. Marlen Catalina V. Vázquez who will buy women’s, men’s and children’s shoes on order and to have stock available to offer her customers; Mrs. Agustina C. R. who will buy merchandise like cloth napkins and tablecloths and thread, needles, buttons, elastic, clasps, hooks, etc.; to stock her business, Mrs. Melba García Q. will buy blouses, skirts, pants, sweaters and men’s clothes like pants and shirts.

Mrs. Agustina C. R. is a group member.  She’s 57 years old and finished sixth grade of elementary school.  She’s married and her husband’s a farmer; they have six children:  Porfirio, 42, Ezequiel, 40, Jesús, 38, Héctor, 35, Germán, 32 and Luis, 30.  All the children are married and work.  

She has a business selling notions, toys and women’s articles like perfume, cosmetics and accessories.  She requested her loan to buy merchandise.  She will buy thread, needles, yarn, hoops, napkins and tablecloths to embroider and toys.  Her usual customers are young girls and women.  She offers them notions like napkins to embroider, thread, yarn, embroidery hoops, cosmetics, perfumes, toys and accessories for young girls and young ladies like hairpins, brackets, pendants, etc.  

She started her business 20 years ago needing to support her children.  She taught herself how to go to Mexico City on her own to get her merchandise.  She started out with just a few items.  She wouldn’t spend anything but rather would reinvest all her profits back into the business.  She gradually grew and now she earns profits.

She went to work in the United States for two and a half years and saved up.  When she returned she built her business’ booth so now is able to leave her merchandise there because before she had to take it back and forth from home.  She was also able to vary her merchandise and her business grew still more.  The space where she has her booth is borrowed and is in the town of Moyotepec a block and a half from home; she can walk to it.

Her business is important because it helps her survive, it helps her fill her time and it amuses her while helping her.  When she’s at work she is also working making felt arrangements that a friend is teaching her how to make.  She is proud of her business.  Thanks to God and the effort she’s put into it she is proud to have this kind of business.

Her husband helps her take care of customers and to set up the booth.  Her business is popular because of its location in the market and several people come by to buy.  The challenges she faces are the high costs because if the price of her products rises she has to raise her prices too.  Her business faces competition from another similar one in the market.

She uses profits from the business to cover needs like gas, light and sometimes the telephone and to reinvest.  What she likes are the profits; she has a separate investment already.

Agustina is very happy with this loan because it allows her to stock her business, to become fulfilled and to enlarge it so that it will look prettier.  This business has helped her economically quite a bit.

She’d like to make some home improvements like enlarge some of the bedrooms so that when her children visit with their families they’ll have somewhere to stay.  Her plans and hopes are to continue progressing in her business and continue to save for when she is unable to work any longer.  Her children are adult and take care of their own households.

The group members want to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad:  “Thanks for the support you give us.  We feel good because you are interested in our businesses and, above all, that women better themselves.  You help us a lot with the low interest rates you offer, by charging less interest.  Thank you very much for the support which will be of great help to us.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like thread, needles, yarn and embroidery hoops to embroider napkins and tablecloths and to buy toys.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es: Felicia, de 42 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de sus dos hijos menores; juntos se esfuerzan a diario por salir adelante. Esta trabajadora dama se dedica, desde hace 9 años, a la elaboración de diversos accesorios para mujer como: aretes, collares, pulseras y anillos; realizados en pedrería pequeña que requiere de una labor rigurosa. Ella esta muy satisfecha pues tiene clientes fijos que le compran toda su mercadería y sus ganancias han aumentado bastante, pues ahora se ha hecho muy conocida y no solo vende a comerciantes, sino también a sus amigas y conocidas que la buscan con frecuencia para apreciar y comprar sus últimos diseños. Aunque este es un trabajo muy tranquilo, debe esforzar mucho la vista para acabar lo mejor posible los accesorios. Tiene muchos planes para el futuro, como el de instalar un pequeño bazar en su casa donde pueda ofrecer en una vitrina la bijouteria que ella realiza. Es el sexto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Felicia tiene planeado invertir el crédito, en la compra de cantidad de material en pedrería, pues quiere empezar a producir sus accesorios en mayor cantidad para mejorar sus ganancias y empezar a concretar su negocio futuro.
texts.en:
Felicia, 42, lives in her own house next door to those of her grown-up children.  They work together to get ahead.  For the last nine years, this hardworking woman has been making different kinds of women's accessories, such as: earrings, necklaces, bracelets, and rings; she makes these out of small stones, which is demanding.  She is happy that she has faithful clients, who buy all of her merchandise, and her income has grown considerably--she is now very well-known and sells her goods not only to traders, but also to friends and acquaintances who seek her out to buy her latest designs. It is very quiet work, but she has to focus closely on it in order to make the best possible accessories.  She has many plans for the future, such as opening a small bazaar in her home, where she can display her jewelry in a shop window.  

This is her sixth loan with microfinance partner MFP, and she promises to pay her installments on time.  Felicia plans to use her credit to buy stones so she can start to produce her accessories in greater quantity and thereby improve her income and start to make her future business a reality.

loans.use: Felicia will use this loan of $1,100 to buy stones to make more necklaces and bracelets.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is a member of the communal bank "Alondras" at FINCA Peru in Ayacucho. She is 37 years old, married, and has four children who are all studying. She has a clothing business and also sells vegetables in a local market. She is using her loan of 3,000 PEN to purchase clothing from Lima to sell in Ayacucho. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for four years now and enjoys that it gives her more independence and allows her to save money. She would like to save enough money to buy land in Ayacucho.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell

loans.name: Yolys Lucia

texts.es:
Yolys de 38 años, es una mujer trabajadora que trabaja vendiendo productos Avon y Esika (compañías que vender productos de uso personal a crédito).  

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con las ventas que realiza ya que da a sus clientes una comodidad de pago a crédito. Vende perfumes, cremas, blusas, pantalones etc. Tiene tres hijos de 18, 17, 12 años de edad. Quiere darles una buena vida por eso ella quiere continuar trabajando pero por ahora con el crédito quiere comprar materiales de construcción para su vivienda como cemento, bloques, arena. En el futuro quiere construir su casa de dos pisos para darle una buena vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yolys, 38, is a hardworking woman who sells Avon and Esika products (companies that sell personal products on credit). 

She has a lot of hope for increasing her sales, now that she gives her clients the option of buying on credit.  She sells perfumes, creams, blouses,  trousers, and so on.  She has three children, who are 18, 17, and 12.   She wants to give them a good life, and this is why she needs to continue working, but this loan will be used to buy construction materials for her home, such as cement, cinder blocks, and sand.  In the future, she wants to build a multi-level house so as to give her children better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cinder blocks and cement

loans.name: Senia Margarita

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora en la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora, dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal La Mocora.

Aquí conocimos a Senia ella tiene 37 años de edad, está  soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya por cuatro ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan a personas como ella para salir adelante y poder ser más productivos.
 
Ella trabaja como maestra en una escuela cerca de la localidad donde ella vive, en la actualidad está estudiando una maestría en Gerencia Educativa, es para esto justamente que solicito el crédito para poder seguir con sus estudios ya que cada día debe mejorar sus conocimientos para poder dar una mejor educación a sus alumnos y además porque se les exige en el Ministerio de Educación, ella trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 7am hasta la 13h00 y los sabados y domingos se dedica a sus estudios, nos dice que le encanta aprender para después dar lo mejor a sus estudiantes.

Este crédito es para pagar una parte de su maestría. Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y tener su propia Institución Educativa.
texts.en:
The members of La Mocora Communal Bank meet every 15 days in La Mocora, which is in the Colon parish of the city of Portoviejo. This area is known for its hard-working people, who work in agriculture and ranching. 

Here we meet Senia. She is 37 years old and lives in her parents' house. She has already been a member of the communal bank for four loan cycles, and she likes it for the help that they give to people like herself to advance and become more productive.

She works as a teacher in a school near where she lives. She is now studying for a master's degree in Education Administration. It is exactly for this purpose that she is applying for a loan, so that she can continue her studies. Every day she must improve her knowledge so that she can give a better education to her students, and furthermore, because it is required by the Ministry of Education. She works from Monday to Friday from 7 am to 1 pm. On Saturdays and Sundays she studies. She tells us that she loves to learn so that she can give the best to her students.

This loan will pay for part of her master's coursework. Her dreams are to finish her studies and have her own educational institution.

loans.use: to study for a master's degree

loans.name: Capuchino Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO SE LLAMA "CAPUCHINO" SE ENCUENTRA UBICADO EN EL ESTADO DE MORELOS, MÉXICO. LA SEÑORA YOLANDA C. P. ES INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO, ELLA VENDE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS EN SU COMUNIDAD, SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA A LA SIEMBRA EN EL CAMPO Y LO APOYA EN LOS GASTOS DE LA CASA YA QUE CON LO QUE GANA SU ESPOSO NO ALCANZA PARA EL SUSTENTO DE SU FAMILIA, ELLA DIA A DIA TRATA DE SACAR A DELANTE A SU FAMILIA CON SU VENTA DE SU NEGOCIO, ELLA TAMBIEN ATIENDE LAS LABORES DEL HOGAR. LA SEÑORA YOLANDA SE SIENTE MUY CONTENTA POR LA OPORTUNIDAD DE LE DAN PARA OBTENER UN PRESTAMO E INVERTIR EN SU NEGOCIO. OBSERVACIONES LAS SEÑORAS QUE NO SE VEN BIEN SE LLAMAN HILDA O. Y FRANCISCA B..
texts.en:
The group called “Capuchino” is located in the State of Morelos in Mexico. Sra. Yolanda C. Polbano is a member of the group. She sells fruits and vegetables in her community. Her husband is a farmer and helps her with the household expenses. However, his earnings are not enough to support their family. Day after day, Yolanda tries to move her family forward with the sales from her business. She also takes care of the household chores.

Sra. Yolanda is pleased with the opportunity she has been given through this loan so that she can invest in her business. It should be noted that the ladies whose faces are hidden are Hilda O. and Francisca B..

loans.use: To invest in fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Fabiola Azucena

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora, dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal La Mocora.

La señora Fabiola es socia fundadora del Banco comunal además de ser la presidenta,  le gusta por la puntualidad con que se realiza todo en la institución. Tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos una niña de 10 y un niño de 3 años  de edad, la mayor estudia en  escuela. Su esposo es chofer profesional.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta pero  también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando lleva mercadería. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 11h00 ya que tiene que esperar que llegue su hija de la escuela, luego en la tarde a veces va a vender, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra todas las semanas. Su mercadería  la compra en Portoviejo. Tiene cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido bien.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños, pero de preferencia ropa de temporada. Sus sueños son seguir adelante con su negocio y su vida personal.
texts.en:
The members of the La Mocora community bank meet every 15 days in La Mocora, which is in the parish of Colon in the city of Portoviejo.  Portoviejo  is known for its hardworking folk, who dedicate themselves to farming and ranching.

Fabiola is a founding member of the community bank, as well as its president.  She is well-liked for the prompt way in which she directs the institution.  She is 33 years old, married, and has two children:  a girl of 10 and a boy of 3.  Her daughter is in school.  Her husband is a professional driver.

She sells different kinds of clothing door to door, although she also makes sales out of her home, where clients come when she brings in merchandise.  She works every day from 8 am to 11 am, since she has to wait for her daughter to get home from school; sometimes she also goes out selling in the afternoons. She gives her clients credit and charges them weekly.  She buys her merchandise in Portoviejo.  She has been working in this way for the last five years, and it is going well.

Fabiola will use this loan to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, children's clothing, but above all seasonal clothing.  She hopes to get ahead in her business and in her personal life.

loans.use: to buy trousers, t-shirts, blouses, children's clothing, and seasonal clothing

loans.name: Angela Asunción

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora, dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal La Mocora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Angela, ella tiene 26 años de edad, en la actualidad está separada pero de esa relación tiene una hija de 2 años  de edad. Su ex marido es mecánico automotriz.

Es una gran madre que además de estar al tanto de su pequeña también se dedica al comercio, ella vende productos elaborados en cerámica como centros de mesa, adornos, recuerdos, floreros entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días en su casa que es donde ella vende sus productos por lo frágiles que son. También ella realiza manicura de uñas lo cual lo hace tanto en su casa como a domicilio.  Para comprar su mercadería   viaja todas las semanas a  La Pila que es donde los mejores  artesanos realizan estas obras que son muy apreciadas en todo el país.

Este crédito es para comprar más artesanía. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos y le agrada todo del Banco. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y darle lo mejor a su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank La Mocora meet every fifteen days in La Mocora, which is in the Colon parish of the city of Portoviejo. This area is known for its hard-working people, who work in agriculture and ranching.

Here we meet Señora Angela, who is 26 years old. She is now separated but has a two-year-old daughter from her marriage. Her ex-husband is an auto mechanic.

She is a wonderful mother, who in addition to being attentive to her little one also has a business. She sells ceramic products such as centerpieces, decorations, souvenirs, and flower vases, among other items. She works every day at home, which is where she sells her products, since they are so fragile. She also does manicures, which she does as much in her home as in her customers' homes. To buy her merchandise, she travels every week to La Pila, which is where the best artisans work; their works are well recognized throughout the country.

This loan will be used to buy more handicrafts. Angela has been in the communal back for three cycles, and everything about the bank pleases her. Her dreams are to succeed and to give the best to her little daughter.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts

loans.name: Maryuri Briceida

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora, dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal La Mocora.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Maryuri, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 13, 7 años y el menor de dos meses, los dos mayores estudian  en colegio y escuela. El marido trabaja en una copiadora.
 
Tiene un lugar de distracción en la Mocora la cual  ofrece mucha diversión para toda la familia, cuenta con piscinas para grandes y chicos lo cual en esta temporada pasa lleno, los días que ella abre su local normalmente son los días viernes, sabados y domingos. Además de esto también vende comida para todos los gustos, bebidas y refrescos, para entrar cobra una módica suma por persona. Nos cuenta que lleva con su negocio ya por cuatro años y que gracias a Dios les ha ido muy bien ya que trata de dar el mejor servicio para que sus clientes regresen.

Este crédito es para comprar productos para preparar los alimentos además de sodas, agua, cervezas, entre otras cosas. Ella está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos y le agrada porque con los créditos se ha ayudado mucho. Sus sueños son tener un local mucho mejor.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank La Mocora meet every 15 days in La Mocora, which is in the Colon parish of the city of Portoviejo. This region is known for its hard-working people, who work in agriculture and ranching.

Here we meet Señora Maryuri. She is 30 years old and lives in a common-law marriage from which she has three children of ages 13, 7, and 2 months. The two older children go to secondary and primary school. Her husband works as a distributor.

She has an amusement center in La Mocora which offers fun for all the family. It has pools for adults and children which in this season are full. She normally opens her center on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays. In addition, she sells food for all tastes, beverages, and soft drinks. Entrance costs a reasonable amount per person. She tells us that she has had this business for four years and that, thanks to God, it has gone very well for them, since she tries to give the best service so that her customers return.

This loan will be used to buy products to prepare food, in addition to sodas, water, and beer, among other items. She has been in the communal bank for three cycles, and she is very pleased with it, because she has been able to help herself a lot with the loans. Her dreams are to have a much better place of business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items,  soda, water, beer, etc.

loans.name: Leila Indalecia

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora, dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal La Mocora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Leila, ella tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos todos mayores de edad, de ellos solo su hija menor aun viven con ella. Su esposo es chofer profesional.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y zapatillas, siempre busca lo que está de moda en la  temporada para  tener más salida, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta pero también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando lleva mercadería. Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra todas las semanas. Su mercadería  la compra en Guayaquil. Tiene 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien.
 
Este crédito es para comprar bermudas, trajes de baño, camisetas, blusas, zapatillas, sandalias, entre otras cosas. Sus sueños son seguir adelante con su negocio y su vida personal. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque todas sus amigas son muy cumplidas. Le gustaría viajar al extranjero.
texts.en:
Every fortnight, the members of the 'La Mocora' community bank meet in the town of La Mocora, in Colon parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for its hard-working people who work in farming and livestock raising.

Here we meet 50 year-old Leila who is married and has three grown-up children.  Only her youngest daughter still lives with her.  Her husband is a professional driver.

Leila's business is selling all types of clothes and sneakers.  She is always on the lookout for what is in fashion each season so that she makes more sales.  She makes her sales door to door and also sells products from her home where her customers come when she has merchandise.  She works three days a week in this business and it has done very well.

Leila will use this loan to buy bermuda shorts, swimming costumes, t-shirts, blouses, sneakers, sandals and other products.  Her dreams are to continue to get ahead in her business and her personal life.  She is a founding member of her community bank and she likes it because all her friends are very thoughtful.  She would like to travel abroad.

loans.use: to buy bermuda shorts, swimming costumes, t-shirts, blouses, sneakers, sandals, etc.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.es:
Asuncion tiene 72 años de edad y es viuda. Vive en casa propia con tres hijos mayores.  Vive en Morropon, una ciudad ubicada en el departamento de Piura, a más de 4 horas de Chiclayo, el capital de la región de Lambayeque. 

Desde más de 14 años se dedica al cultivo y mantenimiento de arroz que siembra en un pequeño terreno cerca de su domicilio. Vende sus productos en el mercado local el cual conoce muy bien y se estima un buen precio para su arroz. Asuncion es muy conocida en la zona y cuenta con una clientela muy establecida. Posee buenas referencias personales y laborales de su comunidad urbana.

Desea invertir su préstamo en la compra de fertilizante e insecticida. Espera ampliar su producción de arroz para poder vender más y obtener mejores ganancias. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Ha tenido otros préstamos y siempre cumple con sus obligaciones de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Asuncion is 72 years old and a widow.  She lives in her own home with three grown-up children.  She lives in Morropon, a town in Piura department, more than 4 hours from Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

For more than 14 years, Asunción has been growing and looking after the rice that she sows on a small plot of land near her home.  She sells her produce in the local market which she knows very well and where she gets a good price for her rice.  Asunción is very well known in her area and she has a very well-established customer base.  She has good personal and work references from her community.

Asunción would like to invest her loan in buying fertilizers and insecticides.  She hopes to expand her rice production so that she can sell more and make better profits.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  She has had previous loans and has always made her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Grey Maribel

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora, dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal La Mocora.

Aquí conocimos a  la señora Grey, ella tiene 45 años de edad y es madre soltera de un niño de 10 años de edad el mismo que estudian en escuela. Vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya por cuatro ciclos y le gusta porque a pesar de que esta sola le ha dado el respaldo para tener su propio negocio y así poder darle lo mejor a su hijo.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, zapatos y zapatillas, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 11h00 ya que tiene que esperar que llegue su hijo de la escuela y de 14h00 hasta las 16h00, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra toda los sabados. Su mercadería  la compra en Guayaquil, lleva  10 años que se dedica a esta actividad pero antes ella trabajaba para otra persona hasta que se independizo hace algunos años.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, zapatos, zapatillas, entre otras cosas pero de preferencia de temporada. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Every fortnight, the members of the 'La Mocora' community bank meet in the town of La Mocora, in Colon parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for its hard-working people who farm and raise livestock.

Here we meet Grey.  She is 45 years old and the single mother of a 10 year-old child who is in school.  She lives in her parents' home.  Grey has been a member of her community bank for four loan cycles and she enjoys being a member because, although she is alone, the bank has given her the support she has needed to run her own business and provide her son with the best.

Grey's business is selling all types of clothes, shoes and sneakers.  She makes her sales door to door.  She works every day from 8.00am to 11.00am and then has to wait for her son to come home from school.  She works again from 2.00pm to 4.00pm.  She leaves her goods with her customers on credit and collects payment every Saturday.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil.  Grey has been in this business for 10 years.  She used to work for another person but a few years ago she started working for herself.

Grey will use this loan to buy pants, t-shirts, shoes, sneakers and other seasonal products.  Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, shoes, sneakers and other seasonal products

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en: Marlene is a 38-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a food stall where she sells vegetables/spices.  She lives in Narra, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her food stall selling vegetables and spices, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 11,500. Marlene is borrowing PHP 28,000 so that she could increase the volume of vegetable and spices that she sells in her food stall.  This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 28,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Marlene aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: María Cecilia

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora, dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal La Mocora.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora María, tiene 50 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijas, la mayor está comprometida y la menor de 18 años que estudia en Universidad y aun vive con ella. El marido es chofer.
 
Ella es una gran ama de casa que tiene una tienda de víveres de consumo en su casa, en la cual vende todo tipo de productos como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, etc. trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hija y su esposo le ayudan en su trabajo, los productos los compra en Portoviejo aunque la mayoría de sus productos los recibe en su local.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que dan para generar negocios propios. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que este crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
Every fortnight, the members of the La Mocora community bank meet in the town of La Mocora, in Colon parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for its hard-working people who farm and raise livestock.

Here we meet 50 year-old María.  María lives with her partner and has two daughters.  Her eldest daughter is engaged and her youngest, who is 18, is studying at University and still lives with her.  Her husband is a driver.

María is a great housewife who also has a grocery store in her home.  She sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, etc.  She works every day from 7.00am to 10.00pm and sometimes until later.  Her daughter and husband help her in her work.  She buys some of her products in Portoviejo but most of them are delivered direct to her store.

María will use this loan to better stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and other essentials.  She has been a member of her community bank since the beginning and she likes it for the help that they give people to run their own businesses.  Her goals are to get ahead in her business and for it to grow every day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and other essentials

loans.name: Las Nuevas De Jilo Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO SE LLAMA "LAS NUEVAS DE JILO" SE LLAMA ASI PORQUE ES LA PRIMERA VEZ QUE PIDEN UN PRESTAMO, EL GRUPO SE ENCUENTRA UBICADO EN EL ESTADO DE MÉXICO. LA SEÑORA CELIA G. A. ES INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO, ELLA ESTA MUY ENTUSIASMADA CON EL CREDITO OTORGADO, YA QUE CON ELLO VAN A AUNMENTAN SUS VENTAS EN EL NEGOCIO, ELLA QUIERE EL PRESTAMO PARA INVERTIR EN MATERIA PRIMA EN EL CUAL ARREGLAN CALZADO, SUS CLIENTES MENCIONAN QUE ES UNA PERSONA RESPONSABLE Y CUANDO LLEVAN SUS ZAPATOS A COMPONER ELLA LOS DEJA COMO NUEVAS Y SIEMPRE LOS TIENE A TIPO, ASÍ LOS CLIENTES NO COMPRAN OTROS Y APOYAN A SU ECONOMIA, LA SEÑORA CECILIA ESTA FELIZ YA QUE VA A APOYAR A LA ECONOMIA DE SU FAMILIA Y TENER UNA VIDA MÁS DIGNA Y ESTABLE. OBSERVACIONES, LA SEÑORA QUE NO SE VE BIEN SE LLAMA LIDIA R..
texts.en:
The name of the group is "Las Nuevas de Jilo" and it is called this because it is the first time that they request a loan. The group is located in the state of Mexico. Celia G. A. is a member of the group. She is very enthusiastic about the loan granted to her because she will be able to increase sales in her business. She needs the loan to invest in materials used to repair shoes. Her clients say that she is a responsible person and when they bring their shoes for repair she makes them as good as new and she always has them ready on time. This way her clients don't need to buy new shoes and they are able to save their money. Cecilia is happy that she will be able to contribute to the family's finances and to contribute to a more dignified and stable life. 

Note: The individual that cannot be seen clearly is Lidia R..

loans.use: to purchase shoe repair supplies

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 50-year-old married woman who supports her family by having a fishing business. She lives in Quezon, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. Rose is borrowing PHP 10,000 to purchase fishing supplies.  This will be her fourth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Rose aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: To purchase fishing supplies

loans.name: Thuok

texts.en:
From the province of Kompong Cham, Thuok C. is a 31-year-old mother caring for four children. All of her children are still living in the family home. Thuok C. is a recycling seller, buying used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other countries. The used goods she deals in are mostly leftover electrical wires, cans, old bottles, and plastic items. Her husband works in the construction field as a building worker. 

Thuok C. is concerned that she is can barely use her old bicycle for traveling far away in order to buy used goods, and she dreams of having a vehicle to pick up her goods, but she doesn’t have money yet to buy one. Therefore, Thuok C. would like to borrow a loan to purchase a secondhand motorcycle for her transportation. She intends to use some funds to add with her savings to buy a plot of land for building her a new house. Thuok C. and her young child are in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand motorcycle for her transportation and buy a plot of land for building her new house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a wireless internet antenna

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a 48-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two businesses. She has a small restaurant and makes and sells ice cream. She lives in Puerto Princesa, Palawan. Marissa has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard, Marissa is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 14,000. Marissa is borrowing PHP 19,500 so that she could increase the volume of food that she cooks every day as well as widen the variety of food choices for the people who eat at her small restaurant. She also wants to use part of the money she is borrowing to increase the volume of the ice cream that she sells.

This will be her 19th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Marissa aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for the food she offers in the restaurant

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pâk

texts.en: Pâk S. could earn his daily income by growing rice crops on his own farmland, which comes from his grandparents years ago. He and his wife have spent most their lives farming, since they were single until the present time. Usually, they can make a profit of approximately $2 per day to use for the family’s needs. The couple is blessed with two married children. Previously, Pâk S. had rented a few carpenter laborers to build his wooden house on credit, and it is the time for paying back, but he lacks some money to pay on time. In order to deal with this situation, Pâk S. has decided to ask for a loan to pay for construction costs.

loans.use: to pay for construction costs for his home

loans.name: Mrs. Sarun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The sixteen people who make up this village bank loan will use their portion of the loan for different purposes so it can improve the standard of living of their families.

Mrs. SaR. is the village bank president and has been selected by the other members. She is a farmer who owns a 3-hectare plot of land where she can grow both rice and watermelon to sell to support her family. She has some problems in the crop fields because her fields have infertile soil, so, to improve production, Mrs. SaR. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer.  With the rest of the loan she is going to buy two piglets and plow a field for growing watermelon.

Her husband, Mr. Sin, owns a horse cart. This couple supports seV. children, two of whom are seamstresses in garment factories, while the other three are studying in local public school, and the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mrs. Tep Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The sixteen people who make up this village bank loan will use their portion of the loan for different purposes so that it will improve their family's standard of living.

Mrs. Tep is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. She and her husband, Mr. Voeun, are farmers who own a 1-hectare plot of land where they can grow rice.  They sell some part of the rice and the other part they use to support their family.  He is a construction worker. 

Now she has a problem because her field is far away from an irrigation system. So to improve this situation, Mrs. Tep is asking for a loan to buy a pump machine. She is the mother of two children who are studying in local school.

loans.use: to buy a pump machine

loans.name: Mon

texts.en: Mon V. is a 68-year-old woman, married to Tith Hoeurn, age 64, and both of them work in the field of agriculture as rice farmers in Kompong Tom province. This old couple lives with three married children and all of them are employed in a variety of jobs for a profit. One of their children sells beds from a mobile place by using his trailer to transport his products. Currently, his old trailer has broken down while using this process and it has influenced his selling business. Mon V. actually wants to assist her child, but her present capital is not sufficient to make it possible. To help her son's business, Mon V. has decided to seek a loan in order to purchase a new trailer to replace the broken one so that he can go on selling his furniture as usual.

loans.use: To purchase a new trailer for her son to use in his business.

loans.name: Chun

texts.en:
Chun is a married woman. She and her husband are farmers who own a three-hectare plot of land where they can grow rice. They sell part of the rice and use some for their family. Chun is also a pig breeder. 

At present, she wants to start a new business, but she does not have enough money. She is asking for a loan to add to her savings to buy two cows for breeding. 

She is the mother of five children, two of whom are seamstresses in garment factories, while another one is a teacher, and the others are students.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Sophon

texts.en:
Sophon is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where she can grow rice. She sells some of it and the rest is used for the family.  Her husband, Chan, is a construction worker. Although they try to work hard, they can earn only a little income. 

To improve this condition, Sophon is seeking a loan to start a new business by buying four piglets for breeding and pig food for them.

She is the mother of a child who is five months old.

loans.use: to buy four piglets and pig food

loans.name: Horn

texts.en: Horn is a Khmer cake seller who earns some profits to help support her family. Besides that, she is a pig breeder. Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand, so she is applying for a loan to buy four more piglets and pig food. Her husband, Chamreun, is a construction worker. This couple supports four children, two of whom are construction workers and the other two attend the local public school.

loans.use: to buy four more piglets and pig food

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas S. and his wife are local village cultivators who live in the province of Kompong Tom. He earns a living by planting many kinds of crops on his own farmland, located away from his house. He has eight children, five of whom are married. Four of the children are employed at various occupations. 

Meas S. needs a loan to buy fertilizers, and seed for growing in the dry season. He will invest the rest of the funds in his potato crop. He hopes to get more income from his farming business by using this Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seed for the dry season, and to invest in his potato crop.

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Fedelina is 48 years old and married with seven children. Fedelina works very hard to provide for her family. Fedelina runs a general store in the Philippines and requests a loan of PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more merchandise to sell in her general store.

Fedelina has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, noodles, soft drinks and liquor. Fedelina also earns income with her rice retail business. In the future, Fedelisa would like to expand her business and help her husband with family needs.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to sell in her general store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Samen

texts.en: Samen is a married woman who has a two-year-old child. She is a farmer who owns one hectare of land where she grows rice. She sells part of the rice crop and the family uses some of it. Her husband, Ran, is a firewood seller and a farm laborer. Though this couple tries to work a lot, they can earn only a little income. So to improve this condition, Samen is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Chann

texts.en: Chann is a widow with three children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory. The others attend a local public school. She owns a general store in her local village where she can sell groceries to earn some profit to support her family. She is also a farmer who owns a plot of land where she can grow rice, some of which she sells and some supports her family. She has a problem because her child’s work place is far away from home. So to improve this condition, Chann is asking for a loan to buy a new motorcycle for transportation.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her child to drive to work

loans.name: Eoeun

texts.en: EoeU. was born in 1955 and she owns a general store in the local village where she sells groceries to earn some profit to support her family. She is also a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land where she grows rice, some of which she sells and with the other part she supports her family. She is a widow with a child who is a construction worker. She has a problem because her child’s work place is far away for home. So to improve this condition, EoeU. is looking for a loan to buy a new motorcycle for her child's transportation.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her child's transportation

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en:
Choeun is 47 years old and she is a widow with three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory. Another one is a driver who gets a low salary, and the last one is studying in the local public school. She is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land where she grows rice. She sells part of the rice yield, and with the other part she supports her family. Besides farming, she is also a chicken breeder. 

Currently she wants to start a new business, but her savings is not enough to buy a cow. So to improve this condition, Choeun would like to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely L. is from the village of Calaocan, Angadanan, Isabela. She is 42 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $100 when she sells a raised pig.

In 2010, Fely joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional animals. 

Fely is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Magsarjav

texts.en: Magsarjav is 21 years old and lives with his parents and a younger sister in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live together in a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His parents have been operating a spare truck parts retail business for many years in “Uguumur market”. His two youngest sisters are attending local secondary school. Magsarjav has been running a spare truck parts retail business for the last three years and he adopted this business from his parents. His business is doing very well because brand new spare parts for big trucks are very expensive. He has his own customers and his products are in good demand. In the future, he wants to get a higher education. Therefore, Magsarjav is requesting this loan because he wants to increase his working capital and inventory.

loans.use: to increase his inventory

loans.name: Nuth

texts.en: Making wooden beds for a profit is a part of 59-year-old Nuth N.’s daily routine in the local furniture shop. Nuth N. has been working in this job since 2008, and has a proper salary every month to use for the family. Nuth N.’s wife is a rice farmer who has been earning a revenue by cultivating rice on her existing farmland for many years. They have given birth to five children: three are single and the other two are married. Presently, this family's living condition is not comfortable because some parts of their wooden wall is rotten and it is really so difficult to live in when the heavy rains come. To solve this problem, Nuth N. will use his loan to buy some poles to repair the broken parts of his wall.

loans.use: To buy some poles for repairing the broken parts of his wall.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda O. is from the village of Calaocan, Angadanan, Isabela. She is 56 years old. Erlinda is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a business raising pigs for breeding. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month in these activities.

In 2011, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Erlinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase feed & other supplies

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lydia is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Lydia is 43 years old. Lydia has three children who are in school.

Lydia has a wholesale and retail rice grains business in the Philippines.  Lydia requested a loan of PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase more rice to resell.

For four years, Lydia has been in this business. In the future, Lydia would like her children to finish their education.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of rice to resell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Mrs. Sophea was born in 1976 and is married to Mr. Leng who was born in 1979. They have four children, two of whom are enrolled in the local public school. The others are too small to work or study. She is a weaver and a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she grows rice. She sells some of the rice yield and the rest her family uses. In the rice field, she has some problem because her field has infertile soil. So to improve her rice production, Mrs. Sophea is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan, she is going to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. Her husband is a construction worker. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a cow.

loans.name: Bit

texts.en:
Bit R. is a 42-year-old married woman living in Kompong Tom Province.  She earns a living by growing different kinds of crops on her land in the village. She has been running her business over five years and currently earns around $1.5 in profit each day.  Her husband assists her in planting crops. 

Bit R. has five teenage childR., three of whom are employed -- one is a garment worker and two are construction workers. 

Bit R. says that the height of her house is too short and it is not easy to come in and out. Because of this, she is applying for a loan to add to her personal savings to raise the frame of her house.

loans.use: To improve her house

loans.name: Chhorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhorn was born in 1963.  She is a widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, and the other is studying in a local public school. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land where she grows rice on some parts of the field to sell, and on other parts to feed her family.  She also sells vegetables and fish in local market to earn income to support her family. 

Currently, Mrs. Chhorn is having problems because her field has infertile soil, a lot of insect, and is far away from an irrigation system. To improve her rice production, Mrs. Chhorn is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline to grow rice

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly was born in 1980 and has four children -- two of whom are enrolled in a local public school, and the others are still too young to work or study. 
 
Mrs. Ly and her husband, Mr. Set, are farmers who own a 1-hectare plot of land where they grow rice and vegetables to sell to support their family.  Mr. Set also collects palm juice to sell to earn additional income.  

Mrs. Ly wants to breed a cow, but her savings are not enough to buy one.   To achieve this purpose, she is asking for a loan to add to her savings to buy a cow.

loans.use: buy a cow

loans.name: Aalia's Group

texts.en:
Aalia has been living in Sahiwal for many years with her family in a 4-room brick house. Sahiwal is a small city in Pakistan, known for its agriculture and cattle farming. 

Aalia is 34 years old.  She has 2 sons and 3 daughters. Only one of her children is able to attend school and get an education.  Her husband’s name is M. A. and he is involved in a dairy business. For this business, M. has a buffalo and a cow at his home. He offers his clients good quality milk and has a good number of clients in his community.  Aalia supports her husband in his business by milking the cattle and filling the milk jars. She is also a very good housewife and takes care of her household responsibilities. She tries her best to provide relief to her family with her work. 

Aalia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband's dairy business. By utilizing the loan, he will buy another buffalo to get more milk and increase his sales and profits.  Aalia is confident that a loan investment in her husband’s business will be a good step towards its growth and he will be able to provide better living facilities to their family as a result.  

Aalia is a regular loan user of Asasah's.  This is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself as a responsible client by paying her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.

loans.use: buy a buffalo for her family's dairy business

loans.name: Nget

texts.en:
Mrs. Nget was born in 1947.  She is a widow and has one child who is a construction worker. Mrs. Nget is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell as well as to feed her family.  

At the present, Mrs. Nget has a problem because her son's work place is far away from her home.  To fix this problem, she would like to ask for a loan to add her savings to buy a motorcycle for his transportation.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle for her son to commute to work

loans.name: Mean

texts.en:
Mean P. is 30 and is the mother of two school-aged children. She has been working at a local rubber plantation in Kompong Tom province for a year. Her husband also works at the same plantation. Together they earn about $5.50 a day to meet the needs of the family. 

With this loan, Mean P. will purchase a plot of farmland from a villager in order to cultivate rice crops. This will enable her family to accrue extra profit to meet their daily expenses. 

Note: Mean P. and her two small children are in the picture.

loans.use: purchase a plot of farmland to cultivate rice

loans.name: Soem

texts.en: Mrs. Soem was born in 1946.  She has two children, one of whom is a construction worker and the other does housework.   Mrs. Soem is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell as well as to feed her family.  Her husband, Mr. Sariem, is a consultant.  Mrs. Soem has a problem because her husband’s work place is far away from her home.  To improve this situation, Mrs. Soem is applying for a loan to buy a new motorcycle for his transportation.

loans.use: buy a new motorcycle for her husband to commute to work

loans.name: Khuy

texts.en:
Mr. Khuy was born in 1961.  He is married to Mrs. Oeun.  He is a father of five children, two of whom are seamstresses in garment factories, and the others are attending a local public school.   

Mr. Khuy and his wife are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare plot of land where they grow rice to sell as well as to feed their family.  He also breeds ducks and collects palm juice to earn additional money to support his family. Although he tries to work a lot, he earns very little income.  To improve this condition, Mr. Khuy is seeking a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: buy a cow to start a new business

loans.name: Yum

texts.en: Yum S. is a 29-year-old mother who earns income as a sewing worker in the garment industry.  She has been engaged in her job since 2007 and receives a formal salary. She has a life partner in her husband who is a motor taxi driver in and around Phnom Penh City. The couple helps each other earn money to feed their child, who is still not yet enrolled in school. Yum S. would like a loan of $900 in order to purchase a piece of land in good condition for a farming business. She will rent out this land to farmers for a fee.

loans.use: purchase a piece of land to rent out for farming

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Mrs. Ra, who was born in 1957, is married to Mr. Khe.  They have two children -- one is a laborer, and the other is studying at a local public school. 

Mrs. Ra is a pig breeder and her husband is a farmer who owns a 3-hectare plot of land where he grows rice to sell and to feed his family. Although they try to work hard, their income is very small.  To improve this condition, Mrs. Ra is applying for a loan to add to her savings to buy two cows for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: buy two cows

loans.name: Torn

texts.en:
Mrs. Torn is a married woman, who was born in 1979. Her husband is Mr. Bros. They have three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local public school, while the other child is 7 years old.

She and her husband are both farmers. Indeed, they own a 2-hectare plot of land, where they grow rice. Some of the rice they grow is sold for a profit, while the rest of the rice is used to feed their family. Mr. Bros is also a construction worker and a palm juice collector.

It is time for her to plow her field, which presents a problem for her. As such, Mrs. Torn is seeking a loan to buy two oxen that will be used to plow her field.

loans.use: To purchase two oxen

loans.name: Anwer's Group

texts.en:
Anwer is a married, 57-year-old, very active woman. She does not have any children, and she lives with her husband in a 2-room brick house in the colony of Fateh sher in Sahiwal, where she has lived for the past 30 years. Sahiwal, she explains, is a small city in Pakistan that is known for its agriculture industry. Her husband is 64 years old, and his name is S. A.. He works in court with a lawyer. By doing so, he has an extensive knowledge of the law and court matters.

To earn a living, Answer operates a jewelry-making business. At the same time, she effectively manages her household responsibilities. Due to the high-quality service she provides, she has both commercial (different jewelers throughout the city) and residential clients (community members who place regular orders with her).

Anwer hopes that her loan application through Asasah will benefit her jewelry-making business by increasing her profits. With the loan proceeds, she would like to buy wires, beads, and glue in bulk, which she will use to make jewelry in bulk for re-sale purposes. This would be her first loan through Asasah, and she plans on saving the money she expects to earn as a result of the loan for when she is older.

loans.use: To purchase wires, beads, and glue in bulk for her jewelry-making and -selling business

loans.name: Kaen

texts.en:
Mrs. Kaen is a married woman who was born in 1972, while her husband was born in 1970. They have three children, two of whom are employed in garment factories; their third child is currently studying in a local public school.

They are farmers who own a 1-hectare plot of land. On their land, they grow rice, some of which is sold for a profit, while the remaining portion is used to feed their family.

Her husband is also a construction worker. Unfortunately, her husband's construction work is far from their home. As a result, she is seeking a loan to add to her savings so that she can one day buy a new motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Mrs. Lim is a married woman, and she and her husband have one child. She works as a seamstress in a garment factory. In addition, she is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows rice. She sells some of the rice she grows for a profit, and keeps the remaining portion of the rice to feed their family.

Her husband, Mr. Sorn, is a fish breeder. Because her husband’s business has been doing so well, she would like to help him expand the business. Therefore, Mrs. Lim is asking for a loan to be able to dig more ponds for breeding fish.

loans.use: To expand fish breeding operations

loans.name: Chhavy's Group

texts.en:
This group loan would be provided to four members. Each would use their portion of the loan for a variety of purposes, all of which would be geared towards improving their families' standard of living.

Mrs. Chhavy was selected by the other members as the group's leader. She is a Khmer cake seller and a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land. On her land, she grows rice, which is both sold for a profit and kept to feed her family. She is a widow with five children: three of her children are seamstresses in garment factories, while the other two attend the local public school. Although they work very hard, their family does not earn much income. To improve their lot, Mrs. Chhavy is seeking a loan to start a new business. Specifically, she would like to buy piglets and chickens, and rest of the loan proceeds she would be used to build a breeding area.

loans.use: To start a new animal breeding business

loans.name: Ngvon

texts.en:
Ngvon S. is a 36-year-old rice farmer who lives in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She has a life partner in her husband who works as a leader in the construction field. They are blessed with three children who are studying in the local school. 

Ngvon S. says that her husband lacks some money to purchase more construction materials for his construction business. Ngvon S. doesn’t have enough money to assist him in his business. To overcome this problem, she has decided to request a loan from Kiva to buy equipment for her husband to improve his construction business.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her husband's construction business.

loans.name: Jannat's Group

texts.en:
Jannat resides in Fateh Sher colony which is located in Sahiwal. Sahiwal is a small Pakistani town, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family in a 2-room brick house for the past 20 years. She is 53 years of age and a housewife. It is not easy for her to operate a business and to support her family financially but she makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. 

She is married to A. D. who is a mason by profession. Jannat is the mother of a son who is 27 years old and also does the same business as his father. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son. With the loan, he will buy masonry tools which will help him to work better and earn better profit. 

Jannat is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her son and he will be able to gain maximum benefit from his business. She is a regular loan user with Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: to buy masonry tools for her son.

loans.name: Saret's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of six members who have selected Mrs. Saret to be the group leader. All the members will use their portion of the loan in varied ways to improve their family's standard of living. 

Mrs. Saret was born in 1963. She and her husband, Mr. Yung, are farmers who own a 2-hectare plot of land where they grow rice. They sell some part of the crop and the other part they use to support their family. 

Now it is the dry season, so it is time for growing crops. So to improve their production, Mrs. Saret would like to apply for a loan to do farming. She is a mother of six children, three of whom are seamstresses in garment factories, while the others are studying in the local public school.

loans.use: to do farming.

loans.name: Enkhbat

texts.en:
Enkhbat is 45 years old. He is married and the father of two young men.  His family lives in a small house in the suburbs of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife is a legal advisor at a private company while his oldest son is a section chef at a restaurant.  The youngest son attends university.  In most cases, the family relies on him.

Enkhbat has been operating his transportation business with his small lorry since 2007. He mostly transports goods by his lorry from a construction and building materials market, called Gurvaljin. He has lots of competitors at the market, yet he still has a large number of constant customers. Over the past few years, he managed to pay his sons’ tuition expenses with the profits.
He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) to purchase a new engine and other spare parts that need to be changed. He is working hard to support his oldest son to go to Japan to study.

loans.use: to purchase an engine and other spare parts

loans.name: Mrs. Koem Heang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan contains nine members who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes so it can improve their family's standard of living. 

Mrs. Koem Heang is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she can grow both rice and vegetables for selling to earn some money to support her family.  Her husband, Mr. Then, is a construction worker. Although they try to work hard, they can only earn a little income.

In order to improve this situation, she wants to start anew, but her savings are not enough to support this. Thus, Mrs. Koem Heang is asking for a loan to add to her savings to buy a cow for breeding. She is the mother of three children who are studying in local public school.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kel's Group

texts.en:
The four members who make up this group loan have selected Mr. Kel to become the group leader. They will each use their portion of the loan in varied ways to improve their family's standard of living. 

Mr. Kel was born in 1964 and he is single. He is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land where he can grow rice. He sells some part of the rice yield and the other part he uses to support his family. At present, he lives with his parents who are 82 and 80 years old and he lives with his sister who is a fish and meat seller in the local village where she can earn some money to support her family. 

Since his sister’s business is getting on well, he wants to help her expand it. So  Mr. Kel is asking for a loan to buy more fish and meat for resale.

loans.use: to buy more fish and meat for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to do poultry farming.

loans.name: Haph

texts.en: Haph S., age 41, has been living with her five family members for years in a small house along the village road in the province of Siem Reap. Haph S. and her husband earn their profit by fishing around the river, earning $4 a day. The family always goes to catch fish, in and around Tunle Sap River. Presently, the quantity of fish caught has decreased because some of their fishing equipment is broken. Therefore, Haph S. has requested a loan in order to buy nets and a new boat to replace their broken one.

loans.use: to buy nets and a new boat to replace the broken one.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Yegon

texts.en:
Yegon is 24 years old, single, and a resident of Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been doing poultry farming for two years now with his egg produce being sold to the local market. He has employed one farmhand. He earns additional income from dairy and tea farming.

Yegon has requested for this loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to expand his poultry business. He believes the expansion will generate enough income to repay the loan and he can save the rest for greater expansion.

Yegon says animal feed and treatment of poultry are a great challenge since they involve heavy expenses. He is grateful  for the support Juhudi gives farmers.

loans.use: to do poultry farming.

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar is 37 years old and a housewife, who stays at home and performs her household responsibilities. She is a mother of a 15-year-old daughter who helps her in completing her household tasks. Kosar couldn’t provide her daughter with an education due to financial crises. She lives with her family in a small city called Sahiwal. Sahiwal is famous for its agriculture industry and can be found in Pakistan. Her home is located in the colony named Fateh Sher. 

She is married to M. R.. He is a rickshaw driver by trade. He provides transport facilities to the passengers and earns income for the family. He also provides pick up and drop off facilities for school children. 

These days, the engine of his rickshaw is out of order and needs repair work for which reason Kosar has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. Kosar is hopeful that through the loan, her husband will be able to repair his rickshaw and will be in a position to provide better transport services to his passengers.  

Kosar is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: to repair a rickshaw.

loans.name: Hab

texts.en: Hab V., age 57, sells fresh fish that she buys from her regular suppliers or fishermen. Hab V. sells to her neighbors in and around her village. She is a widow who is blessed with six children; five of them are married and live separately, while the other one is single. She has a few sons who sometimes fish to earn money. In order to earn additional income and make her business more successful, Hab V. is requesting a loan to expand her capital in order to buy more fresh fish for resale.

loans.use: to expand her capital in order to buy more fresh fish for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Roza's Group

texts.en:
Roza D. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Kochkor, a nice village in the Isykul region. She is 55 old and married to a taxi driver. Together with her husband, she has raised two sons; both of whom are engaged in farming. In order to earn money to cover family expenses, the family cultivates agricultural products. Selling part of their harvest, they earn 5000 soms per month. Roza and her husband are also engaged in cattle breeding. With money received from the loan they will purchase more cattle for breeding.

Where Did This Loan Come From?

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our lending team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, 51, is a farmer in Nyamira town in Western Kenya. He is married with seven children between 3 and 22 years old. Five of the children are still in school. His mixed farm produces tea, which he sells through Kenya Tea Development Authority and beans, onions and milk, which are sold to the local market. He also relies on his pension pay to cater to the basic needs of his family. 

He has requested a loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes the income from the dairy project will cater to the education of the children still in school. He is focusing on acquiring more acreage to expand his farm and requesting more loans in the future.

He, however, laments that the markets are not offering good prices and pests and diseases are a great challenge to business.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is age 44 and a farmer from Nyamira town in Western Kenya. He is married with five children between 1 and 13 years old. He has been doing mixed farming for 12 years, producing cabbages, sugarcane and bananas all of which he sells locally. He earns additional income from employment.

Thomas has requested for this loan 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He believes the dairy cow will generate enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The extra income from this loan will help improve his family's living standard as well as pay school fees for the children. He is also focusing on buying a motorbike to help in transporting the produce to the market in future.

Thomas, however, faces the challenges of poor roads, price fluctuations and pests. He remains optimistic on successfully repaying the first loan and requesting more.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mairamkul's Group

texts.en:
Mairamkul T. is the treasurer of this group. She is 29 and married to a constructor. Together with her husband, she brings up two daughters.  The first daughter studies at school and the second is preschool age (under seven). In order to earn money to meet family needs, the family breeds livestock animals.  They also cultivate agricultural products. With money received from the loan, Mairamkul wants to purchase some livestock for breeding. In the future she dreams of purchasing a piece of land and building a new house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: William

texts.en: Thirty-seven-year-old William S. has been involved in this fishing business in Kiwanga-Mpigi for six years. For the most part, he sells the fish he catches to fish sellers in and around his neighborhood. The happily married father of four says he also does some farming. In his plantation, he mostly grows bananas, cassava, maize, sorghum, and millet. Before he was working in the above businesses, he ran a retail shop. This business generates a weekly income of 160,000 shillings per week as profits. He says that with this loan, he is going to purchase a new boat.

loans.use: to purchase a new boat.

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en:

To make a living, Carlito owns & operates a business selling a variety of vegetables in the local community. Carlito has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Carlito joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carlito is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Carlito from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark has been practicing mixed farming for the last 20 years in Kitale town, western Kenya. His mixed farm produces milk, maize, beans, vegetables and tomatoes, which are all sold locally. He also owns a motorbike that provides transport services to the local people.

Mark is 43 years old and married with seven children whose ages range between 4 and 20. Six of the children are currently attending school.

He has requested a loan of 30,000 KES through Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, for poultry farming. The extra income from this loan will help him provide for the basic needs of his family and pay for the education of his children. He hopes to expand his farming activities in the next five years and expand his market coverage as well.

loans.use: Poultry farming.

loans.name: Hab

texts.en:
Hab T., age 71, is a mother of seven children: five are single, still living under her care; two are marred and live separately. 

To earn a living, Hab T. is a fish trader. She has operated this business since 2003 and is able to make $5 USD each day. She has another income earner, her husband, who catches fish in and around Tonle Sap Lake. Currently, the quantity of fish is not much as before because of they are lacking fishing tools. Hab T. has requested a loan in order to purchase fishing equipment for supporting her husband's fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment to support her husband's business.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married and has one teenage daughter. She owns a small retail business selling women's clothing. Her kiosk is located at a small market in Melitopol town. She makes about 5,000 Grivnas per month. Svetlana started this business 11 years ago. She offers good quality products to her clients at affordable prices. Svetlana has many repeat clients that come back to purchase new clothing from her.

Svetlana would like to receive a loan of 12,000 Grivnas to increase her cothing assortment, especially of spring inventory. She hopes to increase her income and to improve the living conditions at her apartment.

loans.use: to increase her assortment of women's clothing.
