Elles se réunissent tous les mois pour des activités d'épargne et de prêt et de parler également des perspectives de leur Banc Villageois. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de Keur Khaly

Madame Fatoumata D. (debout tout à fait à droite sur la photo, emmitouflée avec une écharpe blanche et portant des lunettes) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Elle a aussi la responsabilité de deux autres enfants de son mari. 

Elle fait du petit commerce d'huile de palme, de poissons séchés et de pâte d'arachide. Elle fait aussi de la broderie à la main. Elle a une expérience de plus de 6 ans dans le domaine du petit commerce.

Son financement augmentera sa capacité d'autofinancement afin de d'accroitre son activité

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de leur progéniture tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne dans le Banc Villageois
texts.en:
The solidarity group BOKK JOM was established on February 16, 2000. It is composed of 16 women from the same administrative department, but not from the same neighborhood. They get together every month for savings and loaning activities, as well as to discuss perspectives for their Banc Villageois. The group belongs to the Keur Khaly Banc Villageois.

Mrs. Fatoumata D. (standing on the far right in the photograph, wearing a white scarf and glasses) is the group leader. She's 47 years old, married, and the mother of seven children. She also has to support two other children of her husband.

She retails palm oil, dried fish, and peanut paste. She also does embroidery. She has an experience of more than 6 years in commerce.

This loan will bolster her self-financing capacity in order to expand her business. Her goal is to support her husband in providing for their children, while at the same time boosting her savings.

loans.use: to buy 40 liters of palm oil, 2 baskets of fried fish, and peanuts to transform

loans.name: Nana Ekua

texts.en:
Nana Ekua K. operates a device to extract palm oil in Jukwa which is near Abura in Cape Coast. Nana buys baskets of palm fruits and with the help of the device you can see in the picture she extracts the oil which then is sold by street vendors. 

Nana sees the potential of her business growing if she can only purchase larger quantities of palm fruits. This is the reason why she applied for a loan. She will use the money to buy the needed palm fruits to satisfy the needs of more customers. 

Nana is divorced and is taking care of three children. Most of the money is used to feed her children and send them to school. The little which is left will be reinvested to keep her business running.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of palm fruits.

loans.name: Muoy

texts.en:
The woman shown in the picture is Muoy S., 38, a fisherman who resides in Siem Reap province. She and her husband usually need to take at least eight hours per day to fish, in and around Tunle Sap River. They catch about 10 kilos of fish a day and sell them in bulk to their regular customers who are retail sellers in the market. The couple is blessed with two young children who are still enrolled in school. 

Muoy S. will use her loan to purchase nets and a boat and other fishing implements for fishing purpose.

loans.use: to purchase nets and a boat, and other fishing implements.

loans.name: Miujiza Group

texts.fr: Bwira B. est entrepreneur,leader du groupe d’affaire Miujiza,âgée de 40 ans,mariée,mère de 8 enfants qui étudient tous.Son mari est vendeur des habits (friperie).La  cliente  Bwira B.  fait aussi le petit commerce, parfois elle s’entraide avec son mari dans le commerce de friperie.Elle installe ses marchandises au marché sectoriel de Nyabushongo.Vers 1998,elle démarra son activité avec un fonds propre reçu de son mari.En 2009, elle bénéficia de premier crédit de l’IMF Hekima pour renforcer son capital.Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec des nouvelles marchandises des habits friperie(2 ballons de friperie). En plus,elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, agrandir sa maison pour qu’elle soit spacieuse.La cliente Bwira B.  remercie l’IMF Hekima pour ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Le groupe Miujiza est constitué de 35 membres.
texts.en:
Bwira B. is an entrepreneur, and the leader of the Miujiza group. She's 40 years old, married, and the mother of eight children who are all studying. Her husband sells secondhand clothing. She sometimes helps her husband with his business, but she also retails on her own at the Nyabushongo sectoral market.

She started her business around 1998, with her own funds that she received from her husband. In 2009, she got her first loan from Kiva's partner, the Hekima MFI, in order to bolster her capital.

This new loan will be used to buy two bales of secondhand clothing. Additionally, she ambitions to expand her business and her home, to make it more spacious. Bwira B. thanks Hekima for its actions targeting poor women who do not get access to loans from regular banks. Miujiza group comprises 35 members.

loans.use: to buy two bales of secondhand clothing

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Zinabala Nasuuti Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
36-year-old  M. Annet has now been working in her tailoring business in Nasuuti-Mukono for four years. Annet who is single with no children yet says she began this business out of her own enterprise. Before that she was in more of a wits' ends situation. She cites diligence as one variable which has kept her business growing by leaps and bounds. 

Weekly she says this business generates shillings 65,000 as profits and she says with this loan, she is going to purchase more cloth and materials for making clothing. Annet belongs to Zinabala Nasuuti Development Group-Mukono.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth and materials for making clothing.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama W. is a very hard-working woman, striving to take care of her three children. She is divorced and does not get assistance from her ex-husband. To make sure her children get something to eat every day and can also go to school, she has two jobs. Besides selling food items, she cooks yams for sale. With the help of the money from the loan she would like to increase her stock to be able to serve more customers. She needs the income to secure the well-being of her family. (In the picture you can see Ama arranging her goods.)

loans.use: to expand the inventory of her little provisions stall.

loans.name: Asi

texts.en: Asi Y. sells cooking pots and coal-pots in the market of Jukwa near Abura. Asi's husband passed away and she is left alone with her three children. Most of her income is being used for the well-being of her children. It is also very important for her that they get the chance to go to school. In order to make this possible she tries to provide school books and other learning materials. But she is struggling and would like to see her business grow to get more profit out of it. Therefore she will use the money from the loan to buy more goods and offer her customers a larger variety. (In the picture, Asi is showing one of the cooking pots she sells.)

loans.use: to buy more goods for resale.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Madame Awa est une femme de 48 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de sa maman alitée depuis plusieurs années. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Keur Khaly depuis le début en 2000. Elle est membre du comité de gestion et occupe le poste de trésorière. 

Elle fait du petit commerce de chaussures, de bijoux et de vêtements. Elle s'approvisionne à la capitale (Dakar) et à Ngaye (une ville artisanale) environs à 20 km. Elle a une bonne expérience du petit commerce pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis son jeune âge, avant qu'elle ne se marie.

Son nouveau crédit 500.000 francs CFA lui permettra de mieux développer son activité et de l'accroitre

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari qui est malade depuis plus de dix ans. Elle prend entièrement la charge de ses enfants tout en maintenant son activité qui lui procure des revenus financiers
texts.en:
Mrs. Awa is a 48-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of five children. She also takes care of her mother, who has been bedridden for several years. She joined the Banc Villageois of Keur Khaly at the beginning of 2000. She is a member of the management committee and holds the position of treasurer.

She runs a small business selling shoes, jewelry and clothing. She gets her merchandise in the capital (Dakar) and in Ngaye (a craft city) about 20 km away. She has a good experience of small businesses from having been engaged in such activities from a young age, before she got married.

Her new loan of 500,000 FCFA will allow her to better develop and expand her business.

Her goal is to support her husband who has been ill for over ten years. She bears the full responsibility of providing for her children while also sustaining her activity, which generates financial income.

loans.use: To order 50 pairs of shoes, buy jewelery and clothing to sell

loans.name: Maame Afia

texts.en:
Maame Afia G.' work days take place at the market in Jukwa near Abura which is close to Cape Coast. After getting there in the morning, she arranges her goods like rice, canned tomatoes, fried fish or groundnuts and starts selling. Maame Afia went through junior high school and has been a market woman for the past seven years. She is married to a teacher and has two children with him. 

With the money she makes she assists her husband in the payment of schooling materials for their children and utility bills. Her dream for her children is a high school education. In order to make sure this is going to happen, she wants to use the money from the loan to grow her business and increase her profit. To achieve this goal she will buy more goods and offer her customers a greater variety.

loans.use: to buy more goods and offer her customers a greater variety.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa M. has been a market woman for six years now, working at the market of Jukwa near Abura. She sells provisions like corn, salt and plantains as you can see in the picture. Plantain is used for lots of different dishes is Ghana and one can prepare it in a lot of different ways. 

Yaa is a widow and has four children to take care of. She is hoping for a loan to be able to invest into her business and see it grow. She would like to purchase larger quantities of goods and thus sell more. Education for her children is the highest priority and to ensure this privilege for her children she works hard.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of the goods she sells.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa K. is the mother of three children. Her husband passed away so it’s just her looking after them. In order to provide food and clothes for them she works hard. It is also very important for her that they can go to school. To be able to do all this, Adwoa works at the market of Jukwa near Abura. She sells different kinds of vegetables and specialized in plantains and cocoyams. 

In the picture, you can see her presenting her goods to her customers. She is hoping to expand her business with the help of the loan. Her plan is to buy additional goods to provide a greater variety and attract more customers. With the new profits from her business she will be able to take good care of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to provide a greater variety in her inventory.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
As you can see in the picture, Ekua S. sells yams. She does this at the market of Jukwa which is a community near Abura close to Cape Coast. Yams can be prepared in lots of different ways and are very common in Ghana. Ekua is divorced and takes care of her four children by herself. To do this she uses the income from her business. 

Sometimes she struggles and wishes to have a more solid financial foundation. That’s why she would be very happy to boost her business with the help of a loan to increase her profit. In order to achieve this goal she is planning to buy more yams and thus sell more. She hopes to be able to take good care of her children with the newly earned profit.

loans.use: to buy more yams to sell.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba A. has a small wooden stand on the roadside in the town of Jukwa which is near Abura close to Cape Coast. She sells fried fish and smoked fish of different kinds. Several times a week she prepares the fish at her place. 

Aba is hoping for a loan because she would like to buy more fresh fish in order to be able to prepare more fish so she can then sell to her customers. Aba is married to an electrical repairman and she assists him in taking care of the family needs. With the new profits of her expanded business, she hopes to be able to save some money for their children’s education which is very important to her and her husband.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to fry or smoke for sale.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia K. is a market woman from Jukwa near Abura. She sells vegetables such as garden eggs (a kind of eggplant), okra, plantains and others. Over the past five years her business has been slowly growing but due to the lack of capital, Afia can’t make any great leaps forward. That’s why she is hoping for a loan to be able to boost her business by investing that money. She is planning to buy more goods and sell more as a result. 

Afia is married to a farmer. Together they have four children. She already assists her husband with the money she makes with her business but her dream is a high school education for her children. With the new profits from her expanded business she will get closer to that dream.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
With her husband who is a cocoa farmer, Abena Z. and five their children live in Jukwa near Abura which is close to Cape Coast. Together with her husband she takes care of the well-being of the family. In order to do this she works as a palm oil extractor. 

Abena buys palm fruits and processes them into oil she then sells. Palm oil is the most common cooking oil used in Ghana and therefore part of most traditional dishes. She believes that she could satisfy a lot more customers if only she had the financial means to expand. She would like to purchase larger quantities of palm fruits to be able to produce more oil. That’s why she is hoping for a loan so she can make that needed investment.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of palm fruit  to produce more oil.

loans.name: Cecilia Adwoa

texts.en:
Cecilia Adwoa D. B.T.C. makes soap and sells it at Jukwa near Abura. This locally made soap is often prepared in the home and can be used for bathing, washing, and so on. In addition she also sells toothpaste and toothbrushes. She does this by carrying her goods in a large bowl on her head. She is married and has seven dependants. Her husband is a carpenter. 

Cecilia has been working at this job for nine years now. Slowly the business has been growing. From the loan she expects a significant development of her business. She would like to expand her business by producing more soap and buying more toothbrushes and toothpaste. Cecilia intends to use the newly earned profit to make sure her children receive a solid school education.

loans.use: to produce more soap and buy more toothbrushes and toothpaste for resale

loans.name: Tamarsu Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Tamarsu” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean leones for each one. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Marie B. is the leader of this group. The 24-year-old is married to a motorbike taxi driver and they have 2 children. Marie has been a businesswoman for 5 years now; she sells window curtains, door curtains, birthday cards, celebrity calendars, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current ones.

loans.use: to buy curtains, cards, calendars, etc. for resale

loans.name: We All Na One;  Slkn-000776-001 Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “We All Na One” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Saffiatu S. is the leader of this group. A native of Mano Dasa village, Saffiatu is married to a businessman and the couple has three children. Saffiatu has been a trader for approximately 40 years now. She sells market food: rice, palm oil, beans, peppers, Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), onions, etc.  With her share of this loan,  she will buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil, beans, peppers, Maggi, onions, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional items to prepare breakfast for sale.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 25 years old, married and has two children.  For five years, he has been running a barber shop.  He has been able to run his business well because he has been trained in business management by Faulu Kenya.  He has also learnt how to save his money and budget.  

He hopes to open another business in the future.  He has requested 30,000 Kes to buy shampoo and disinfectants.

loans.use: to buy shampoo and disinfectants.

loans.name: Hellen Penina

texts.en:
Hellen penina N. is 23 years-old and the married mother of two children. Hellen is a farmer and, four the last four years, she has farmed on her own piece of land.

She learned about Kiva partner KADET LTD from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her first loan and she plans to spend it to buy farm supplies and to purchase livestock for fattening. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Hellen's dream is to educate her children to a higher level and expand her farming.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and purchase livestock for fattening

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is 43 years old. She is married with one child who is three years old. Prisca is requesting her first loan from Kiva partner Vision Finance Company. She needs the loan to purchase more clothing to sell at her market stall. She has been in business for three years and has one employee in her shop. She works daily from 8am until 5:30pm.

Prisca has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy more clothing for her business. With her additional profits, Prisca will build her own house and pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more eggs and fruit to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy maize flour, sugar and cooking fat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of maize, potatoes, and eggs.

loans.name: Sattor

texts.ru: Худойкулов Саттор проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 50 лет. Женат. Имеет 2 детей. Жена домохозяйка. Сам Саттор имеет среднее образование. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 30 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Sattor K. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. 50 years old. Married, with two children. His wife is a homemaker. Sattor makes a living by raising cattle. He has been in this line of work for over 30 years. He is taking out a loan in order to purchase cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia A. is single and for the past six years, she has been selling "kenkey" (a Ghanaian staple made of fermented maize dough) and fried fish at Nkroful, near Takoradi. 

Cecilia wants to grow her food business. She will use her loan to purchase more maize to increase her production of kenkey. She will save up any additional profits that she earns.

loans.use: to purchase more maize to increase her production of "kenkey".

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of beans, groundnuts and condiments.

loans.name: Maame Aba

texts.en:
Maame Aba E. has been operating a chop bar (a small food business) for six years at Nkroful, near Takoradi. She is married to a plumber and they have six children. She uses her earnings to pay for household expenses. 
Her loan will be used to buy more food items to cook for sale. She plans to save up the new profits from her expanded business.
At the time of visitation,  Aba had not prepared food for the day, and so had to show some bottles of drinks she serves to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more food items to cook for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice and beans to increase her sales.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is 32 years old and a farmer.  He has been farming for over five years.  He is also employed as a taxi driver. He is able to run his farming business well because the climate of Kiambu is suitable for farming.  He hopes to be a large-scale farmer in the future.  He believes that through Faulu Kenya, he will grow his business.  He has requested 15,000 Kes to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Dorithy

texts.en:
For the past five years, Dorithy A. has been selling general provisions, cooked food, and drinks at Nkroful near Takoradi.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a spare parts dealer.  She is responsible for the payment of household expenses. 

Her loan will be used to buy additional provisions, drinks and other items to serve her increasing numbers of customers.  She plans to save up any extra profits she earns.

loans.use: to buy additional provisions and drinks

loans.name: Enos

texts.en:
Enos A. M. is a married man. He and his wife have two children, aged five and three years old. His business is located at Kongowea Estate in Mombasa,  Kenya.  Mombasa is in the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attraction sites, in addition to the Indian Ocean's white beaches. 

Enos owns a barber shop in which he takes care of men's hair. He has been in this business for five years and has two employees. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is the unavailability of enough water in the area. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

He is using his loan of Kes 10,000 to buy a shaving machine. He hopes to grow his business, open a salon and, in the future, open a beauty college.  He also hopes to give his children a quality education to the university level. He describes himself as faithful.

loans.use: to purchase a shaving machine

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 23 years old, married, and the father of one child. He has been operating a taxi business for more than two years. He dreams of owning more taxis in order to become financially stable. He also does dairy farming to supplement his family’s income. He has been able to improve his businesses, and therefore, his standard of living. He has requested a loan of 10,000 KES to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Teglorma Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “TEGLORMA” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Kenema, a city in easterh Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Musu K.. Musu is 37 and was born in a town called Tongor. She is currently residing in Kenema, together with her husband and two children. Her husband is a teacher and her children attend school. For 17 years, Musu has been selling rice and palm oil. With her share of this loan, she will buy rice and palm oil at wholesale prices to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice and palm oil at wholesale prices to expand her business.

loans.name: Oneness Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Oness” group. They are small scale businesspeople based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan that these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Isatu D.. Isatu is age 26. She was born in Sebaboh village but is currently residing in Kenema, together with her husband and one child. Her husband is a trader and her child is attending primary school. For 9 years now, Isatu has been selling market food – salt, groundnuts, onions, etc. With this loan, she will buy salt, groundnuts, onions, and many more items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy salt, groundnuts, onions, and many more items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Loma Guazu Group

texts.es:
El comité está compuesto por 15 integrantes muy trabajadoras y sacrificadas, la mayoría debe trabajar y generar ingresos para mantener el hogar.
La Sra. Laura A. es la presidenta de dicho comité, vive con su marido e hijos, posee una pequeña despensa en su hogar que le ayuda al sustento de su familia. El crédito que percibe de parte de la fundación le sirve para invertir en su negocio y de esa manera crecer comercial y económicamente.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of 15 members who are very hard-working, devoted women.  Most of them must work to generate an income to cover their household expenses.

Mrs. Laura Auqino is the president of the group.  She lives with her husband and children.  She has a small grocery store in her home that allows her to help maintain her family.  The loan she receives from the foundation will be invested in her business so she can grow in sales and earnings.

loans.use: To purchase sweets, fruit, beverages, vegetables, legumes, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en:
Clarisse is 23 years old and is still single. She is the only one in her family who works. For that reason, Clarisse works hard in order to provide everything necessary for her family. She owns a small business selling various products such as body lotion, water and soap. Clarisse has 3 years of experience in this business and her business is well-organized. The hours of her shop are from 6am until 10pm every day.

Clarisse has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more goods to sell. Clarisse hopes to earn more profits, which will allow her to save money for her future. Clarisse will build a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make advance payments for greater quantities of frozen chicken, to grow her business.

loans.name: Edik

texts.en:
Edik G. was born in 1966. He lives in Ijevan city. Edik is married and has three children. His elder daughter is married and lives separately.  His younger daughter and his son go to school. Edik’s wife is at home. 
Since 1990, Edik has engaged in auto servicing. Now he is renting a workshop where he repairs cars, but he also has his own dilapidated workshop.  He is asking for a 600.000 AMD loan to reconstruct this workshop. This will allow him to run his business at his own workshop and thus cut down his business expenses.
This is Edik’s third loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To reconstruct his dilapidated workshop

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa B. sells food items including fish, peppers, garden eggs and tomatoes at Jukwa Market, which is a big market, near Abura, Cape Coast. She has been doing this for two decades now. Adwoa is married to a mason and they have six children. 
The family depends on her income to pay for school fees and utility bills. Adwoa wants to expand her business and plans to use her loan to buy more bags of garden eggs to increase sales. She intends to reinvest the new profits back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: to buy more bags of garden eggs to increase sales.

loans.name: Target Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “Target” group. They are small-scale business people in the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva.  With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and better profit. Consequently, their living standards will improve.   They can at least provide three meals a day for their children, pay their school fees, buy them clothes to wear, and pay their medical bills in case any of them falls sick. 

Mabinty T. is the leader of this group. Mabinty was born in Magburaka.  She is 30 years of age, married to a trader, and has one child who is in primary school. Mabinty sells palm oil, rice, and groundnuts. With the help of this loan, she will buy more of these goods at wholesale prices.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, rice, and groundnuts at wholesale prices

loans.name: Rowalla Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Rowalla” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking their first loan to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Aminata C..  Aminata is 35 years old and was born in the village of Rowalla.  She is married with four children. Her husband is a businessman, and their children are all in secondary school.  For more than four years now, Aminata has been selling drinks, soap, and brushes. With this loan, she will expand her business by purchasing more of these items to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy drinks, soap, and brushes to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio Santa Lucia de la cuidad de Caacupe que dista a 17 km de la oficina regional de dicha ciudad.
La presidenta del comité es la señora Lidia F., vive con su marido y sus hijos, ella trabaja como locutora de radio y en sus ratos libres trabaja en venta de comestibles, ella como también sus compañeras están muy satisfechas con el apoyo económico que les están brindando la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva.
Con este capital las señoras están aumentando sus pequeños negocios y así también sus ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
Las señoras están en el ciclo Nº 2 con sus 12 integrantes.
texts.en:
The women in this group are from the Santa Lucia District in the city of Caacupe, which is 17 km from the regional office.  The president of the group is Mrs. Lidia F..  She lives with her husband and children and works as a radio announcer.  In her free time she sells groceries.  The members of the group are very grateful for the financial support they are receiving from the Paraguaya Foundation and Kiva.

With these funds they are expanding their small businesses and increasing their earnings so they can have a better lifestyle.  The 12 members are in their second year.

loans.use: To buy meat, fruit, bakery goods, beverages and vegetables

loans.name: Amalya

texts.en:
Amalya M. was born in 1955. She has three children, who are already married and live separately from their mother.  Amalya lives in the Azatamut area of Ijevan and has been running her own business. Over 10 years she has been selling food, clothes and household goods. Thanks to income from her business, she can make a living and also buy some furniture for her apartment.  

This is Amalya’s fourth loan from Nor Horizon.  She is asking for a 500,000 AMD loan to buy household goods and spring season clothes to resell.

loans.use: To buy household goods and spring season clothes to resell

loans.name: Santos Ruben

texts.es:
El señor Santos Rubén tiene 54 años de edad, vive en la Urbanización San Juan de Dios al oeste de nuestra ciudad y el trabaja como taxista con una experiencia de quince años en esa actividad, tiene cuatro hijos que dependen de él económicamente su esposa se encuentra en España tuvo que salir del país ya que la situación no es la mejor para poder conseguir  una mejor vida para sus hijos.

Ruben tuvo problemas hace como ocho años atrás con su hijo mayor ya que ellos tenían un vehiculo con el cual tuvieron problemas ya que el tuvo un accidente en el cual se perdió el auto y también estuvo a punto de perder su casita y esa fue una de las razonas por la que decidió irse a España ya que Ruben se encontraba enfermo y el no podía salir solo adelante.

El solicita el crédito para la compra de un tanque de gas natural para su nuevo vehiculo y de esa manera poder salir adelante ya que el es un hombre trabajador y muy responsable y lucha con sus hijos y su esposa que se encuentra allá, para salir adelante y de esa manera poderle ofrecer un mejor nivel de vida para sus hijos .
Su hija se encuentra en la universidad estudiando la carrera de Derecho y sus otras hijas están en el colegio, el quiere trabajar y luchar porque sus hijas puedan terminar la universidad y tener una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Mr. Santos Rubén is 54 years old and lives in the San Juan de Dios residential area west of the city.  He has worked as a taxi driver for 15 years.  He has four children who are dependent on him financially.  In order to give their children a better lifestyle his wife had to leave the country because of financial hardship and now lives in Spain.

Ruben ran into problems eight years ago when his eldest son had a car accident, and they lost the car.  When they almost lost their house his wife moved to Spain because Rubén was too ill to do so and couldn't have made it on his own.

He is requesting a loan to purchase a natural gas tank for his automobile.  In this way he will be able get ahead since he is a hard-working, responsible person trying his best, together with his wife, to provide all they can for their children.

His daughter is studying Law at the university and his other daughters are in school.  He wants to work hard to make sure they also can obtain a college degree and enjoy a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase a natural gas tank for his automobile

loans.name: C4808 Ahazaza Group

texts.en:
Juvenal is the president of a group called “Ahazaza”, which has a total of six members, each with a different business. Juvenal is the second person on the left in the photo. Juvenal owns a small general store which sells different kinds of products.

Juvenal is 37 years old and is married, with two children. His business is open from 7am until 8pm every day, including weekends. This is his third successful year in his business.

Juvenal and his group will use this loan to purchase more products, such as salt, cassava flour, bread, and so on. Juvenal has many plans for any profits that he makes from this loan. He would like to provide food for his family, pay school fees for his children, renovate his house, save money for the future, as well as purchase more stock for his store. A long list!

loans.use: To purchase products such as salt, cassava flour, bread, and so on.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Chinchero, provincia D. Urubamba, Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Guadalupe; La socia tiene 54 años D. edad, la socia es casada; la socia tiene 3 hijos D. los cuales uno D. ellos es independiente y los otros dos tiene (17,1 año); la socia  es docente D. profesión y también tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes, ella está deseando implementar su tienda con útiles escolares,  la socia desea invertir en la compra D. útiles escolares tales como lapiceros, borradores, tajadores, reglas, tijeras, cuadernos, vinifan, cinta maskin, entre otros más. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. útiles escolares.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a member of the "Nueva Victoria - Chinchero" community bank which is located in Chinchero district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Guadalupe is 54 years old, married, and has 3 children.  One of her children lives independently and the other two are 17 years old and 1 year old.  Guadalupe is a teacher by profession and also owns a small grocery store.  She would like to stock her store with school supplies.  She would like to invest in buying school supplies such as pens, erasers, pencil sharpeners, rulers, scissors, exercise books, Vinifan products, masking tape, etc.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying school supplies.

Guadalupe is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy school supplies

loans.name: Vahik

texts.en: Vahik S. lives with his wife, son, and two daughters in Khndzoresk village. Vahik has been engaged in agriculture for 10 years. Vahik’s younger daughter dreams of attending a school of music, where she will learn to play a musical instrument. She dreams of owning her own instrument. Since the family’s main income is not enough to cover extra costs, the father is planning to increase the number of cattle by purchasing 2 cows. He hopes that the additional income will help him make his daughter’s dream come true.

loans.use: to purchase two cows

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa D. lives with her husband and 4 children. She sells firewood at Nkroful, near Takoradi, which she has been doing for five years. Her husband is a farmer.  Adjoa assists her husband with the household expenses by using her income to educate the children.  Adjoa will use the loan to purchase extra quantities of firewood for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to invest in the sale of salt.

loans.use: to purchase extra quantities of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: For the past 15 years Hannah N. has been selling provisions, vegetables and food items such as garden eggs, tomatoes, peppers, near Nkroful at Takoradi. Hannah has been educated up to the senior high level.  She is married to a farmer and has 5 children. As a supportive wife, she makes sure that there is always food in the home. Her loan will increase capital to expand her business. Hannah anticipates using the new profit to further her children’s education, since education now is the key to success.

loans.use: to expand her business.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La señora Ana Maria es empleada en una empresa, el crédito lo requiere para el pago del tratamiento medico y cubrir los gastos de los medicamentos que necesita con suma urgencia su padre. Vive en la casa de sus suegros ubicada en la zona Central de la ciudad de La Paz, es casada y tiene un hijo. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO.
texts.en: Ana Maria is an employee in a company.  She needs the loan urgently to pay for medical treatment and medicine for her father.  She lives with her in-laws in the center of the city of La Paz.  She is married and has a son.  This is the first time that she has worked with IMPRO.

loans.use: To pay for medical treatement and medicine for her father.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama N. is a peddler of kenkey (type of sourdough dumpling) at Takoradi. She serves it with fried fish and hot pepper sauce.  Ama has attained a senior high level of education.  She is a single parent taking care of 3 children. As a single mother, things have not been easy, but she sees to the well-being of her children. A loan will enable her to produce food in larger quantities in order to generate greater income.  She will be able to properly take care of her children. Her business plans are to establish a kenkey restaurant and to provide the best of education for her children.

loans.use: to produce in larger quantity to generate greater income

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. is currently taking care of 4 children. Having acquired a senior high education, Grace is into the sale of provisions and salted fish at Nkroful near Takoradi, which she has been doing for twenty years. Her husband is unemployed so taking care of the family has not been easy. Grace is requesting the loan to buy more goods to expand her business. Her future plan is to be able to supply her customers with whatever they request in her shop so she can make more money for her home.

loans.use: to expand grocery store inventory

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo se dedica a la producción de leche; de la misma, elabora quesos y los comercializa en la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de un terreno para dar más espacio a sus vacas. Esta actividad es  la fuente de ingreso que tiene para la manutención de su hogar. El señor vive en casa propia en la comunidad de Kella Kella a un par de horas de la ciudad de El Alto; es casado y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA .
texts.en: Pablo is a dairy farmer; he produces milk and makes cheeses that he sells in the city of La Paz. He needs the loan to buy land so his cows will have more space.  This activity his source of income for maintaining his home.  He lives in his own home in the community of Kella Kella, a couple of hours from the city of El Alto.  He is married and has two kids.  This is the first time that he has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy land for his cows

loans.name: Melvis Del Rosario

texts.es: Melvis Del Rosario tiene 36 años, su actividad es la venta del servicio de limpieza. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio, ella vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos menores de edad,  tiene un horario fijo y por el momento tiene cierta cantidad de clientes que son fijos. Por lo que Melvis solicita un préstamo para comprar aerosoles, ambientadores, pinesol entre otros productos.  Ella quiere tener los mejores productos, ser la atracción de los clientes y mantener en el negocio ya que es su fuente de ingreso.
texts.en: Melvis Del Rosario is 36 years old and has had a cleaning service for more than 3 years.  She lives with her husband and their two young children.  She has a fixed schedule and for the moment she has a certain number of fixed customers.  Melvis is asking for a loan to buy spray cans, air fresheners, Pinesol and other cleaning products.  She would like to have the best products in order to attract customers and maintain her business, since it is her source of income.

loans.use: to purchase cleaning products

loans.name: Jovana

texts.es: La señora Jovana es empleada en un Internet pero ella también se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir; el crédito lo requiere para comprar una maquina recta ya que la señora desea abrir un taller de costura. Jovana vive en casa anticretico la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Alto Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz; es soltera y tiene un hijo. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro.
texts.en: Jovana is employed at an Internet business, but she also makes clothing.  She needs the loan to buy a sewing machine, since she wants to open a sewing shop.  Jovana lives in a house under antichresis (a rental arrangement common in Bolivia) located in the Alto Miraflores zone of the city of La Paz.  She is single and has one child.  This is her first credit with Impro.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine in order to open a sewing business

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Chinchero, provincia D. Urubamba, Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Asunta; La socia tiene 63 años D. edad, la socia es casada; la socia tiene 3 hijos (todos independientes), la socia tiene un kiosko dentro del colegio, la socia venD. en su stand todo tipo D. golosinas, también venD. gaseosas, mates, cafés, leche, jugos, sándwich, hamburguesas, la socia prepara para el segundo recreo segundos caseros, como ají D. gallina, papa rellena, lomo saltado, salchipapas, pollo frito con arroz y ensalada, los segundos le compran los profesores del colegio y también ella tiene un pequeño estante en el cual exhibe cuadernos, lapiceros, y otros útiles escolares. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. mercadería para implementar el kiosko escolar ahora que comienza la época del colegio.  

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Asunta is a member of the Communal Bank “Nueva Victoria – Chinchero” which is located in the District of Chinchero, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 63 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are independent. Asunta has a kiosk next to a school where she sells all types of candy, but also sodas, tea, coffee, milk, juice, sandwiches, and hamburgers. For the second lunch period, she prepares food for another set of customers such as chicken with chili peppers, stuffed potatoes, salted steak, sausages and fried potatoes, fried chicken with rice, and salads. The customers who buy these meals are school teachers. Asunta also has a small cabinet from which she displays notebooks, pens, and other school supplies. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of merchandise for her kiosk since the school year has started.

Asunta is happy with the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and merchandise for her food kiosk.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: El señor Luis es comerciante de golosinas (dulces) las mismas reparte en tiendas y colegios de la ciudad de La Paz; el crédito lo requiere para la compra de gran variedad de dulces y chicles (chewing gums), pues esta actividad es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir los gastos de sus hijos. Vive en alquiler en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz, es divorciado y tiene cuatro hijos.
texts.en: Sra. Luis is a candy merchant who distributes his products to stores and schools in the city of La Paz.  The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a wide variety of candy and chewing gum.  This business provides a source of income to cover his children’s expenses.  Luis lives in a rental property in the District of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz.  He is divorced and has four children.

loans.use: To purchase candy and chewing gum in bulk.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Moving from one locality to the other in Takoradi, Esi M. sells "kenkey". Kenkey is made from corn and usually served with pepper sauce and fried fish. Esi has not received any form of education. She stays with her three children. Her loan is going to serve as additional income to expand her business. She hopes to build a house for her family.

loans.use: Her loan is going to serve as an additional income to expand her business.

loans.name: Lucho

texts.es: El señor Lucho es Técnico Electricista y el crédito lo necesita para la compra de herramientas de trabajo como ser cables, materiales para soldar distintas piezas. Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de Alto Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltero y no tiene hijos. El cliente se encuentra muy contento con los créditos que se le otorgaron, pues es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2005.
texts.en: Lucho is an electrician and he needs this loan to buy work tools such as cables and soldering materials.  He lives in his parents' home which is located in Alto Sopocachi neighborhood, in the city of La Paz.  He is single and doesn't have any children.  Our client is very happy with the loans that he has been offered.  He has been a client of IMPRO since 2005.

loans.use: to buy cables and soldering materials for his electrician's business

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es: La señora Janeth se dedica al trabajo de costura, el crédito lo requiere para la  compra de una maquina de costura, pues esta actividad es la principal fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir los gastos de su familia. Vive en casa de sus suegros ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, es casada y tiene dos hijos.
texts.en: Janeth's business is sewing.  She needs this loan to buy a sewing machine as this is her main source of income with which she covers her family's expenses.  She lives in her in-laws' house which is located in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz.  She is married and has two children.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her sewing workshop

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, provincia de Urubamba, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Ines; La socia tiene 28 años de edad, la socia es conviviente; la socia tiene 2 hijos (12,6) años de edad, la socia es artesana de profesión ella tiene su stand en la casa taller, que está situado en el bello poblado de Chinchero, la casa taller alberga a muchos artesanos del poblado enseñándoles las técnicas de la pintura textil y aprendiendo a combinar colores y a teñir las lanas con óxidos naturales provenientes de la misma naturaleza; la socia se dedica en especial a la textilería con la ancestral técnica, ella tiene todos sus trabajos exhibiéndose en la casa taller de lunes a domingos; La socia desea el crédito para poder invertir en la compra de materiales y de este modo seguir produciendo para sacar adelante a sus pequeños hijos y darles una buena educación, la socia lleva el arte en las venas, toda su familia desde muy pequeña aprendió la técnica para poder vestirse entre ellos y abrigarse con las frazadas que ellos mismo hacían. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales. 

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ines is a member of the "Nueva Victoria - Chinchero" community bank which is located in Chinchero district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Ines is 28 years old, lives with her partner, and has 2 children aged 12 and 6.  She is a craftswoman by trade and has a stall in a workshop which is located in the beautiful town of Chinchero.  This workshop houses many craftspeople from the town.  It teaches them textile painting techniques and how to combine colors and dye yarn with natural oxides which can be found in nature.  In particular, Ines works in textiles, using an ancestral technique.  She displays her works in the workshop from Monday to Sunday.

Ines would like this loan so that she can invest in buying materials and thereby continue producing her works so that she can get her young children ahead in life and provide them with a good education.  Ines carries art in her veins.  All her family members learned these techniques when they were very young so that they could dress themselves and wrap themselves up in the blankets that they made themselves.

Ines is requesting this loan to invest in buying materials.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to invest in buying materials

loans.name: C4807 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Ramadhan is 29 years old and is married with three children who are 10 and 5 years old. He is the president of a group called “Tuzamurane”. Ramadhan sells charcoal, and others in the group have businesses selling beans at the local market. Ramadhan employs two people in his business and has been working for three years in this line of work. Ramadhan is in the middle.

He plans to use this loan to buy more sacks for charcoal to sell at the market. He would like to use any profits to start saving and to satisfy the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks for charcoal.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: El señor Antonio es productor lechero y su esposa lo ayuda con todas  las actividades agrícolas y también comercializa los productos en distintas ferias; el crédito lo requiere para comprar una vaca lechera e incrementar su ganado lechero y por consiguiente el volumen de leche para vender. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Cotapampa del departamento de La Paz; es casado y no tiene hijos. Es la  primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Antonio is a dairy producer and his wife helps him with all the agricultural activities and she also sells the products at various fairs. He requires a loan to purchase a dairy cow in order to increase his herd and to increase the volume of milk to sell. He lives in his own home located in Cotapampa in the department of La Paz. He is married but he does not have children. It is his first time working with Impro (Kiva Field Partner) and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to increase the volume of milk to sell.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: This picture was taken on one of Hannah's normal rounds selling "kenkey" (fermented corn dough balls). Hannah A. has received junior high level of education. She is a single parent taking care of three children. Hannah has been selling "kenkey" and fried fish for 10 years. She singlehandedly takes care of her family with the income she makes from her sales. A loan will go a long way to boost her kenkey business. The new profit will be reinvested into her business.

loans.use: to boost her "kenkey" business.

loans.name: Valiant Women Of Pirayu Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la Compañía Tujukua de la Ciudad de Caacupe que dista a 25 km de la Oficina de Fundación Paraguaya de dicha ciudad.
La Presidenta del comité es la Sra. Maria Antonia D., ella se dedica a la Artesanía en Ñanduti (bordados), la misma vive con su pareja que es empleado (Guardia de Seguridad) y sus tres hijos que son estudiantes, doña Antonia es una persona muy humilde, vive en una casita precaria pero aun así es muy trabajadora y responsable, ella trabaja incansablemente todos los días para poder generar más ingresos en su hogar y así ayudar con los gastos diarios.
Ella destina todo su crédito a la compra de telas e hilos para realizar sus tejidos de ñanduti, gracias al empeño y la dedicación que ella le pone  a su trabajo siempre tiene muchos pedidos y sus clientes quedan muy satisfechos.
Ella como todas sus compañeras de comité están muy agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva por el importante apoyo que les están brindando con este crédito.
texts.en:
The women of this group are members of "Compania Tujukua" in the cit of Caacupe, located at a distance of 25 km from the offices of Fundacion Paraguaya (Kiva Field Partner) in the same city.

The leader of the group is Maria Antonia D.. She is an artisan in Nanduti where she lives with her partner, employed as a security guard, and their three children, all of whom are in school. Antonia is a very humble person and she lives in a small and precarious home but she is very hard working and responsible. She works every day tirelessly to generate more income for her home and to help with the daily expenses.

She will invest all of her loan in the purchase of fabrics and threads to weave Nanduti articles. Thanks to her work and her dedication that she puts into her work she always has many orders and her clients are always very satisfied.

She and her colleagues in the group are very thankful to Fundacion Paraguaya and to Kiva for the important support they are providing them through this loan.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, threads, and needles.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: Agustín es productor lechero y también es albañil constructor y su esposa lo ayuda con las actividades agrícolas; el crédito lo requiere para la compra de ganado lechero para incrementar el volumen de leche para su venta. Estas dos son las actividades que realiza para mantener los gastos de su familia. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Achacachi del departamento de La Paz, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Augustin is a dairy producer and he is also a construction worker. His wife helps him with the agricultural activities. He requires the loan to purchase dairy cows in order to increase the volume of milk to sell. These are the two businesses that he carries out to provide for the family's expenses. He lives in his own home located in Achacachi in the department of La Paz. He is married and he has three children. It is his first time working with Impro (Kiva Field Partner) and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow in order to increase the volume of milk to sell.

loans.name: Janixia Los Santos

texts.es: Yanixia De Los Santos tiene 34 años, su actividad económica es la brindar el servicio de transporte. Ella tiene más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues ella lo alquila y le entregan cierta cantidad de dinero al finalizar el día. Ella busca la forma de obtener ingresos para su hijo que es lo más importante. Ella se levanta muy temprano pues tiene que entregar el vehículo para que se lo entreguen por la noche. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de llantas, combustible y ciertos arreglos de su carro.
texts.en: Yanixia De Los Santos is 34 years old and her business activity is to provide transport services. She has more than 6 years in the business. She rents her vehicle and they pay her a certain amount of money at the end of the day. She is looking for a way to obtain an income for her son, which is the most important thing.  She gets up very early in the morning to surrender her vehicle so that they will return it to her in the evening. The loan she requests is to purchase tires and fuel, and to carry out certain repairs to her vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase tires and fuel, and to carry out maintenance repairs to her vehicle.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush A. lives in a faraway small city called Agarak. There are six people in her family, two of whom are children. For 5 years Anush has been running a beauty salon. She is the only breadwinner in the family, because of the high unemployment rate in the region. It took many years for Anush to build up this salon business. Lots of hard work, long working hours and hard earned savings were put into it. 

To finally end the construction work in the salon, Anush has applied to SEF International for a loan to achieve this in a short time and create suitable conditions for her clients, to give them comfort and good service.

loans.use: to finish constructing a salon.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: Rene es productor lechero y también es constructor y su esposa lo ayuda con todas  las actividades agrícolas; el crédito lo requiere para la compra de una vaca lechera y así incrementar su ganado lechero. Es la principal fuente de ingreso que tiene para mantener a su familia. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Chijipina Chico del departamento de La Paz, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2007.
texts.en: Rene is a dairy producer and he is also a driver. His wife helps him with all of the agricultural activities. He requires a loan to purchase a dairy cow in order to increase his herd. It is his primary source of income to support his family. He lives in his own home located in Chijipina Chico in the department of La Paz. He is married and he has three children. He has been a client of Impro (Kiva Field Partner) since 2007.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to increase milk production.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua K. is a single parent taking care of two children. She has senior high background of education. Akua sells cooking utensils at Nkroful near Takoradi. Akua uses her income to take care of her children. Akua will add the loan to her initial capital to expand her business. She anticipates building a shop to sell her wares in.

loans.use: Akua will add the loan to her initial capital to expand her business.

loans.name: German

texts.es: El señor German es productor lechero también es constructor y su esposa lo ayuda con las actividades agrícolas; el crédito lo requiere para la compra de una vaca lechera e incrementar su ganado lechero y su volumen de producción de leche. Es la principal fuente de ingreso que tiene para mantener a su familia. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Chahuira Pampa del departamento de La Paz, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Es la  primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: German is a milk producer. He is also a builder and his wife helps with the agricultural activities. This loan is needed to purchase a dairy cow and increase his dairy livestock and milk volume production. This is the primary source of income for taking care of his family. He lives in his own house in the locality of Chahuira Pampa in the department of La Paz. He is married and he has two children. This is first time working with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase the milk volume production

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, provincia de Urubamba, Departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra: Marleny; La socia tiene 35 años de edad, la socia es casada; la socia tiene 4 hijos (11,5,3,1 año y medio) años de edad, la socia es artesana de profesión ella ha heredado el arte de sus ancestros, la socia es originaria del pueblo de Chinchero, la socia desde muy niña siempre estuvo ligada a la artesanía sin ellos saber que este era un arte, hicieron de ella parte de sus vidas diarias, aprendió a hilas, y teñir las diferentes lanas con óxidos naturales provenientes de las zonas más altas del ande, con mucho ingenio aprendieron a tejer a mano con la ayuda de precarias herramientas de tejido, entretejían las lanas y se iban formando los diferentes dibujos, generalmente estos diseños muestran la iconografía andina la viva diaria, los paisajes, los animales, la siembra y cosecha, el agua y el sol; La socia fue creciendo con todo esto a su entorno, mientras su padre Forferio pintaba la naturaleza en sus cuadros, ellos fueron descubiertos y ayudaron a escribir su historia, la historia de un pueblo lleno de bellos paisajes y que a pesar de los siglos aún conservaron la pureza del legado inka en muchas de sus costumbres entre ellas el arte. La socia ha sido protagonista en documentales a nivel internacional, y siguió dando a conocer al mundo a su pueblo y a sus trabajos finamente acabados, hoy en día Marleny exporta sus trabajos a Estados Unidos; Ella tiene el sueño de instalar en su comunidad hospedajes para recibir a los diferentes turistas que llegan de todo el mundo y que se queden unos días para participar de sus costumbres y tener más contacto con ellos y también nos indica que desearían enseñarles a tejer. La socia desea el crédito para poder hacer de este un capital y comprar sus materiales para continuar con sus trabajos y enviarlos a sus proveedores en Estados Unidos.
La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "NEW VICTORIA - CHINCHERO."   This bank is located in the district of Chinchero, province of Urubamba, Cusco.  Her name is Marleny, and she is 35 years old and married with four children (11, 5, 3, and 1 1/2 years old).

Marleny is a professional artisan who inherited her skills from her ancestors.  She is originally from the town of Chinchero.  From the time she was very young, she was involved with artisanal crafts without knowing that they were an art form; she made them part of her daily life.  She learned to spin and to tint the various wools with natural dyes from the higher areas of the Andes.  With great facility she learned to knit by hand using rustic knitting implements.  She wove using wool to create different designs.  Generally, the patterns are symbolic representations of Andean daily life: the landscapes, the animals, planting and harvesting, the sun and the water.

Marleny grew up surrounded by all these things and with her father Forferio painting scenes of nature all the while.  The paintings were discovered and helped to establish a history of a town full of beautiful landscapes and that for centuries has preserved the purity of the Inca legacy through its customs and particularly its art.

Marleny has been featured in international documentaries and continues to contribute fine artwork to her town and to the world.  Today she exports pieces to the United States.  She dreams of installing accomodations for the various tourists who come from all over the world to stay a few days in order to participate in local customs.  She wants to have more contact with these visitors and wants to teach them to knit.  

Marleny is requesting this loan to buy more materials so that she can continue creating artwork to ship to her U.S. suppliers.  She is happy to be provided this opportunity and promises to comply with timely repayments.

loans.use: to buy more materials in order to create artwork to ship to U.S. suppliers

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin S. lives with his mother and sister in Brnakot village of Syunik region. Due to high unemployment, Martin can’t work locally. The family's only income comes from growing potatoes, cabbages, and wheat. During the high season he employs eight workers, six of whom are women. The families of those workers benefit from this seasonal income.  To insure he is ready for the busy season, Martin has applied for a loan to purchase potato seeds, fertilizer, and diesel to transport the produce.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds, fertilizer, and diesel for transport.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: La señora Eva es productora lechera y también comercializa los quesos que elabora, el crédito lo requiere para comprar una vaca lechera para incrementar su producción de leche. Es la principal fuente de ingreso que tiene para mantener a su familia. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Chahuira Pampa del departamento de La Paz, es soltera tiene un hijo. Es la  primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Eva is a milk producer and she also sells cheese that she makes, The loan will be used to buy a dairy cow to increase her milk production. This is her main source of income to support her family. She lives in her own house located in the community of Chahuira Pampa of the departament of La Paz. She is single and has one son. This is the first time that she has worked with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase her milk production.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 32 years old and married. He has two adopted orphans. Jean Claude has been a motorbike taxi driver for one year. He transports people every day from 5am until 12pm.

Jean Claude would like to use this loan to buy new motorbike to help him. With this profit, he will build his own house for his family and save for his future.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Francisco Saul

texts.es: El señor Francisco Hernández C. tiene cuarentiseis años maneja una moto taxi compro este vehiculo el cual pago en partes actualmente ya esta cancelado se dedico a esta actividad por que le gusta manejar unidades de transporte antes se dedicaba a la labor en el campo tiene dos hijo de las edades de veintidós y veinticinco años , su sueño a futuro es tener una flota de carros para brindar servicios de taxi a la comunidad iqueña tiene buenas referencia personales , el crédito que esta solicitando va a hacer destinado en el pago de derecho de cambio de tarjeta de propiedad es por ello que se propone el crédito.
texts.en: Mr.Francisco Hernández C. is 46 years old and drives a moto taxi. He purchased the vehicle and paid it off in payments. He works in this profession because he likes to drive. He worked as a field laborer before. He has two children, 22 and 25 years old. His dream is to have a fleet of cars to be able to offer taxi services to the people of Ica. He has good personal references and is asking for the credit to pay for the change of ownership card for his vehicle.

loans.use: the legalization of his vehicle

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, provincia de Urubamba, Departamento de Cusco.
 
La socia Elsa; tiene 43 años y es casada, ella tiene 4 hijos y aún dependen todos de ella, la socia es artesana de profesión y elabora bellos bordados, carteras, chompas de alpaca, ponchos, chullos, correas en lana con bordados de flores y otros, monederos, y mucho más, la socia pertenece a la asociación artesanal Virgen de las nieves, ella trabaja en este oficio desde hace más de 15 años, la socia realiza sus tejidos con óxidos naturles ella tiñe las lanas con plantas naturales de dan diversos colores. La socia desea implemetar su negocio y comprar materiales y también parte de este prestamo lo invertirá en los estudios de sus hijos para que pueda estar pagando las cuotas pocoa  poco con el producto de las ventas de la artesanía. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de materiales y de útiles escolares.

La socia agradece el prestamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir co el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Elsa belongs to the “Nueva Victoria (New Victory) – Chinchero” Communal Bank, located in Chinchero district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Elsa is 43 years old, married, and has 4 children, all of whom still depend on her.  She is an artisan by profession and makes beautiful embroidered purses, alpaca sweaters, ponchos, decorations, wool runners embroidered with flowers, and other things like coin purses, and much more.  She belongs to the Virgen de las Nieves (Virgin of the Snows) Artisan Association and has worked in their office for more than 15 years.  Elsa makes her textiles with natural dies and decorates wool cloth with natural plants of diverse colors.

Elsa wants to expand her business and buy materials and, also, part of this loan will be invested in her children's studies, paying fees little by little with the money she earns from sales of her artisan work. She is requesting the loan to buy materials and to pay school bills.

She appreciates the loan and promises to make her payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: TO BUY MATERIALS FOR EMBROIDERING ARTISAN TEXTILES AND TO PAY HER CHILDREN'S SCHOOL FEES

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
La señora Laura es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Edén, del Distrito de yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos.
Tiene un bote que alquila para pescar,  gracias a ello puede solventar algunos gastos en su casa, su esposo está convaleciente (enfermo) y no puede trabajar por estos tiempos.  Laura lleva 10 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles se comprará un motor nuevo para su bote, 10  galones de gasolina, 1 litro de aceite.
Laura es la que se ocupa del alquiler del bote y de los gatos de la casa, tiene que trabajar para poder mantenerse y ver por la mejoría de su esposo y sus hijos.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por lo que hace por todas las mujeres trabajadoras y con ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Señora Laura is a member of the Nuevo Edén (New Eden) Community Bank in Yarinacocha district, Ucayali department. She is 60 years old, married, and has four children.

She owns a boat that she rents out for fishing, and it is because of this that she is able to pay some of the costs of running her home. Her husband is convalescing after an illness and hasn’t been able to work for some time. Laura has had several loans over the past ten years with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos.

With this new 2000 sole loan, she plans to buy a new engine for the boat, 10 gallons of fuel, and one litre of oil. Her work consists of renting out the boat and taking care of household expenses. She has to work to support the family and watch over their wellbeing.

She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for what the organization does for working women who are keen to get on in life.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine, fuel and oil

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth N. is a peddler selling shoes, ladies' underwear and slippers at Takoradi. She is a single parent currently taking care of four children. Her educational background is up to senior high level. Elizabeth has not been finding it easy taking care of her family and so is requesting a loan to expand her business so she can take proper care of her family. She would reinvest the new profit back into her business.

loans.use: a loan to expand her business so she can take proper care of her family.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.es:
La señora Madeleine es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Edén, del Distrito Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 42 años de edad y tiene 2 hijow pero solo vive con uno de ellos, está separada de su esposo.
Cuenta con dos motocars, de los cuales recibe a diario una feria (pago por alquiler) por cada motocar, ese mismo dinero es invertido en el mantenimiento de sus vehículos y los gastos de la casa.

Con su nuevo préstamo de s/. 1,700.00 nuevos soles comprará: 2 llantas, 2 cámaras, 2 bujías, 2 sistemas de arrastre, 1 intermitente, 4 litros de aceite, ¼ de grasa, cera.
Los vehículos tienen que estar en mantenimiento constante para que no se malogren y puedan trabajar bien,  de esa manera podrá recaudar más dinero.  Quiere seguir trabajando con Manuela Ramos para poder comprarse más adelante un nuevo motocar.
texts.en:
Señora Madeleine is a member of the Nuevo Edén (New Eden) Community Bank in Yarinacocha district, Ucayali department. She is 42 years old and has two children, only one of whom lives with her. She is separated from her husband.

Madeleine owns two motocars (motorized rickshaws) which she rents out for a daily fee. This money is then used to maintain the motocars and to cover household expenses.

With this new loan of S/.1,700 soles, Madeleine plans to buy 2 tires, 2 inner tubes, 2 spark plugs, 2 traction systems, an indicator, 4 litres of oil, ¼ litre of grease, and wax polish.

The vehicles have to be kept in good repair so they don’t break down and are in service all the time. Then she will be able to earn more money. Madeleine wishes to continue taking out loans with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos so that in the future she can buy a new motorcar.

loans.use: to buy tires, inner tubes, spark plugs etc.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba E. is into the production and sale of "Fante kenkey" atTakoradi. Efua has received senior high education. She is divorced and has five children. With this burden of taking care of five children at hand, Efua will want a loan to expand her business so she can sell more to be able to take care of the family. She has been in this trade for six years. She plans to reinvest her additional income for further growth.

loans.use: Efua will want a loan to expand her business so she can sell more to be able to take care of the family.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua A. is into the production and sale of "Fante kenkey" and fruit at Takoradi. Efua has received senior high education.  Her husband is currently unemployed and so she has to bear the burden of supporting the family alone. She has four children. With this burden at hand, Efua will want a loan to expand her business so she can sell more to be able to take care of the family. She has been in this trade for six years. She plans to reinvest her additional income for further growth.

loans.use: Efua will want a loan to expand her business so she can sell more to be able to take care of the family.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa N. is married to a mason and has three children. In the photo, Theresa is in the process of preparing the "kenkey" (fermented corn dough in balls) she sells. She serves it with fried fish at Nkroful near Takoradi. 

Theresa uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of the general household expenses. Theresa will use the loan to purchase more maize to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more maize.

loans.name: Angel Group

texts.es:
MarceL. es socia del Banco Comunal Angel, tiene 29 años, es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos.
MarceL. y su esposo, tienen un taller D. cerrajería donD. elaboran puertas, ventanas, pasamanos, escaleras, tijerales. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en L. compra D. materiales como: fierros, planchas, soldaduras.
MarceL. está en Finca Perú 4 ciclos, le gusta por los ahorros y porque aprenD. D. las capacitaciones que recibe D. su promotora, en temas D. L. familia, hijos, salud y matrimonio.
MarceL. está estudiando corte y confección, está ahorrando para en un futuro poder abrir un taller donD. pueda confeccionar buzos, polos, casacas y vender al público.
texts.en:
MarceL., 29, is a member of the Ángel communal bank.  She has a spouse and four children.

She and her husband have a metal shop where they manufacture doors, windows, banisters, stairways, metal braces.  The loan she’s requesting will be used to buy materials like:  metals, presses, solder.

MarceL. has been with Finca Perú for four cycles.  She likes it very much because of the saving and because she learns during the workshops her advisor provides on family, children, health and marriage topics.

MarceL. is studying dressmaking and is saving up to open a dressmaking shop in the future to make sweatshirts, polo shirts, jackets to sell to the general public.

loans.use: to buy materials like metals, presses and solder.

loans.name: Katy Karina

texts.es:
La señora Katy es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Edén, del Distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 31 años, está casada y tiene 3 hijos, su esposo se desempeña como armador de bote. 
Lleva 4 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de pescado fresco, tiene un puesto que tiene en el mercado de Yarinacocha.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/.3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 2 tinas de pescado fresco y un motor pequeño,  para utilizarlo para la pesca, de esa manera el pescado pueda llegar directamente, sin los intermediarios.
La señora Katy se dedica a la venta de pescado por las tardes, el resto de tiempo se dedica a la atención de  su hogar y a sus hijos que todavía son pequeños.  Gracias a Manuela Ramos ha tenido un capital para iniciar su propio negocio y mejorar su economía.
texts.en:
Katy, 31, is a member of the “Nuevo Edén” (New Eden) communal bank in Yarinacocha district, Ucayali department.  She’s married and has three children; her husband is a boat builder.

She’s been working with Manuela Ramos loans for four years.  She sells fresh fish.  She has a stand in Yarinacocha’s market. She will use her new, 3000 new sol, loan to buy two vats of fresh fish and a small motor to use for fishing so that she can get fish directly and not have to go through middlemen.  Katy sells fish in the afternoon.  The rest of the time she dedicates to her home and to her children who are still small.
