Thanks to Manuela Ramos she’s had capital to start her own business and improve her economy.

loans.use: to buy two vats of fresh fish and a small motor.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia N. operates a chop bar (a place where people come to eat) at Takoradi. She is married to a mason and has three children. She has been in this trade for a decade. Sophia assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. A loan is going to help her buy more food items to cook to meet the demand of her customers. She has the plan of reinvesting her increased capital.

loans.use: to buy more food items to cook.

loans.name: Rosario Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Rosario es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Edén, del Distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y tiene 6 hijos.
Se dedica a la venta de plátanos, alquila un pequeñp puesto para poder  vender sus plátanos.  Leva 2 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 comprará 50 racimos de plátanos  bellaco verde, 5 racimos de plátano capirona.
Los 6 hijos que tiene todavía viven con ella porque son pequeños, con su negocio y el de su esposo pueden solventar los gastos que tienen en su hogar, más aun cuando se acercan los gastos del colegios.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos y los préstamos recibidos ha podido ir creciendo poco a poco, hay temporadas que la venta esta baja, pero ella no deja de trabajar para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Señora Rosario is a member of the communal bank Nuevo Edén in the Yarinacocha district in the department of Ucayali.  She is 37 years old, married and has 6 children.  She rents a small stand where she sells bananas.  She has been doing this for 2 years with loans from Manuela Ramos.  With the new loan she will buy 50 bunches of green Bellaco bananas  and 5 bunches of Capirona bananas.  Her 6 children are still young so they still live at home.  With her business and her husband's they are able to cover their household expenses which are even more with the upcoming school expenses.  

Thanks to Manuela Ramos and the loans granted she has been able to grow little by little.  There are seasons when sales are slow, but she doesn't stop working to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy 50 bunches of green Bellaco bananas and 5 bunches of Capirona bananas.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
For the past three years Mary M. has been smoking fish for sale at Takoradi. She is married to a commercial driver. The picture is showing Mary getting the fish ready  to be smoked. She has acquired junior high level of education. 

Mary wants to produce fish in a larger quantity and so is requesting a loan to expand her business.  She would like to see improvement in her business and so she will be reinvesting her profit.

loans.use: so is requesting for a loan to expand her business.

loans.name: Juana Jessica

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia D. banco comunal Nuevo Edén, D. Distrito de calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 34 años.  Su esposo es técnico de sonido.
Lleva muy poco tiempo trabajando con los prestamos de Manuela Ramos pero ya tiene una pequeña bodega en su casa que ha ido surtiendo cada vez que saca su préstamo.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 soles comprará: 1 caja de aceite, 1 caja de galleta, 1 paquete de fideos para sopa, 1 bolsa de fideo tallarín, ½ saco de azúcar, ½ saco de arroz, ½ caja de leche, 10 casilleros de huevo, 2 bolsas de caramelos, 1 caja de chiche, 1 bolsa de chupetín.
Juana está convencida que para lograr algo hay que trabajar duro y dedicarse por entero y lo primordial... saber manejar su dinero y saber cómo invertirlo.  Gracias a Manuela Ramos ha podido incrementar su capital de trabajo y crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en: Sra. Juana, 34, is a member of the Nuevo Eden community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ucayali.  Her husband is an audio technician.  She has only worked with Manuela Ramos for a short time, but she's already managed to establish a small corner shop.  The shop is located in her house and she's used past loans to stock it with the merchandise she sells.  With this new loan, for S/.1,000.00 soles, she will buy cooking oil, snacks, pasta, sugar, rice, milk, eggs, candy, etc., all for resale.  Juana believes that you have to work hard to succeed and she understands the basic principles of success . . . know how to manage and invest your money.  Thanks for Manuela Ramos, she has been able to increase her working capital and grow her small business.

loans.use: to stock general store.

loans.name: Sol Group

texts.es:
Reyna Isabel es la Presidenta del Banco Comunal Sol, tiene 47 años, viuda, 3 hijos.
Reyna es docente D. Educación Primaria, se ayuda vendiendo ropas para damas caballeros y niños por pedidos. Ingreso a Finca Perú, por la invitación D. una amiga y le gusta porque se pueD. ahorrar, se pasa gratos momentos con sus consocios y se practican los valores. El crédito que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra D. útiles escolares para está campaña pues ya tiene pedidos.
texts.en:
Reyna Isabel, 47, is the president of the Sol community bank.  She is a widow with 3 children.  
Reyna is an elementary school teacher.  She also operates a business selling clothing, to order, for men, women and children.  A friend invited her to join Finca Peru and she likes being a member because she's learning to save and the other members are good fun.  She will use this loan to buy school supplies for the coming school year, some of which she needs to fill existing orders.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for retail business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret C. is married and has 3 children. Margaret sells cloth at Takoradi, which she has done for five years. Her husband is a farmer. Margaret uses her income to help her husband to pay school fees and utility bills. Margaret will use the loan to purchase cloth to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Margaret plans to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth to sell.

loans.name: Griselda Ilmer

texts.es:
La señora Griselda es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Edén, del Distrito Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada, tiene 2 hijos y su esposo se desempeña como albañil.
Son tres ciclos que lleva trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos.  Ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas y lo hace en un tablero que tiene y vende en el patio de su casa de forma ambulatoria.
Con su nuevo préstamo de s/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 caja de chicle, 3 bolsas de caramelo, 1 bolsa de chicle en bolita, 2 cajas de cigarro, 3 tiras de chupetines, 2 cajas de chocolate, 1 paquete de wafer, una caja de lentejitas, 1 caja de galleta.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por los préstamos recibidos.

En la foto se muestra tomando sus alimentos, ella espera su tercer hijo y el embarazo no le permite trabajar todo el día por ello la venta de sus golosinas lo hace por las tardes, ya que por las mañanas se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Griselda, 31, is a member of the Nuevo Eden community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ucayali.  She is married and has 2 children.  Her husband is a construction worker. 
This is her third round of funding with Manuela Ramos.  Sra. Griselda operates a small snacks business.  She works as a street vendor, but she also has a stand in the patio at her house where she can sell.  She will use this loan, for S/.1,000 new soles, to buy gum, different kinds of candy, cigarettes, suckers, chocolates and other snacks.  She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for past loans.  

In the picture, you see Sra. Griselda making a meal.  She's expecting her third child so she can't work all day now.  She sells in the afternoons and spends mornings taking care of her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for retail business.

loans.name: Martha Luz

texts.es:
La señora Martha es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Edén, del Distrito D. Yarinacocha, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 52 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos.
Lleva 6 años en este banco comunal.  Ella se dedica a dar servicio D. fotocopias, elaboración D. sellos y fotografías, su negocio está creciendo, antes se dedicaban solo a sacar copias.
Su esposo es el que se encarga D. hacer los sellos y sacar las copias y ella en las fotografías, el trabajo lo tienen compartido y ambos se apoyan.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: una maquina digital, 5 millares D. papel  A4 para copias, 1 millar papel para fotografía y otros insumos.
Su negocio está yendo muy bien gracias a la dedicación que le ponen, con cada uno D. sus préstamos ha ido comprando las cosas que le hacían falta y D. esa manera ha logrado mejorar la atención a sus clientes. Manuela Ramos ha sido D. gran ayuda para su familia.
En la foto la vemos retocando una foto.
texts.en:
Martha, 52, is a member of the “Nuevo Edén” (New Eden) communal bank in Yarinacocha district, Ucayali department.  She’s married and has two children.

She’s been in this communal bank for 6 years.  She provides photographic services, manufactures stamps and photographs.  The business is growing because they used to just make photocopies. Her husband makes the stamps and copies and she does the photography.  They share the work and support each other.

She will use the new, 2000 new sol, loan to buy a digital camera, two reams of A4 paper for photocopies, 2 reams of photographic paper and other supplies.

She is doing well in the business thanks to the effort they put into it.  She has used each one of her loans to buy the things she needed thus attaining better customer service.  Manuela Ramos has been of great help for her family.

In the photo we can see her retouching a photo.

loans.use: To buy a digital camera, 10 reams of A4 copy paper and 2 reams of photographic paper.

loans.name: Gregori

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SILKINCHANY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de San Jerónimo, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Gregori; el tiene 46 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de reciclaje el compra todo lo que son botellas descartables, papeles, chatarras entre otros más para luego venderlos a sus clientes, el socio lleva años en este negocio incluso tiene su moto donde lleva todo lo que recicla, el socio es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercadería para reciclar.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the “SILKINCHANY” communal bank.  The bank is located in the district of San Jerónimo, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

The associate is Señor Gregori.  He is 46 years of age and lives with his partner and their 3 children.  The associate alternates his daily activities with the business of recycling.  He purchases everything such as disposable bottles, paper, and scrap, among others, more in order to sell them to his clients.  The associate has years in this business.  He also has a motorcycle where he carries everything that he recycles.  The associate is a very happy person with a strong will to get ahead.  

The associate requests the loan for the purchase of more merchandise to recycle.  

The associate is happy for the loan and promises to comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to recycle.

loans.name: Henri Joseph

texts.fr:
Homme de 36ans  marié et père de trois enfants dont l’âge varie de 9mois à 9ans. Il a un moulin à farine de manioc depuis 1997. Il à des ventes journalière 15000 à 30000 francs.
avec ce prêt il veux renforcer son activité en achetant un deuxième moulin à farine de manioc ainsi que deux sacs de farine de manioc pour la vente.
  Sa stratégie est d’épargner car il aimerait créer une entreprise agro- industrielle.
Son souhait est de voir ses enfants évoluer dans leur scolarité.
texts.en:
This 36-year-old man is married with three children ranging in age from 9 months to 9 years old. He has had a cassava flour mill since 1997. His daily sales reach 15,000 to 30,000 francs.

With this loan, he plans to strengthen his business by buying a second cassava flour mill and two sacks of cassava flour for resale.

His strategy is to save in order to start an agro-based industry. He wishes to see his children pursue extensive studies.

loans.use: to buy a cassava flour mill and sacks of cassava flour

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SILKINCHANY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de San Jerónimo,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Fortunata; la socia tiene 54 años de edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de cuyes y pollos para luego venderlos a sus clientes, a la vez la socia se dedica a la agricultura ella siembra papa, maíz entre otros y luego lo vende de forma ambulatoria en los mercados y clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona bien alegre y responsable.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para sus animales como pasto, maíz, alfalfa entre otros y también fertilizantes y abono para su chacra.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the ” SILKINCHANY” communal bank.  The bank is located in the San Jerónimo district,  which belongs to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The associate is Señora Fortunata.  She is 54 years of age, married and has 4 children.  The associate fills her daily activities with the business of raising guinea pigs and chickens in order to later sell them to her clients.  At the same time, the associate is dedicated to agriculture. She sows potatoes and corn, among other crops, and later sells them on foot in the markets and to clients who ask for her.  The associate is a very happy and responsible person.

The associate requests the loan to purchase food for her animals such as grass, corn and alfalfa, among others, and also fertilizer and pesticides for her small farm. 

The associate is happy for the loan and promises to comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy food for her animals such as grass, corn, and alfalfa, among others, and also fertilizer and pesticides for her small farm.

loans.name: Placida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SILKINCHANY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de San Jerónimo,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Placida; la socia tiene 41 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de materiales de construcción como ladrillos, cemento, palos entre otros más, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia ya que son el motivo más importante que tiene.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar material de construcción para su negocio y así tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the ” SILKINCHANY” communal bank.  The bank is located in the San Jerónimo district,  which belongs to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The associate is Señora Placida.  She is 41 years of age, married and has 3 children.  The associate alternates her daily activities with the business of selling construction materials such as bricks, cement, and boards, among other things. The associate has years in this business which she works jointly with her husband.  The associate is a very happy person with a strong desire to do well by her family since they are the most important motive than she has.  

The associate requests the loan to buy building materials for her business and thus to have a greater variety to offer her clients.  

The associate is happy for the loan and promises to comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her business and also to have a greater variety of merchandise to offer her clients.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro Pablo A. tiene 61 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 8 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  JUNTOS VENCEREMOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Matilde Esther  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de cacao y yuca.

Pedro se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao y yuca. Compra sus productos en  Mata de Cacao cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos de cacao y yuca.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando y ayudar a los nietos con la educación.

Le gusta ver la televisión en especial los noticieros.
texts.en:
Pedro Pablo A. is 61 years old, married, and lives with his wife and eight children in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar Province.

The members of the Communal Bank “Juntos Venceremos” (Together We Overcome) meet at the fairgrounds of Matilde Esther in the canton of Chillanes. There are twelve members in this Communal Bank, all of whom are devoted to growing cacao and cassava.

Pedro is a farmer who grows cacao and cassava. He buys his supplies in Mata de Cacao at the end of each month and sells at the fair in Chillanes on Sundays.

Pedro is requesting a loan to buy supplies for growing cacao and cassava. The assistance from this loan will help him financially to acquire what he needs. His main challenges are pests, diseases, and weather changes. He dreams of continuing with his work and helping his grandchildren with their education.

Pedro enjoys watching television, especially the news.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for growing cacao and cassava.

loans.name: Rosita Maria

texts.es:
La señora Rosita es socia del banco comunal Juntas Hasta El Final, del Distrito de Manatay, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos menores.
Recién lleva 5 ciclos perteneciendo a la familia de Manuela Ramos, cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su casa, gracias a ello puede atender al mismo tiempo a sus hijos.
Con el nuevo préstamo de S/.2,000.00 comprará: 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, ½ caja de leche, 2 cajas de galleta, 3 paquetes de papel higiénico, 1 paquete de fideo, ½ caja de conservas, ½ caja de fruta al jugo, ½ caja de huevo, ½ caja vinagre, ½ caja de sillao.
Su negocio no deja mayores ganancias pero es una gran ayuda para su esposo, quien se dedica al transporte, maneja un motokar con el que presta servicio de taxi, los dos aportan dinero para su hogar, de esa manera están dando educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosita is a member of the Communal Bank “Juntas Hasta El Final” (Together Until The End) which is in the District of Manatay, Department of Ucayali. She is 39 years old, married, and has two young children. Rosita has participated in five loan cycles as part of the Manuela Ramos family. She has a small store in her home, which allows her to take care of her children at the same time.

With this new loan of 2000 PEN, she will buy the following items: one sack of rice, one sack of sugar, ½ case of milk, two crates of chicken, three packets of toilet paper, one packet of noodles, ½ case of preserves, ½ case of fruit juice, ½ create of eggs, ½ case of vinegar, and ½ case of soy sauce.

Her business does not generate a lot of profit, but her husband is a great help since he works in transportation. He drives a motorcar used for providing taxi services. The two of them are able to maintain their household and provide their children with an education.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Gabriel Ignacio

texts.es:
Gabriel Ignacio P. V. tiene 33 años, vive en Union Libre con la compañera y con los hijos en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  JUNTOS VENCEREMOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Matilde Esther  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de cacao y yuca.

Gabriel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao y yuca. Compra sus productos en  Mata de Cacao cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos de cacao y yuca.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando para dar la educación a los hijos.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Gabriel Ignacio P. V. is 33 years old and lives with his common law wife and their three children in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar Province.

The members of the Communal Bank “Juntos Venceremos” (Together We Overcome) meet at the fairgrounds of Matilde Esther in the canton of Chillanes. There are twelve members in this Communal Bank, all of whom are devoted to growing cacao and cassava.

Gabriel is a farmer who grows cacao and cassava. He buys his supplies in Mata de Cacao at the end of each month and sells at the fair in Chillanes on Sundays.

Gabriel is requesting a loan to buy supplies for growing cacao and cassava. The assistance from this loan will help him financially to acquire what he needs. His main challenges are pests, diseases, and weather changes. He dreams of continuing with his work and providing his children with an education.

Gabriel enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for growing cacao and cassava.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Urubamba, provincia D. Urubamba, Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Josefina; La socia tiene 65 años D. edad, la socia es casada; la socia tiene 5 hijos (todos ellos independientes), la socia tiene un puesto D. venta en el mercado central D. Urubamba, ella venD. chicha D. maíz, la socia también venD. en su casa los días sábados y domingos por la tarD., la socia nos comenta que ella hace esto para no aburrirse, y que sus hijos le apoyan; la socia comenta que con el crédito que ella saca del banco comunal mediante este medio, la socia pueD. invertir en la compra D. azúcar, arroz, aceite, maíz, entre otros y que con lo que le rinD. ella pueD. pagar sus cuotas mensuales y también sus hijos le dan, La socia desea seguir con su negocio hasta dónD. la fuerza le sea posible D. llevar. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, fideos, maíz.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Josefina is a member of the Communal Bank “Tercer Milenio” (Third Millennium) which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

She is 65 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom are independent. Josefina has a vending stall at the central market in Urubamba where she sells “chicha D. maiz” (a beverage maD. from corn). She also sells from her home on Saturday and Sunday afternoons. Josefina says she works to keep from getting bored and that her children help her. Upon receiving her loan from the Communal Bank, she says she will invest in the purchase of corn, rice, oil, corn, and other products. As a result, she will earn enough to cover her monthly payments and also give some money to her children. Josefina wants to continue her business as long as she has the strength to make it possible. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy rice, sugar, noodles, and corn.

Josefina is happy with the loan being provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase  rice, sugar, noodles, and corn.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SILKINCHANY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de San Jerónimo,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Andrea; la socia tiene 37 años de edad, casada y tiene 5 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de herramientas de agricultura como pico,acha,rastrillos entre otros más para luego venderlo en la feria de todos los sábados de nombre Baratillo en este lugar se vende todo tipo de cosas de segunda mano y cosas nuevas también , hay de todo ,la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo y lleva ya un buen tiempo en este negocio y se siente feliz ya que mediante este negocio ella saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería para su negocio y así tener más herramientas que ofrecer.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Andrea is a member of the Communal Bank “Silkinchany” which is located in the District of San Jerónimo, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 37 years old, married, and has five children. Andrea divides her time between her daily activites and her business of buying and selling farming tools such as picks, axes, rakes, and other implements. She sells her products at the Baratillo Fair every Saturday. In this place, all types of new and secondhand goods are sold. Andrea and her husband work together and have a good time managing their business. She is happy that her family is able to get ahead as a result of this business.

Andrea is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her business so that she can have more tools to offer. She is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: To purchase farming tools to sell.

loans.name: Juan Montalvo

texts.es:
Juan Montalvo C. G. tiene 41 años, vive en Unión Libre con la compañera y con los hijos en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  JUNTOS VENCEREMOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Matilde Esther  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de cacao y yuca.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao y yuca. Compra sus productos en  Mata de Cacao cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos de cacao y yuca.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es construir la vivienda de hormigón para vivir con la familia.

Le gusta hacer deporte
texts.en:
Juan Montalvo C. G. is 41 years old and lives with his common law wife and their child in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar Province.

The members of the Communal Bank “Juntos Venceremos” (Together We Overcome) meet at the fairgrounds of Matilde Esther in the canton of Chillanes. There are twelve members in this Communal Bank, all of whom are devoted to growing cacao and cassava.

Juan is a farmer who grows cacao and cassava. He buys his supplies in Mata de Cacao at the end of each month and sells at the fair in Chillanes on Sundays.

Juan is requesting a loan to buy supplies for growing cacao and cassava. The assistance from this loan will help him financially to acquire what he needs. His main challenges are pests, diseases, and weather changes. He dreams of building a concrete house where he and his family can live.

Juan enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for growing cacao and cassava.

loans.name: Segundo Miguel

texts.es:
Segundo Miguel V. O. tiene 23 años, es soltero vive con los padres en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. No tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  JUNTOS VENCEREMOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Matilde Esther  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de cacao y yuca.

Segundo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao y yuca. Compra sus productos en  Mata de Cacao cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos de cacao y yuca.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando formar una familia y ayudar a los hijos.

Le gusta salir a jugar fútbol con los amigos del recinto.
texts.en:
Segundo Miguel V. O. is 23 years old and lives with his parents in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar Province. He does not have children.

The members of the Communal Bank “Juntos Venceremos” (Together We Overcome) meet at the fairgrounds of Matilde Esther in the canton of Chillanes. There are twelve members in this Communal Bank, all of whom are devoted to growing cacao and cassava.

Segundo is a farmer who grows cacao and cassava. He buys his supplies in Mata de Cacao at the end of each month and sells at the fair in Chillanes on Sundays.

Segundo is requesting a loan to buy supplies for growing cacao and cassava. The assistance from this loan will help him financially to acquire what he needs. His main challenges are pests, diseases, and weather changes. He dreams of continuing his work so that he can start a family and help his future children.

Segundo enjoys playing soccer with his friends.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for growing cacao and cassava.

loans.name: Luz Angelica

texts.es:
Luz Angelica G. B. tiene 62 años, es casada vive con el esposo y los hijos en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 8  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  JUNTOS VENCEREMOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Matilde Esther  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de cacao y yuca.

Luz se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao y yuca. Compra sus productos en  Mata de Cacao cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos de cacao y yuca.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es arreglar la vivienda para los hijos.

Le gusta criar animales en la casa.
texts.en:
Luz Angelica G. B. is 62 years old, married, and lives with her husband and eight children in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar Province.

The members of the Communal Bank “Juntos Venceremos” (Together We Overcome) meet at the fairgrounds of Matilde Esther in the canton of Chillanes. There are twelve members in this Communal Bank, all of whom are devoted to growing cacao and cassava.

Luz is a farmer who grows cacao and cassava. She buys her supplies in Mata de Cacao at the end of each month and sells at the fair in Chillanes on Sundays.

Luz is requesting a loan to buy supplies for growing cacao and cassava. The assistance from this loan will help her financially to acquire what she needs. Her main challenges are pests, diseases, and weather changes. She dreams of remodeling her home for her children.

Luz enjoys raising animals at home.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for growing cacao and cassava.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.fr:
Cliente  de 60 ans célibataire et mère de 3 enfants dont l’âge varie de 22ans à 28ans. 
En 1976 elle se lança dans la fabrication et vente des savons de ménages et ses potentiels clients sont les clients dans les différents marche de la capitale, Ses ventes journalière sont 10000 à 30000 francs.
A l'octroi de son , elle va acheter 250l d'huile de palme, 250l d'huile d'amande douce ,la soude caustique et des parfums a la citronnelle et la vanille .
Son ambition  c'est d'avoir une unité de production de savons et de produit de beauté.
texts.en: This borrower is 60 years old, single and the mother of three children, ranging from 22 to 28 years of age. In 1976, she launched a business producing and selling household soap. Her potential clients are shoppers at the different markets of the capital. Her daily receipts are from 10,000 to 30,000 francs. Thanks to her [loan], she will purchase 250 liters of palm oil, 250 liters of almond oil, caustic soda and lemon and vanilla fragrances. Her long-term goal is to have a studio producing soap and beauty products.

loans.use: to purchase 250 liters of palm oil, 250 liters of almond oil, caustic soda and fragrance

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Urubamba, provincia D. Urubamba, Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Santusa La socia tiene 62 años D. edad, la socia es casada; la socia tiene 5 hijos (aún apoya en los estudios D. la universidad a 2 D. ellos), la socia tiene en su casa un taller pequeño D. costura, ella realiza costuras y composturas, la socia nos comenta que se cayó y está mal del brazo, la socia por el momento no podrá dedicarse a sus costuras hasta que le sané el brazo y nos comenta que su esposo también es socio del banco y los dos están solicitando el préstamo para poder invertir en la educación D. sus hijos, que requieren hacer los pagos D. un nuevo semestre para que ellos estudien, la socia espera recuperarse para volver a su costura y continuar con sus actividades diarias, la socia también comenta que ellos poseen terrenos agrícolas lo cual genera otro ingreso económico. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la educación D. sus hijos.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Santusa is a member of the Communal Bank “Tercer Milenio” (Third Millennium) which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

She is 62 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom she is supporting since they are attending university. Santusa has a small sewing workshop in her home where she stitches and mends. She says that she fell and hurt her arm, so she is not able to sew until her arm heals. Her husband is also a member of the Communal Bank, so the two of them are requesting a loan to invest in the education of their children who need to pay for another semester of studies. Santusa hopes to recover so that she can return to sewing and continue her daily activities. She states that she also owns farmland that is used to generate additional income.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in her children’s education. Santusa is happy with the loan being provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: To invest in her children's education.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SILKINCHANY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de San Jerónimo,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dina; la socia tiene 33 años de edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de riclar ella compra lo que son botellas descartables,papel,botellas entre otros, la socia se metió a este negocio por su tío que le enseño ya anteriormente solo se dedicaba a la crianza de sus hijos ahora ella puede trabajar y así brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos ella trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo ambos están en este negocio del riclaje.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería para reciclar.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Dina is a member of the Communal Bank “Silkinchany” which is located in the District of San Jerónimo, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 33 years old, married, and has four children. Dina divides her time between her daily activities and managing her recycling business in which she buys disposable bottles, paper, and other materials. She started in this business as a result of an uncle who taught her what she needed to know. Dina previously devoted all of her time to raising her children, but now she is able to work and provide them a better quality of life. Both she and her husband work together in their recycling business.

Dina is requesting a loan to buy more materials for recycling. She is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: To purchase scrap materials for recycling.

loans.name: Rodolfo Roberto

texts.es:
Rodolfo Roberto G. Q. tiene 27 años, es soltero vive  con la madre en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. No tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  JUNTOS TRABAJADORES AGRICOLAS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Matilde Esther  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 9 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de cacao, café y naranja.

Rodolfo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, café y naranja. Compra sus productos en  Mata de Cacao cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos de cacao, café y naranja.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir sembrando.

Le gusta la familia por que es muy responsable y trabajadora y le gusta festejar el carnaval.
texts.en:
Rodolfo Roberto G. Q., 27, is single living with his mother in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  He doesn’t have any children.

The JUNTOS TRABAJADORES AGRICOLAS (Agricultural Workers Together) communal bank is located in Matilde Esther which is part of Chillanes canton.  It has nine members who are cocoa bean, coffee and orange farmers.

Rodolfo grows cocoa beans, coffee and oranges.  He buys his supplies in Mata de Cacao at the end of each month and sells at the Chillanes farmers market on Sundays.

He is asking for a loan to buy supplies for his cocoa bean, coffee and orange crops.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  The challenges he faces are infestations, illnesses and weather variations.  His dream is to continue planting.

He enjoys his family because they are responsible and hard working and he enjoys celebrating Carnival.

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SILKINCHANY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de San Jerónimo,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

Vanesa; la socia tiene 21 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 1 hijo por venir tiene 7 meses de embarazo; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de verduras para luego venderlo en el mercado de Huancaro todos los sábados que son de feria y también va a vender a  otros mercados su mercadería  quienes le solicitan, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con un motivo principal para seguir adelante que es su hijo que está por venir ella tiene 7 meses de gestación y aproximadamente para mayo daría a luz, la socia está contenta con su negocio y está trabajando para hacerse de un pequeño capital ya que pronto será mama.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.

The member belongs to the Silkinchany communal bank, located in the San Jerónimo district of the Cusco province in Cusco department.

She is Vanesa, 21, who lives with a common-law husband and has 1 son.  She is also 7 months pregnant. She alternates her daily activities with her business of buying vegetables and then selling them in the Huancaro market every Saturday.  Saturdays are the market day there and she also sells her products in other markets when requested.  Vanesa is a a cheerful person whose main goal is to get ahead for her son and her new baby who will probably be born in May. She is very happy with her business and is working to make some capital since she will soon have another child.

The member is requesting the loan to buy more products for her business.

loans.use: To buy more products for her business

La socia es la Sra: Feliciana La socia tiene 38 años de edad, la socia es casada; la socia tiene 4 hijos (aún apoya en los estudios), la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia vende golosinas en un local independiente en la provincia de Urubamba, ella también vende ropa. La socia alterna entre estas dos ocupaciones para sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella desea el crédito para poder comprar mercadería para sus dos negocios, la socia comprara caramelos, gaseosas, galletas, chocolatillos y otros al por mayor, la socia también comprará ropa de la ciudad de Lima y traerá junto con los productos de golosinas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

Feliciana is a member of the community bank Tercer Milenio [Third Millenium], located in the Urubamba district in the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco.

Feliciana is 38 years old, married, and has four children who are in school.  She works in the retail trade.  She sells candy in a store in the province in Urubamba.  She also sells clothing.  She balances those two jobs in order to help her children succeed.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase merchandise for her two stores.  She is planning to purchase candy, soda, cookies, chocolates, and other items at wholesale.  She will also purchase clothing in the city of Lima and bring it back with the candy products.  Feliciana is asking for this loan to purchase merchandise.

She is happy with the loan provided and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Rosalia; la socia tiene 57 años de edad, viuda y tiene 6 hijo; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de pesacado, machas, camarones entre otros, la socia viaja hasta el distrito de Mollendo provincia de Arequipa para comprar mercadería y venderlo a los mercados donde se encuentran sus clientes, la socia viaja hasta allá no solo por comprar su mercadería sino también porque sus hijos están viviendo en Mollendo y de esta manera ella puede visitarlos tambien,la socia se queda como 15 días en Mollendo y luego retorna a Cusco para vender su mercaderia, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota

Rosalía, 57, is a widow; she has six children.  She alternates her daily chores with a business selling fish, clams and shrimp, among others.  

She travels all the way to Mollendo district in Arequipa province to buy her merchandise to then sell it in the markets where her customers are found.  She travels all that way not just to buy her merchandise but also because her children live in Mollendo and this way she can visit them also.  She stays in Mollendo about two weeks and then returns to Cusco to sell her merchandise.  

She is quite a cheerful person with a strong drive to get ahead.  She is asking for the loan to buy more merchandise for her business.  She is happy with the loan and commits to pay her installments.

loans.use: To buy more seafood.

texts.es:
Lourdes, es separada, tiene 41 años D. edad, 04 hijos en edad escolar; socia D. la alcancìa comunal: " Señor D. Cani Cruz"
Lourdes empezò este negocio D. venta D. ropa por necesidad; ya que se separò D. su esposo hace 3 años, y tuvo que criar y alimentar a 4 niños sola. Lourdes buscò trabajo por varias semanas, pero ya que no contaba con estudios superiores y tampoco tenia experiencia no conseguìa empleo. Asì fuè que viò en la venta D. ropa una oportunidad D. salir adelante. Lourdes reparte ropa a domicilio a sus clientes; ademàs D. las ventas, ella alterna su dia para cobrar y ver los quehaceres D. la casa para no descuidar la educacion D. sus hijos.
El prèstamo otorgado es para comprar otras prendas y tambièn calzado; asì poder incrementar sus ingresos.
(En la fotografìa, Lourdes esta vestida D. pantalòn color celeste y chompa color naranja, y es la tercera D. la izquierda)

Las dos Fotos pequeñas corresponD. a las señoras: (quienes no estuvieron presente en la toma principal)
Carmen Teodora Vichez A. (Foto Pequeña que esta en la parte superior)
Flor D. Maria M. E. (Foto Pequeña que esta en la parte inferior)
texts.en:
Lourdes Rosario A. C., 41, is separated and has four school age children.  She’s a member of the “Señor D. Cani Cruz” communal bank.

Lourdes started a clothing sales business because of need having separated from her husband three years ago; she had to raise and feed four children on her own.  Lourdes looked for work for several weeks but because she hadn’t gone beyond elementary school and also had no experience, she couldn’t find employment.  She saw selling clothes as an opportunity to get ahead.  She home delivers clothes to her customers.  Besides sales, she alternates her days with payment collections and with household chores in order not to neglect her children’s education.

The loan is granted to buy other articles of clothing as well as shoes in order to increase income.

In the photo, Lourdes is wearing sky blue pants and an orange sweater; she’s third from the left.The two small photos correspond to the members who were not present at the time the picture was taken: Carmen Teodora Vichez A. (upper left) and Flor D. Maria M. E. (lower left).

loans.use: To buy other types of clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Deysi Beatriz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Deysi; La socia tiene 31 años de edad, la socia es soltera; y tiene a pequeño hijo, de 6 años de edad; la socia tiene una tienda de abarrotes, la socia también con la ayuda de su padre y su propio esfuerzo más el banco comunal y este modo de trabajo le permitieron comprar dos autos de segunda para hacerlos trabajar en la ruta Cusco Urubamba  y Urubamba Ollantaytambo; como colectivo, la socia desea el crédito en esta oportunidad para comprar llantas para sus autos y hacerles el mantenimiento respectivo, la socia también invertirá un restante en la compra de mercadería para la tienda de abarrotes, la socia apoya a su familia y ellos a ella, ella nos demuestra que el trabajo en equipo y la perseverancia dan frutos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar llantas para sus dos autos y un poco de mercadería para implementar la tienda de abarrotes.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Deysi belongs to the “Tercer Milenio” (Third Milenium) Communal Bank.  This bank is located in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Deysi is 31 years old, single, and has a little six year old son.  She has a grocery store.  Also, her father’s help, her own hard work, her communal bank, and her grocery business have allowed her to buy two second-hand cars.  She puts the cars to work as taxis on the Cusco Urabamba and the Urubamba Ollantaytambo route.

She wants the loan to buy tires for her cars and to perform maintenance on the cars.  She will use the remainder of the loan to buy merchandise for her grocery store.  She supports her family, and they support her.  She shows us that working as a team and perseverance pays off.

She is requesting the loan to buy tires for her two cars and a bit of merchandise for her grocery store. 

She is happy about the loan that was granted, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy tires for her two cars and a bit of merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Mena

texts.en: Mena A. is a palm oil extractor atTakoradi. She has five children. She has been in the production of oil for a decade now. Mena uses her income to feed, educate and clothe her children. The loan will be added to her initial capital to buy more palm fruits to process for sale.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Mena plans to plough back her increased capital. In this picture, on the floor is the chaff from the palm fruit. In the bowl are some palm fruits.

loans.use: to buy more palm fruits to process for sale.

loans.name: Mujeres Loma Group

texts.es:
El comité "Mujeres Loma" está integrado por 15 mujeres muy trabajadoras, la Sra. Cynthia O., presidenta de dicho comité, vive con su marido e hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas desde hace un buen tiempo, desea poder prosperar por eso ayuda a su marido con los ingresos económicos del hogar, pero ahora necesita del crédito para comprar más ropas que luego las estaría vendiendo.
Ella, como las demás integrantes, está muy satisfecha con los créditos y constantes capacitaciones que recibe de la fundación, porque gracias a ello puede ir aumentando sus ingresos y de esa manera ayudar al sustento de su hogar.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Loma Communal Bank is comprised of 15 hard-working women.  Cynthia O. is the president of the communal bank.  She lives with her husband and children.  She has been selling clothes for a good amount of time.  She wants to be able to prosper, so she helps her husband with the household finances.  

However, she now needs a loan to buy more clothes that she will later sell.

She, like the other members, is very happy with the loans and the regular trainings she gets from the foundation.  Thanks to the loan she is able to increase her income.  That way she helps to support her household.

loans.use: to buy clothes like t-shirts, shorts, blouses, shirts, and pants, etc.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet B. cooks varieties of food for sale at Takoradi. She is married to an electrician and has 3 children. As a way of supporting her husband, she contributes to the feeding of the family. Her loan will be used to buy food items to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy food items to expand her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 38 años, es una mujer enérgica y jovial. Vive dichosamente en su casa cedida por su madre con su esposo Javier, de 39 años y sus 3 hijos aún menores y estudiantes, por quienes se esfuerza diariamente. Mientras que sus hijos eran muy pequeños trabajaba sólo su esposo, pero a medida que fueron creciendo sus hijos, el presupuesto familiar no le alcanzaba. En vista de ello, ella quiso trabajar, entonces su esposo le ayuda a comprar un stand para vender sándwich. Desde entonces, hace 3 años vende en la puerta de su casa salchipapas (salchichas, pollos y papas fritas), y le va bien, porque ahora sus hijos no carecen de muchas necesidades. De esta manera está emprendedora mujer trabaja desde las 5 de la tarde hasta terminar de vender todo lo preparado, siendo a las 12 ó 1 de la madrugada, de ese modo no pierde el capital invertido. Esta contenta con su negocio y la utilidades de le brinda, además porque lo realiza sola y eso le hace ser independiente, por ello planea inmediatamente incrementar su negocio con la venta de mates, gaseosas y cervezas. Para el futuro piensa instalar un salón de belleza en el interior de su casa, para que pueda trabajar durante el día. Es el 5to crédito que tiene con MFP, y está agradecida por toda la ayuda que recibió, y se compromete pagar como siempre de manera puntual, para seguir contando con más ayudas que le permitan progresar. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará gaseosas, cervezas y un termo, para vender mates calientes que a veces le piden sus clientes.
texts.en:
María, age 38, is an energetic and jovial person.  She lives happily in the house that her mother gave her.  She lives with her husband, 38 year old Javier, and their three minor children who go to school.  It is for them that she works hard every day.  

When her children were very little only her husband worked.  But, as the children were growing the family budget did not suffice.  In light of that, she wanted to work.  Her husband helped her buy a stand to sell sandwiches.  For three years she has been selling “salchipapas” (sausages, chicken, and French fries) in the doorway to her house.  It is going well for her because now her children are not lacking for much. 

This enterprising woman works from five in the afternoon until she finishes selling everything she has prepared.  This is at 12 or 1 in the morning.  This way she does not lose the money she has invested.  She is happy with her business and the profits it provides.  She is also happy because she works alone, and that makes her independent.

Her immediate plan is to increase her business by selling infusions, soft drinks, and beer.  In the future she plans to set up a beauty salon in her house so that she will be able to work during the day.

This is her fifth loan with MFP.  She is grateful for all of the help that she has received.  She pledges to always make her payments on time.  She will do this to continue counting on more help, which will allow her to progress.

She will use the loan she is requesting to buy soft drinks, beer, and a thermos in order to sell hot drinks that her customers sometimes request.

loans.use: to stock up on soft drinks and beer and to buy a thermos in order to sell hot drinks to her customers

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary B. prepares smoked fish for sale at Takoradi. Mary is married and has 7 children. Her husband is a commercial driver. Mary has been selling smoked fish for 20 years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to smoke for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children. 
She is showing a piece of the fish she will be smoking.

loans.use: to buy more fish to smoke for sale.

loans.name: A. Jameela

texts.en: A.Jameela N. has one child. She sells fresh fish and provisions at Takoradi, which she has been doing for 11 years. Her husband is a welder. She assists her husband with household expenses. A loan will help her supply her customers with the things they request. She would like to expand her business with the increase in capital.

loans.use: to supply her customers with the things they request.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 31-year-old mother of three. She lives and works in Sderot. In June of 2010, Marilyn opened her business, which involves educational and entertainment activities with animals for young children. Marilyn has created a strong following of clients and works in two major nursery school systems in her city. She also provides birthday party activities. Marilyn decided to open a class with young children this year. In order to open the class, she needs additional equipment and small cosmetic renovation of her balcony.

Marilyn needs the loan to purchase equipment and additional animals for the activities as well as paints and renovation supplies for her enclosed balcony where she is holding the classes.

The weekly classes will provide a steady supplement to Marylyn's income as opposed to being dependent on school and birthday celebrations. Marilyn wants to see her business continue to expand and strengthen. Eventually she would like to hire two staff people and part-time activity coordinators to help her reach more clients.

loans.use: to purchase equipment, animals, paints and renovation supplies

loans.name: Kamla

texts.en:
Kamla is a 43-year-old mother of seven with an elementary school education. She dreamed of opening a business and being able to earn a living. Kamla always had strong skills in sewing and alterations. She loved to design dresses and children's clothes. Three years ago, Kamla gained business training and opened her business.

She needs this loan to purchase an additional sewing machine that allows specialty sewing for button holes, zippers and other designs. Kamla also purchased additional cloth and fabric.

Kamla wants to expand her business first in a larger room she has set aside at home but in the future she wants to open a shop and sell near the market in her city.

loans.use: to purchase an additional sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to update and purchase her photography & video equipment and a rolling cart for equipment transport.

loans.name: Priel

texts.en:
For reasons of modesty, Priel's son is pictured in the photo. Priel is a 43-year-old mother of seven with an elementary school education. She worked as a part-time helper in daycare centers but wanted to create a better future and decided she could create more income through her own business. She began selling household supplies and basic amenities. Eventually, through training and support, she opened a small minimarket at her home.

Priel needed the loan to increase her store's supplies and buy stock including dry goods, perishables, drinks and specialty items her customers wanted.

Priel dreams of expanding her minimarket and one day opening a supermarket that is sorely needed in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to increase her store's supplies and buy stock

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Ysabel; La socia tiene 51 años de edad, la socia es casada; y tiene 3 hijos (30,25,24) años de edad, la socia tiene un cafetín en su casa en el primer piso, y la socia tiene pensado implementar el cafetín y ponerlo simpático, ella requiere el préstamo para poder implementar el negocio y aumentar sus ventas, la socia desea el préstamo para implementar el cafetín.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Ysabel is a member of the community bank “TERCER MILENIO” in Urubamba Province, Cusco.  She is 51, married and has three children (ages 30,25,24).  She runs a small cafe out of the first floor of her home, which she would like to expand and make more attractive in order to increase sales.  For this reason she seeks a loan, which she is committed to repaying according to the required timeframe and conditions.

loans.use: to expand and better equip her cafe

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Luis S. tiene 32 años de edad, es separado y vive en el centro de la ciudad de Caacupe, distante a unos 60 kilómetros de la ciudad capital (Asunción). Tiene 2 hijos y 1 hija (todos en edad escolar).
El señor Luis S. posee en su domicilio una pescadería desde hace 2 años.
Don Luis solicita el crédito para la compra de un cogelador para almacenar los pescados, ya que de esa manera podrá adquirir mayor cantidad de productos y mantenerlos frescos hasta el final de sus ventas.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva el apoyo obtenido para su actividad, ya que mediante ello podrá  ofrecer a su clientela un buen servicio y el mejor producto del mercado.
texts.en:
Luis is 32 years old, separated from his wife, and lives in the center of the city of Caacupe, some 60 kilometers from the capital city of Asuncion.  He has 2 boys and 1 girl, all of school age.

Luis has operated a fish store from his home for 2 years.  He requests a loan to buy a freezer for storing fish.  With this, he will be able to acquire a larger quantity of fish and keep them fresher until final sale.

Luis is grateful to the Paraguay Foundation and Kiva for their help with his activity, because by this means he will be able to offer his clientèle good service and the best product on the market.

loans.use: TO BUY A FREEZER FOR HIS FISH SELLING BUSINESS

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta: Violeta; La socia tiene 28 años de edad, la socia es soltera; La socia es profesora de profesión, ella trabaja en un colegio y la socia a encontrado la manera de alternar su trabajo con otro, ella también es proveedora de instrumentos odontológicos, la socia tiene un cuñado que es odontólogo y debido a que el trabaja en su consultorio y está muy ocupado ella le trae de Cusco los instrumentos y los materiales odontológicos que el requiere y de este modo ella pasa a ser su proveedora, la socia es una joven es una mujer muy trabajadora y con muy buenas ideas del futuro, ella por ahora desea el crédito para poder hacer de este un capital de trabajo y de este modo seguir ahorrando su dinero para comprar sus cosas poco a poco; La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales odontológicos.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the community bank “TERCER MILENIO,” located in Urubamba Province, Cusco.
Violeta is 28, single, and an educator by profession.  She works in a school full time, but also maintains a side job selling dental instruments, as her brother-in-law is a dental surgeon and she assists him buy purchasing dental instruments in Cusco and has become the main supplier for his business.  Violeta is young and a hard worker with many aspirations.  In the near term, she wants to gather capital to continue purchasing materials, and this loan will allow her to buy a stock of dental instruments for resale. She is committed to prompt repayment of the credit according to the terms of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase dental materials to supply local business

loans.name: Donald Isaac

texts.es:
Donald, 26 años de edad, casado, es originario del departamento de Estelí, de oficio transportista lleva 5 años en este negocio. Inicio cuando tenia 20 años en ese entonces el estaba comenzando asistir a la universidad pero debido a  problemas económicos no pudor seguir estudiando la carrera de Agronomía, tuvo que trabajar con su padre para ayudar con los gastos. Su papa le enseño el oficio de transportista le enseño a manejar camiones, en los cuales transporta materiales de construcción, frutas verduras, alimento para animales etc. Hoy en día tiene su camión propio el cual le pertenecía a su papa pero el se lo compro y se lo fue  pagando poco a poco hasta que lo cancelo y es su herramienta de trabajo con el que trabaja en la actualidad.
Solicita el crédito es para comprar un juego de  llantas para el camión el cual tiene capacidad de 8 toneladas. 
Este crédito le ayudara de gran manera ya que podrá transportar su carga más segura y las entregas mas rápidas. Dentro de sus planes futuros esta tener su propia empresa de transporte donde puedan atender abastecer mas rutas de trabajo alrededor de los municipios de Estelí. Como meta próxima tiene comprar otro camión de carga pesada.
texts.en: Donald is 26, married and lives in Estelí.  He is a truck driver and has worked in this trade for five years. At the age of 20, after starting a university program in agronomy, Donald had to discontinue his studies in order to assist his father in providing for the family. His father taught him to drive trucks, to transport construction materials, produce, animal feed, etc.  He now owns his own truck, which he was able to purchase from his father and is now fully paid off.  The truck is now his main income source. Donald is seeking a loan to buy a new set of tires for the truck so that he can carry up to 8 tons of cargo, which will help him transport goods more safely and quickly.  In the future, he hopes to expand his distribution network to include other municipalities of Estelí, and hopes to buy an additional truck to acheive this goal.

loans.use: to buy a set of truck tires

loans.name: Kelly Elizabeth

texts.es:
Kelly, de 29 años de edad, es originaria del departamento de Estelí, esta casada , es madre de 3 hijos , se dedica a atender una pulpería de la cual ella es la dueña lleva año y medio en este negocio. Primeramente la pulpería era de su madre y después se la dejo a ella para que trabajara, anterior a este trabajo, ella era administradora de una disco móvil pero después decido independizarse y tener su propio negocio, el cual se encuentra localizado en el barrio donde habita ella. Ella vende productos tales como pan, tortilla, arroz, azúcar, etc. En la pulpería la apoya su esposo quien le ayuda a realizar las compras y atender a los clientes. 
Solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite y otros productos perecederos, también desea comprar gas para vender. Este crédito le ayudara a incrementar sus ventas al comprar más producto para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, obtener nueva clientela y aumentar sus ganancias para invertir en el negocio. 
Sus planes futuros son preparar a sus hijos para que estudien una carrera profesional ya que tiene a dos de sus hijos en la secundaria y al menor en tercer grado de primaria eso es primordial en su vida. Una de sus metas  es poner un puesto de gas butano.
texts.en:
Kelly is 29 and lives in Estelí.  She is married, the mother of three children, and has maintained a small food store for the past year and a half. The store had been run by her mother but Kelly now manages it full time, having left her job as manager of a discoteque.  The store is located in her neighborhood and sells basic products such as bread, tortillas, rice, sugar, etc.  Her husband helps her with the day to day tasks of the business. 
Kelly is seeking a loan to purchase additional inventory of food items as well as cooking gas.  This credit will allow her to expand her sales, meet increasing demand by clients for food products and will allow her to invest more profits into growing the business.  Her future plans include providing an education for her children, two of which are in high school and the youngest is in third grade.  Another goal of hers is to begin selling butane gas.

loans.use: To buy inventory of basic food items such as rice, sugar, cooking oil and others

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: For 3 years, Elizabeth M. has been selling gari (made from cassava), and bags of charcoal at Nkroful, near Takoradi. She is showing the gari she sells. Elizabeth lives with her husband and assists him in taking care of the home. The loan will be used to expand her gari business and also to purchase extra bags of charcoal to sell.  She plans to reinvest her new profits.

loans.use: to expand her gari business and also to purchase extra bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta: Isidora; La socia tiene 38 años de edad, la socia es conviviente; La socia tiene 1 hijo de 19 años de edad;  la socia trabaja haciendo contratas de comidas, ella ofrece sus diversos menús y según la lista de sus contratistas ella provee los diferentes platos que ella misma elabora, la socia trabaja de manera independiente, ella es muy solicitada ya que cocina muy rico; la socia trabaja con este banco de forma puntual y organizada, ella con los créditos que solicita del banco comunal mediante este medio, invierte en la compra de insumos, la socia compra los insumos al por mayor, esta vez la socia solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de arroz, aceite, fideos al por mayor para que pueda seguir elaborando sus comidas y de este modo seguir creciendo económicamente para bien propio y de sus seres queridos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de arroz, aceite, fideos entre otros.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Srta. Isidora is a member of the communal bank "Tercer Milenio".  The bank is located in the Urubamba district, in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.  She is 38 years old, lives with her common law partner and has a son that is 19 years old.  She works as a caterer offering her customers diverse menus and various dishes that she makes herself.  She works independently and, because of her delicious food, her services are in high demand.  

She is working with this bank in a timely and organized manner.  She uses the loans that she requests from the communal bank to buy raw materials wholesale.  This time she is requesting a loan to purchase rice, oil, and noodles wholesale so that she can continue making her food and continue to grow financially for her own well-being and that of her loved ones.  She is happy with the loan granted and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil and noodles for her catering business.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua D. is married and has 5 children. Efua produces coconut oil for sale. She also smokes fish for sale. She has been doing this for ten years.  She is standing by the coconut husks that are used as a source of fuel for the oil production at Takoradi. Her husband is unemployed and, as a result, the household responsibility is borne by her. She is asking for a loan to enable her expand her business so she can provide for her family. 
At the time of the visit, she had run out of coconuts and so had to stand by the coconut husks.

loans.use: to enable her expand her business so she can provide for her family.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte A. lives with her 3 children and husband. She has received a junior high level of education. Charlotte sells jewelry and cosmetics at Takoradi, which she has been doing for just a year. Her husband is a manual worker. Charlotte uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Charlotte will use the loan to acquire a kiosk to sell her things in. With the new profits from her expanded business, Charlotte plans to fully fill the shop with cosmetics.

loans.use: to acquire a kiosk in which to sell her things.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi M. is a widow and has five children. Educated up to senior high school, Esi is the sole breadwinner for her family.
For the past six years, she has been selling plantain and cassava, popular essentials to the Ghanaian diet, in the Jukwa Market near Abura, Cape Coast. 

She intends to expand her business with her loan, which will be used to purchase more cassava and plantain to boost her sales. Any additional profits she makes will be saved up for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava and plantain.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia A. is married to a farmer, and they have two children. Educated up to junior high school, Afia has spent the past six years selling kenkey, a staple in the Ghanaian diet made of fermented maize dough, in the Jukwa Market (near Abura in Cape Coast). 
Afia’s family relies on her income to pay for school fees and household utilities. She is keen to expand her business with the loan, which she’ll use to purchase more maize to increase the production of kenkey. She plans to save up the extra profits she makes.

loans.use: to purchase more maize to increase the production of kenkey.

loans.name: Gerardo Rubén

texts.es:
El Sr. Gerardo Rubén tiene 24 años, su pareja es la Srta. Sandra Beatriz Samudio de 20 años, viven en casa propia en el barrio San Blás de Caacupé, distante 52 km de la capital del País.
El sr. Gerardo Rubén se dedica a la compra-venta de queso paraguay, insumo principal para la producción de la chipa, cada día sale al interior del país a buscar donde conseguir buenos precios, lo que hace que obtenga un buen margen de utilidad.
Con el crédito de la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva obtendrá mayor movimiento de su negocio y cubrir la demanda de su clientela, con ello mejorará sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rubén is 24 years old; his partner is Miss Sandra Beatriz Samudio, 20 years old.  They live in their own home, in the San Blás section of Caacupé, 52 km. from the capital.
Rubén buys and sells Paraguayan cheese, the principal ingredient used to produce chipa.  Every day he travels to the rural areas to find places that offer good prices, which enables him to enjoy a good profit margin.
With the loan from the Paraguayan Foundation and Kiva, he will increase business activity and satisfy his customers’ needs, and thereby improve his income and his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy chese for resale

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa M. is a palm oil seller at the Jukwa Market in Abura, Cape Coast. She also sells food items, such as okra and tomatoes. She has been in this trade for four years and is now keen to expand her business. She intends to use the loan to purchase more food items to increase her sales. 
Her income helps support her family – she has four children and is married to a farmer. Her earnings help pay for school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: to purchase more food items and increase her sales.
